description:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.

Materials Engineer (Avionics)

Responsibilities:
Lead design decisions related to selection of materials and processes for space applications
Generate and execute test plans and review materials for compliance to internal requirements or to industry standards
Support drawing and specification review
Develop and qualify new materials and processes in the areas of soldering, PCB/PCBA and conformal coating
Work with supplier quality to identify qualified vendors and test houses to perform testing and manufacturing
Assist in failure analysis and implement corrective actions based on findings using standardized analysis techniques

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science, Materials Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Physics or Electrical Engineering
2+ years of professional experience with electronic materials

Preferred Skills and Experience:
Master’s degree in Materials Science, Materials Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Physics or Electrical Engineering
Experience with RF transparent materials
Experience with encapsulants, solders, printed wiring board materials and conformal coating
Extensive experience with the manufacture and assembly of electronic printed circuit boards
Knowledge of Surface Mount Technology (SMT) processes, such as solder paste deposition, surface mount pick and place, vapor phase solder reflow and aqueous cleaning
Extensive knowledge of printed circuit board materials and polymeric materials associated with their assembly
Experience with lead forming tooling and lead plating
Able to perform technical analysis to determine root cause and corrective actions related to SMT manufacturing process issues
Experience with lead free components and processes
Knowledge of IPC-J-STD-001 Class 3, NASA-STD-8739 series, IPC-STD-2222 Class 3, IPC-STD-6012 Class 3, or industry equivalent
Experience with destructive physical analysis of components and piece part failure modes
Capable of operating with considerable independence while also understanding when it is necessary to confer with cross department engineering and production leads to resolve more complex issues
Strong work ethic and self-starter
Able to work in a team environment with good communication skills
Able to effectively manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously, while meeting deadlines

ITAR Requirements:
To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about ITAR here .
SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.
Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a data center facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.

The Failure Analysis and Materials lab within the Reliability Engineering department conducts investigations into failed materials, components, assemblies and products during development, production and use for multiple groups within Hardware. The lab uses its state of the art facilities and equipment to study the characteristics of materials and their failure mechanisms. Lab personnel work closely with product teams and other cross-functional teams to drive corrective actions within Hardware and within the supply chain.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Consumer Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Consumer Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

Responsibilities
  • Investigate failures, identify root cause and work to drive corrective actions with product teams.
  • Develop novel methods for analysis using in-house equipment which reduce cost and improve turnaround time of investigations
  • Use materials expertise to help select materials and specify testing for materials qualification
  • Work with partners/vendors/internal teams to develop best-in-class materials for product teams
  • Take hands-on ownership of laboratory and analytical equipment

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • PhD in Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, with a focus on experimental work or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of industrial experience in one of the following industries: medical devices, consumer goods/products, aerospace/defense, consumer electronics, semiconductors, display/lighting, solar, chemicals, or oil and gas
  • Experience in a technical/engineering role which focused on materials engineering, design, design validation, product development, field testing, failure analysis, reliability, or equivalent.
  • Experience in 2 of the following scientific instruments and/or disciplines: Electron Microscopy, Fracture Mechanics/Fractography, Finite Element Analysis, Computed Tomography X-Ray, Scanning Probe Microscopy, Thermal Analysis, Analytical Chemistry

Preferred qualifications:
  • Programming experience in 2 or more of the following languages: MATLAB, Python, R, JavaScript, C/C++. Experience related to developing experimental automation, instrument control, data analysis tools, numerical simulations or statistical analyses.
  • Experience working in a production environment
  • Experience working at multiple stages in the product lifecycle
  • Capable of influencing teams indirectly through timely, accurate and powerful analysis
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Willing to travel up to 10% of the time, including international travel
title: Reliability Engineer, Failure Analysis and Materials Lab

description: SanDisk®, a Western Digital brand, has been expanding the possibilities of data storage for more than 25 years—giving businesses and consumers the peace of mind that comes from knowing their data is readily available and reliable, even in the most challenging environments. Our products are used in the world's leading-edge data centers, embedded in game-changing smartphones, tablets, and laptops, and entrusted by consumers around the world. As a vertically-integrated storage solution company, we are able to quickly deliver innovative, high-quality solutions with less time from research to realization. From mobile devices to hyperscale data centers, SanDisk storage solutions make the incredible possible.

description:
Founded in 1998, Otter Products has become a global innovator of premium protective solutions for smartphone and tablet devices. At Otter Products, “We Grow to Give.” The company’s success is measured by this mission and brought to life through the OtterCares Foundation. A seven-time honoree on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies in the U.S., Otter Products was also named one of “America’s Most Promising Companies” by Forbes Magazine and one of the "Healthiest Companies to Work for in America" by Greatist. The company is headquartered in Fort Collins, Colo., with offices in San Diego; Cork, Ireland; and Hong Kong.

Otter Products is looking to hire a top-notch Product Testing Engineer in our San Diego office. The Product Testing Team plays a key role to ensure quality of Otter Products core products and new technologies through testing. This individual will work closely with the cross-functional product development teams to facilitate product testing to internal and external performance/quality requirements. The Product Test Engineer is responsible for understanding and interpreting test requirement, designing and executing test plans accordingly, researching and developing test methods, establishing test protocols and their associated work instructions, analyzing test results and data, making determinations of pass/fail criteria, and communicating results.

The ideal candidate will have advanced mechanical testing experience in the consumer products industry. We need someone with an excellent understanding of materials science and mechanics of materials. A strong understanding of manufacturing processes are a must in this role as well, experience working with manufacturing processes with injection molded products is highly desirable. Do you enjoy providing exceptional customer service to internal and external customers? Do you love solving problems? Do you have an out of this world product testing background? If so, this might be the role for you!

Responsibilities:
  • Manage testing needs for core product, future product Series, and technical development activities.
  • Create and execute Design Validation Test (DVT) plans
  • Support all of the organization’s product testing needs including (but not limited to): Fit and function compatibility, shock and drop, environmental exposure, water and dust ingress, mechanical cycling, material property testing
  • Procure, design, and implement improvements/modifications to test fixtures
  • Determine materials used in a part or assembly and utilize published technical data for these materials
  • Understand how manufacturing methods may impact the quality of the final part/assembly and look for defects inherent to the manufacturing process
  • Gather feedback from tooling and manufacturing engineers for product quality issues, and provide recommendations to design engineers to reduce quality risks
  • Work with 3 rd -party accredited test laboratories
  • Read, interpret, apply, refine, and define internal standards
  • Research and apply industry standards (e.g., MIL-STD, ASTM, ISO, ISTA) to Otter Products testing needs
  • Inspect, diagnose, retrofit and install mechanical systems of moderate complexity
  • Obtain product requirements, consults on product specifications, and create testing methods to meet those specifications
  • Troubleshoot and analyze failures and make suggestions for corrective action
  • Use statistical software (e.g., Minitab) to analyze data and present results
  • Ensure compliance with test, safety and security procedures
  • Generate accurate, clear, and concise test reports and provide timely updates of testing results to the product design team
  • Follows appropriate documentation procedures in daily work
  • Use excellent verbal and written communication to convey all aspects of testing
  • Present very complex information in a concise manner so that it can be understood by non-technical personnel
  • Provide outstanding customer service to internal and external customers
  • Work well with teams but also individually with minimal supervision
  • Adapt to changing priorities
  • Demonstrate technical leadership
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications:
  • Bachelors of Science in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) or related engineering degree required. Experience in lieu of degree may be considered.
  • Minimum six years of consumer product testing experience required. Applicable engineering experience preferred.
  • Experience using SolidWorks or other 3D CAD software required
  • Ability to travel up to 10% of the time (domestic and international)

Otter Products is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (EEOC)

description:
Who we are:
EMD Performance Materials, the North American high-tech materials brand of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, comprises a portfolio for applications in fields such as consumer electronics, lighting, coatings, printing technology, plastics, and cosmetics. Key products are: display materials, LED materials for lighting as well as OLED materials for lighting and displays, functional materials for solar panels and energy solutions, effect pigments as well as active ingredients and fillers for cosmetics, food and pharmaceutical products, effect pigments and functional materials for coatings, printing and plastics and high-purity specialty chemical materials for the electronics and semiconductor industry and is currently working on innovative materials for technologies that enable solar energy to be used efficiently and energy-saving LEDs and OLEDs to be developed.

Your role:
EMD Performance Materials is searching for a Material Scientist within our Ormet paste business supporting our conductive paste projects. We are seeking a highly motivated and creative individual with a strong scientific background and hands-on experience in metallurgy, solder paste, sintering and/or applications engineering for implementing such pastes. The person in this role will be responsible for developing and testing new formulations as well as devising application-specific test vehicles to validate that key requirements are met. In addition, this scientist will be responsible for performing research to design innovative formulation concepts in-line with customersâ requirements for sintering pastes, run tests and studies. The candidate will be part of the highly talented multi-disciplinary R&D; team of Ormet in San Diego.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following, other duties may be assigned.

Develop thorough understanding of the material, customer requirements and support our R&D; directors in developing new products to create profitable growth for the Ormet business platform.

Develop new material formulations and support various R&D; projects, run experiments and evaluate results.

Contribute to the generation of Intellectual Properties.

Contribute to the evaluation of competitor landscape.

Work independently on the design, execution, and interpretation of experimental results.

Maintain accurate and timely records of experimental designs, assay development, experimental results, and data analysis.

Support strategy for optimization of material development as needed.

Your possibilities to develop in our growing company are just as manifold as our product portfolio.

Who you are:
PhD in Chemistry, Metallurgy or Materials Science with 0-5 years of experience in an appropriate technical or scientific discipline; or BS in Chemistry, Metallurgy or Materials Science with >10 years of experience in electronic packaging.

Hands-on experience in sintering technologies and formulation.

Must be able to work on assigned projects independently and to complete projects of high quality in a timely manner.

Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze, troubleshoot and overcome technical hurdles independently and methodically with minimal guidance.

Significant understanding of the electronics industry, and specific experience in this area is particularly desirable.

Understanding of Design of Experiments methodologies, and experience analyzing data using statistical analysis tools.

Detail-oriented with good time management skills.

Ability to stay proactive and cooperative working in a small team environment.

The ability to communicate fluently in English is essential.

Regular international travel is required, with total travel time no more than 20%

Strong presentation and written and verbal communication skills

Effective computer skills in Microsoft Office suite, and e-mail/calendaring database systems, such as Outlook are preferred.

What we offer:
Your possibilities to develop in our growing company are just as manifold as our product portfolio. We offer a modern and international working environment to unleash your innovative potential in diverse teams, and take responsibility for our employees, products, the environment and society.

Curious? Apply and find more information at come2emd.com

The Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. No employee or applicant for employment will be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, transgender status, marital status, or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This policy of Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all policies and programs relating to recruitment and hiring, promotion, compensation, benefits, discipline, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment. Any applicant or employee who believes they have been discriminated against by the Company or anyone acting on behalf of the Company must report any concerns to his/her Human Resources Business Partner, Legal, or Compliance immediately. The Company will not retaliate against any individual because he/she made a good faith report of discrimination.

description:
The person is responsible to provide high level applications support of complex measurement systems used in manufacture semiconductor devices/integrated circuits. The Engineer will work in Nanometricsâ HQ in Milpitas, CA and support customers worldwide. Travel to domestic and international customer sites is required.
The selected applicant will have the opportunity to work closely with process engineers in Semiconductor Fab to provide Metrology solutions for complex multi-layer thin film measurements and Optical Critical Dimension measurements for most advanced technology nodes. Duties will include characterization of cutting edge measurement technologies, technical paper publications, making technology / product presentations and technical training for customers.
Ph.D. in Materials Science, Physics, Chemistry, Electrical or Chemical Engineering
  • Experience with statistics/data analysis/fitting concept software
  • Ability to systemically troubleshoot problems to root cause and identify and thoroughly test solutions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Possess good interpersonal skills and willing to work in a team environment.
  • Excellent Project and Time management skills.
  • Ph.D Materials Science/Elect Eng/Applied Physics/Chemical Eng
  • Ability to travel up to 50% of the time
  • The Applications Scientist is the primary technical contact for Nanometrics customers and provides technical support and application development for customers as well as working with the Nanometrics engineering team in product development.
  • The position involves working with customers and customer samples to develop novel metrology strategies on our UniFire interferometer platform for the customersâ leading edge process technologies.
  • The selected applicant will have the opportunity to work closely with Process Engineers in semiconductor and data storage fabs to develop innovative metrology solutions for complex materials and structures.
  • There will be approximately 25% travel required, both domestic and international.
  • The successful applicant will have strong technical skills, and be self-motivated and energetic.
  • Establish and maintain a strong technical knowledge of Nanometrics UniFire products and their applications.
  • Support customers in adopting Nanometrics UniFire products through effective demonstration and recipe development in customer facilities.
  • Work with internal Nanometrics experts to troubleshoot and resolve any and all field product performance issues where feasible.
  • Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of customer application requirements for the UniFire product line.
  • Provide technical support to customers, develop and maintain a positive relationship with customers.
  • Support customer sustaining engineering activities, including qualification requirements.
  • Assist and consult with customers on creating and optimizing applications.
  • Coordinate with Engineering and Marketing on customer requirements and product development.
  • Help to maintain and increase product usage, and supports sales efforts through technical presentations and demonstrations.
  • Initiate, develop, and test new metrology applications.
  • Other duties as required.
  • Good data analysis, signal processing, and some programming skills. Knowledge of ellipsometry, optics, optical properties of materials, and/or thin films preferred. Experience developing mathematical models a plus. Ability to write technical publications and make technology/product presentations. Good organization and solid communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Ph.D. or equivalent in Physics, Materials Science, Engineering, or a related field.
title: Application Scientist

description:
Winslow Automation, Inc. / SIX SIGMA , an industry leader in electronic component soldering and other packaging services, is seeking a creative, mechanically inclined and quality conscious individual to join our team in Milpitas, CA.

We are currently hiring Materials Engineer (for Pinstock Wire)

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Optimize critical material manufacturing process to produce defect-free material to maximize related services yield
  • Provide hands-on technical support to production
  • Implement SPC and other tools to minimize testing costs
  • Train others on proper equipment setup and operation
  • Generate and update work instructions
  • Work with maintenance to ensure proper preventive maintenance and repair procedures are developed and followed
  • Improve material manufacturing processes by designing and conducting experiments, applying scientific knowledge, and soliciting observations from operators
  • Determine critical process variations and implement controls
  • Improve process by analyzing related yields
  • Assure product and process quality by designing appropriate test methods
  • Use statistical tools to determine and optimize process capabilities
  • Conduct engineering studies (including failure analysis) and prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
  • Review test reports
  • Verify test failures
  • Continuously improve productivity and efficiency of existing test services
  • Work with column attach engineer to improve yield on both areas
  • Work with suppliers to ensure material-related issues are resolved
  • Serve as the company's technical resource for critical material and related manufacturing process
  • Mentor, train, and provide technical leadership to engineers, technicians, and others
  • Develop, improve, document, and monitor testing processes and inspection criteria, including:
  • Solder Wire and Pin Pull
  • Physical Dimensions
  • Ionic Conductivity
  • Solderability
  • X-Ray Fluorescence (XRF)

Ideal Candidate will have the following qualifications:

  • B.S. in Mechanical Engineering (preferred), Materials Science, or Applied Physics
  • Some industry experience a plus
  • Solid understanding of the theories and applications of materials properties, metallurgy, intermetallic, ionic chromatography, metrology, thermodynamics, and GD&T; standards
  • Skilled in appropriate and accurate use of measurement toolsets (e.g., force gauge, caliper, micrometer, optical comparator, reticle, toolmakers microscope)
  • Experienced in appropriate and accurate use of DOE, FMEA, and Statistical Process Control (SPC) techniques
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Technically astute
  • Effective, logical problem solving skills
  • Experience writing clear, concise, and accurate technical reports
  • Effective interpersonal skills
  • Skilled in effective organization and project management
  • Detail-oriented
  • Fast learner, self-motivated, and accomplishment driven
  • Works well under pressure
  • Skilled in safe chemical handling procedures
  • Skilled in use of MS Office computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
  • Skilled in use of general office equipment (multi-line PBX phone, voice mail, scanners, faxes, copiers)
  • Valid Driver's License (C Class) with a clean motor vehicle report (MVR); automobile in good operating condition and on-going proof of insurance required
  • Experience or ability to train others a plus
  • Work ing knowledge of microelectronics packaging, lead finish, solders, solder defects, and fluxes a plus
  • Working knowledge of mechanization, robotics, and electro-mechanical equipment a plus
  • Knowledge in appropriate and accurate setup and operation of lab equipment (e.g., Pull Tester ,cross-sectioning , thermocouples, Ionic Cleanliness testers, XRF, measuring machine (CMM), digital camera) a plus
  • Knowledge of the technical theories that provide the basis of the lab equipment functionality a plus
  • Knowledge of and experience in application of test and procedure revision control a plus
  • Knowledge of and experience in application of ESD, FOO, and 5S a plus
  • Knowledge of and experience in application of AS9100 or ISO 9000 a plus
  • Knowledge of and experience in application of JEDEC, EIA, Mil-Std-883, and Mil-PRF-38535 a plus
  • Multilingual in Spanish, Cantonese, Japanese, French, or Tagalog a plus

Employees enjoy:

  • 401(k)
  • Profit Sharing
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • FSA (Flexible Spending Account)
  • Life Insurance and Long-term Disability
  • Paid Holidays & FTO (Flexible time off)

Email resume or you may also come in to fill out an application at 905 Montague Expressway Milpitas, CA 95035; or visit http://www.winslowautomation.com.

This position requires handling of product or information which is subject to ITAR regulations. Applicants must be either a U.S. citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. a Green Card Holder), Political Asylee, or Refugee.

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Manufacturing in semicondutor industry: 2 years
  • mechanical or materials engineer: 1 year

description:
Align Technology is the industry leader and innovator in medical devices which focuses on revolutionizing the digital dental and orthodontics’ practice. Align Technology is looking for a Materials Engineer for our San Jose, CA office. This exciting new role would be part of a culture that is helping to improve lives every day through digital dentistry.

The Materials Engineer candidate will have exceptional skills with different materials like polymers or ceramics . This role will be part of the Align Technology goal to deliver our clear aligners (Invisalign®) 3D scanners (iTero®) to our customer.

Job Description:

The Materials Engineer will be a key member of the R&D; Materials Engineering team. He/she will be responsible for planning and executing projects that focus on new product development, as well as improving Align's existing products. The ideal candidate will have a background in new material development especially in the area of thermoplastics, coating and adhesive, and/or thermoset materials.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop and guide new product development from "start" to "finish."
  • Visit outside manufacturing vendors (e.g., 3rd party vendors, etc.) to guide process development activities related to new product development, process improvements or new equipment evaluation.
  • Work cross-functionally with the following organizations: Manufacturing, Clinical Research, Marketing, Operations, Regulatory and Legal.
  • Design products based on the following materials: polymers, composites, plastics, ceramic, metals and adhesives.
  • Work independently at the laboratory bench to develop and evaluate new products or to adapt and improve existing ones.
  • Select, design and evaluate a variety of materials (e.g., thermoplastics, elastomers, composites, adhesives, etc.) to determine the best combination of materials for specific application.
  • Direct lab bench work for product development and physical property testing duties.
  • Must demonstrate ability to work safely in a team environment.
  • Interface with a variety of internal stakeholders, external suppliers, and technical collaborators to deliver technical solutions.
  • Support product development teams working toward the development of new products.
  • Prioritize and meet deadlines and construct project timetables.
  • Prepare written reports summarizing key findings.
  • Identify and implement effective courses of action.
  • Coach, motivate, and mentor Jr. engineer and lab technicians when needed.
  • Experience of physical-chemical processes and methods of materials characterization.
  • Familiarity with polymer characterization methods (mechanical testing, thermal analysis, rheology, spectroscopy and the underlying theory).
  • Must have the ability to apply results to product performance metrics.
  • Ability to work on several projects simultaneously as well as participate on cross functional teams.
  • Ability to work on projects that vary from routine to very complex.
  • Ability to deal tactfully with others. Must be a strong team player.
Requirements:
  • M.S, or Ph.D. degree or equivalent in Polymer Science or Materials Science or Chemical Engineering or related field.
  • 5+ years working experience in material research and development, depending on level of education.
Nice to Have:
  • Experience with medical device development life cycle and regulatory requirements
  • Photochemistry, Lasers or UV curing processes and resin materials development
Travel:

Up to 10% including international and US-based

title: Postdoctoral Research Staff Member

description:
Job Description

SmartFoam is seeking an entrepreneurially minded materials and device design engineer to join their growing team. Under the guidance of senior research management, the materials and device engineer will design and fabricate smart piezoelectric foam materials to be used in a variety of products including athletic footwear, bedding, electronics, automotive, furniture, and packaging. The individual will be involved with the synthesis of piezoelectric micro- and nanoparticles, the infusion of the piezoelectrics into polymeric carriers, characterizing the electrical/mechanical properties of the materials, fabricating prototype devices, and scaling up the fabrication process. This is a full-time position that will be carried-out in an office and laboratory environment. Occasional travel may be required.

Responsibilities

  • Materials synthesis and processing (solution-phase, ball milling, sintering, mixing, polymer composites, surface modification, polymer cross-linking)
  • Materials characterization (XRD, SEM/TEM, FTIR, UV-Vis, DMA)
  • Piezoelectric device testing (electronic probe station, circuit design, impedance)
  • Prototype design and evaluation
  • Scale-up manufacturing
  • Collaborate with scientific partners and consultants

Qualifications

  • BS or MS degree in materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering, chemistry, physics, or related field
  • Familiarity with piezoelectric and composite materials
  • Understanding of electrical measurements, electrical circuits, signal processing, and wireless technologies
  • Experience with chemical synthesis and materials characterization
  • Experience with polymers is desirable
  • Familiarity with electronic device engineering including wire bonding, multiplexing, and data acquisition
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Ability to manage multiple scientific tasks and maintain well-documented records of projects
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Work cooperatively and supportively with individuals that have a broad range of backgrounds and educational levels

Our headquarters is located in Carlsbad, CA.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's
title: Materials and Device Design Engineer

description:
Hewlett-Packard Labs has an opening for a summer intern researcher position with a background in materials science and engineering, electron microscopy, and applied physics. This role is for PhD. candidates only. The critical task will involve microscopic characterization of thin-film electronic devices and establish the proper physical understanding of the device. The candidate will be able to participate in a team environment to design and test novel material systems to meet time critical deliverables.

At Hewlett Packard Enterprise, we don't just believe in the power of technology, we believe in the power of people when technology works for them. We believe in applying new thinking and ideas to improve the way our customers live and work.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

Enterprise Group works to streamline innovation and simplify IT with superior solutions. By combining ESSN (Enterprise Server, Storage and Networking) and Technology Services into one division, we gain a strategic advantage in our focus on “Converged Infrastructure”. The HPE Enterprise Group supports our customers with the transformation and integration of their technology. We are there for our customers – come join us!

What do we offer?
Extensive social benefits, flexible working hours, a competitive salary and shared values, make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers. At HPE our goal is to provide equal opportunities, work-life balance, and constantly evolving career opportunities.

If you are looking for challenges in a pleasant and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers

description:
Materials Scientist

#LI-KC1

Founded in 1976, Samtec is a privately held, $625 million global manufacturer of a broad line of electronic interconnect solutions, including IC-to-Board and IC Packaging, High-Speed Board-to-Board, High-Speed Cables, Mid-Board and Panel Optics, Flexible Stacking, and Micro/Rugged components and cables. Samtec Technology Centers are dedicated to developing and advancing technologies, strategies and products to optimize both the performance and cost of a system from the bare die to an interface 100 meters away, and all interconnect points in between. With 33 locations in 18 different countries, Samtecâs global presence enables its unmatched customer service. For more information, please visit www.samtec.com.

The Materials Scientist will provide leadership in technology, materials, processes and direction in the development and integration of 2.5D/3D Packaging for RF MEMS, MEMS, Life Sciences, Biomedical, Biometric Sensors, Micro-displays, Optoelectronics, and RF/Digital Components.

This position will support research and development of industry leading materials and processes for next generation TGV (Through glass via) wafers and integrated circuits and electronic packaging solutions.

Responsibilities:
  • Understanding of electronic material systems and processing; including thick films, deposited materials, polymeric systems and integration of these schemes.
  • Responsible for materials laboratory including process equipment, maintenance and material supplies. Recommend new
    equipment and/or processes to improve the performance, quality, reliability and consistency of materials produced.
  • Work as a team with all personnel in the development of new materials that are evaluated and adopted in manufacturing.
  • Scale-up thick film compositions that meet all production and customer requirements. Special emphasis on
    lot to lot consistency.
  • Documentation of all material, process developments and metrics.
  • Familiar with statistical, DOE and NPI approaches using six sigma, Stage-Gate or similar methods.
  • Plan and execute designed experiments to optimize manufacturing quality, consistency and yield.
  • Drive implementation of solution to meet goals.
  • Intellectual property documentation of all materials, processes and procedures.
  • Publication and presentation of technical papers in technical journals, conferences and meetings.
  • Work with customers worldwide to understand requirements and develop products that meet customer timelines.
  • Develop and preserve customer confidence and relationships.
  • Know-how and understanding of plating; electroless and electrolytic, work with internal and external facilities, ENIG and ENEPIG finished products for interconnection, wire bonding, flip chip and soldering of components.
  • Well informed of technology trends and future needs through benchmarking of critical publications, conferences, books, web searches, meetings and seminars.
  • Ability and desire to work collaboratively in multi-disciplinary teams.
  • Experience working in a clean room environment using solvents, resins, vehicles, powders and other light chemicals.
  • Follow all safety and security procedures.
Required Skills:
  • Advanced degree in Materials Science, Engineering, Chemistry, Physics or equivalent, preferably Ph.D.
  • Knowledge of the diverse materials and processes used in electronic microcircuits.
  • Knowledge of thick film materials processing, drying, firing, sintering, adhesion and complete characterization methods.
  • Willingness to take ownership of new projects and ability to work with R&D;, production, marketing and business teams.
  • Strong analytical knowledge and understanding; including Metallography, microscopy, SEM/EDS, TEM, Auger, XPS, SIMS, Sample preparation, TGA/DSC/TMA, Rheology, mechanical properties testing, temperature/humidity/bias reliability assessments, non-destructive investigations using acoustic, X-ray and other approaches.
  • Excellent computer skills, including Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook
  • Excellent communication skills: oral, written and presentation.
Desired Skills:
  • Minimum 3 year experience in formulation of thick film compositions. Development, testing, scale-up and manufacturing of conductor (Cu, Ag, Au and Pt based), dielectric and sealing glass paste and tape compositions.
  • Excellent computer skills, including Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook.
  • Demonstrated problem solving and decision making skills.
  • Ability to work under pressure to meet timelines.
  • Networking skills and ability to build effective links with internal and external organizations.

description:
Req Id: 73401

Job Description

As a Global Quality (GQ) Customer Mapped Quality Experience Engineer (CMQE) at Micron Technology, Inc., you are the voice of the customer for Quality. You will be the key customer facing contact to manage your Customers’ Quality requirements so that Micron is able to deliver a world class Customer Quality Experience. You are accountable for the customer’s product quality and reliability and identifying plans to bring Micron to the number 1 supplier quality ranking position. You will be responsible to reach out to customers proactively to assess their needs and driving best of breed standards internally. You will interact regularly with sales, field application engineers and internal stakeholders to maintain alignment on quality and reliability issues and foster customer relationships.

Responsibilities and Tasks:
  • Champion “voice of customers” on quality within Micron and Micron’s quality voice at customer
  • Manager total customer quality experience
  • Proactively communicate feedback from your customers to Micron functions
  • Drive quality-related proactive and reactive communication
  • Acknowledge and drive tactical and systematic closure of customer quality-related issues and customer requests
  • Be the key communication channel for proactive quality initiatives
  • Work closely with customer to determine their key care-abouts
  • Proactively measure customer’s satisfaction index to Micron’s Quality and project expected quality score
  • Drive IPP Goal of #1 or #2 in Customer Quality Ranking and/or other customer quality metrics
  • Host ongoing customer quality reviews and proactively share Quality Health Assessment of Customer experience with Micron products
  • Work closely with internal teams on the 8D problem solving process to preventive reoccurrence
  • Coordinate customer audits and drive resolution of any NC/OFIs
  • Conduct training at customer sites
  • Quality Focus and Lead
    • Drive outstanding customer experience and continuous improvements activities and results
    • Being a single point of contact for customer regarding quality issues & improvements
  • Drive proactive leadership and communication to quality related issues
  • Work with internal teams (PEs, FAEs, sales, Factory, Bus) on early customer requirements & deliverables (Phase Gate, audit requirements,..)
  • Work on effective utilization of historical quality issues to prevent reoccurrence.
  • Effective customer quality issues management- timely containment, communication and resolution
  • Lead/assemble and direct the different Micron internal teams to manage customer quality issues, requests. Concerns & requirements
  • Document, capture and deliver meeting minutes, actions and track outstanding actions to closure
  • Responsibly represent the CMQE on all customer meetings and quality reviews
  • Customer Quality Advocate
    • Be voice of the customer on quality within Micron
    • Communicate customer message, feedback and requests to Micron teams
    • Manage and coordinate Customer audits
    • Manage and coordinate customer visits
    • Take the lead working with internal teams on customer requests
    • Ensure customer requirements are reflected in processes. Procedures & standards
  • Customer Metrics Tracking and Management
    • Track, update & close all customer action items (AI) on time
    • Work/lead on scorecard tracking and improvements
    • Managing, scheduling and leading MQR
    • 8D management & closure by completing the PA & CA
    • Customer unique requirements (ex. Dell Safe Launch, HPE Quality pledge ..)
    • Communicate/track and close customer quality processes requirements
      • QMP- Quality Management plan (Dell)
      • IQC, BPI, SPC, CQI,
  • CMQE Performance & Behavior
    • Demonstrate assertiveness and accountability
    • Demonstrating intellectual curiosity to fully understand customer experience associated with quality issues identified is a key attribute to success
    • Team leadership- influencing, relationship building, customer focus, efficiency, excellent communication skills and self- development
    • Evaluate the customer requests and challenge by providing intelligent & accurate response when is needed
    • Work with different internal teams to ensure robust, closed loop on customer requests/ requirements
    • Proactively work with CMQE, CQE and GQ teams on identifying gaps and impartments to the quality processes
    • Lead critical customer improvements/projects/ initiatives that can improve on quality and customer satisfaction
    • Identification of process gaps and implementation of preventative corrective actions.
    • Log and track every customer issue in the AI system
    • Track and manage cost (office equipment) and travel expenses
Education:

Required:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in:

• Electronics

• Engineering - Electrical

• Engineering - Industrial

• Engineering - Materials Science

• Communications

• Related field of study

Experience

Required

5+ years’ experience in the following:

• Customer Experience

• Design Experience

Additional Information:

Familiarity with basic semiconductor processing, device physics, quality reliability fundamentals, customer experience, and storage industry.

Qualifications:

• High degree of self-initiative and ability to think and act independently

• Good multi-tasking and problem solving skills

• The ability to work under tight timeframes and prioritize competing activities

• Excellent organizational and management skills and outstanding interpersonal and teamwork skills

• Understand how to handle conflict management

• The proven ability to collaborate well with team members and drive for results

• Strong verbal, written communication skills, and presentation skills

• The ability to drive for results

• The ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand needs and translate them into actionable plans, deliverables, and resource requirements

• The ability to effectively interact with a wide range of personalities

• The ability and willingness to travel when required; travel required

We recruit, hire, train, promote, discipline and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person's race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, pregnancy, veteran’s status, or other classifications protected under law. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for team members' disabilities or religious beliefs and practices.

Each manager, supervisor and team member is responsible for carrying out this policy. The EEO Administrator in Human Resources is responsible for administration of this policy. The administrator will monitor compliance and is available to answer any questions on EEO matters.

To request assistance with the application process, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 (or 208-368-4748).
title: Customer Mapped Quality Experience Engineer (CMQE) - West Coast Job

description:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.

As a Reliability Engineer, you will play a key role in creating new consumer electronic products and accessories that meet a high bar for reliability and performance. You will work closely with the product management and design engineering teams to define standards, specify tests, and then supervise test execution and failure analysis. A broad engineering background and command of statistical methods will help to inform design of new products. Your strong interpersonal and communication skills will be key to ensuring adoption of your technical recommendations.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Consumer Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Consumer Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

Responsibilities
  • Translate product management reliability goals into appropriate testable targets.
  • Develop reliability performance metrics and lead management reviews to review progress against those metrics.
  • Lead reliability test planning, methodology and execution for all aspects of the product.
  • Drive the failure analysis process for all failures discovered during reliability testing.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Textiles Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Materials Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience with reliability engineering for consumer products, accessories, audio/acoustics, soft-goods/textiles, or similar.
  • Experience in applying design for reliability techniques such as FTA and DFMEA. Experience with reliability modeling techniques such as Reliability Block Diagram, Weibull, Reliability Growth Models.
  • Experience in ASTM, IEC, EIA, and AATCC standards.

Preferred qualifications:
  • Masterâs degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Textiles Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Materials Science.
  • Experience working with overseas manufacturing partners and manufacturing processes.
  • Statistical analysis experience including Monte Carlo Analysis, DoE, SPC, Gauge R&R.;
  • Experience with failure analysis techniques for electrical, mechanical, audio/acoustics, textiles, or optical components.
  • Experience with Weibull++, JMP, Python, MATLAB, LabVIEW or other programming languages for data analysis and hardware test.
  • Leadership experience; ability to summarize and communicate issues to executives.

Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?

The Role:

As a Lab Engineer for the Advanced Materials team you will:

title: Sr. Advanced Materials Support Engineer

description:
Electric Power Research Institute, Inc. has an opening for Engineer/Scientist III

in Palo Alto, California.

JOB DUTIES: Perform advanced engineering/scientific analysis with minimal direction and supervision within Primary System Corrosion Research (PSCR) program. Simulate the effects of high fluence irradiation damage in stainless steel as part of ion irradiation research project. Provide scientific insights to materials degradation issues. Participate in formulating technical approaches, and present technical updates to EPRI members. Participate in revising the nuclear power plant materials handbook and materials degradation matrix. Conduct accident tolerant fuel research activities. Lead PSCR interaction with scientific community in irradiated materials characterization and modeling such as void swelling modeling. Conduct independent research, and manage small, less complex projects. Make changes in methods, design or equipment where necessary. May provide technical guidance to other professionals within EPRI. Assist Project/Program managers in assessing customer needs, formulating technical approaches, preparing proposals, writing technical publications/papers, and making presentations.

REQUIREMENTS: Employer will accept PhD in Materials Science, Materials Engineering, or related technical field. Position requires:

1. Irradiated materials characterization using electron microscopy and other techniques;

2. Irradiation damage in steels;

3. Heavy ion irradiation;

4. Understanding environmental degradation in materials;

5. Simulating high fluence irradiation damage in steels using heavy ion beam;

6. Performing independent research in the area of heavy ion irridation; and

7. Making scientific presentations and writing technical reports for peer review.

Some international travel may be required to work on projects at various, unanticipated sites.

title: Sr Manufacturing/Project Engineer - Chemical/Materials/Plastics

description:
Illumina is improving human health by unlocking the power of the genome. Our focus on innovation has established us as the global leader in DNA sequencing and array-based technologies, serving customers in the research, clinical and applied markets. Our products are used for applications in the life sciences, oncology, reproductive health, agriculture and other emerging segments.

This Senior Scientist will work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment to develop robust, scalable manufacturing processes for consumables used in cutting-edge genomics research and for clinical applications. This Scientist will have experience with consumables in a product development setting, as well as deep technical knowledge in surface chemistry and fabrication. You will participate in the development and optimization of high-throughput in-vitro diagnostics which will serve to accelerate next generation sequencing.

Responsibilities
  • Cross functional collaboration with Engineering, Molecular Biology, Quality and Production to develop new processes for consumables products used in Illumina’s NGS platforms (flow cells, microarrays & digital fluidics cartridges)
  • Help to establish best practices for consumables product development in compliance with quality system regulations
  • Define technical requirements for consumable products in consideration of manufacturing robustness, scalability and cost
  • Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOEs) to optimize processes to achieve commercial levels of stability, robustness, and performance
  • Use systematic problem-solving methods to troubleshoot complex issues related to product quality, stability and robustness
  • Provide technical leadership in the transfer of new processes and products to production
  • Be both a strong individual contributor as well as a collaborative team member
Required Skills & Experience
  • PhD in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Materials Science, Physical Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or Biochemical Engineering or closely related discipline
  • 10+ years’ industry experience in new product development with emphasis on consumables
  • 2 or more years’ experience in commercial IVD or molecular diagnostics product development for regulated markets
  • Strong background in surface chemistry or fabrication
  • Working knowledge of ISO13485, 21 CFR Part 11, ISO9001 and QSR guidelines required
  • Solid experience with process development, improvement, scale-up and transfer to manufacturing
  • Strong data analysis skills, ability to interpret and draw conclusions from large amounts of data
  • Experience with design of experiment (DOE) methodologies and statistical methods for large data set analysis (i.e., JMP, etc.)
Preferred Skills & Experience
  • Strong technical science knowledge around glass fabrication, MEMs, nano-fabrication
  • Experience with fabrication or coating
  • Domain expertise in DNA sequencing development
  • Experience with transfer of new products to manufacturing and/or QC desired
EOE / Minorities / Females / Veterans / Disabled

About Illumina
Illumina is improving human health by unlocking the power of the genome. If that inspires you, let’s talk. Having built a culture fueled by innovation, collaboration and openness, we’ve established ourselves as the global leader in DNA sequencing and array-based technologies. Our people and our technology change lives by driving advancements in life sciences, oncology, reproductive health, agriculture and other emerging markets. We are deeply passionate about what we do, because we know that our work has the power to improve lives.

We’re an established company with a track record of phenomenal growth. Our revenue grew from $10 million in 2002 to approximately $2.2 billion in 2015. Our growth isn’t just revenue; we’ve been hiring the best and the brightest. That’s why MIT ranked Illumina near the top of its World’s Smartest Companies list three years running, including #1 in 2014. If you thrive in a brilliant, fast-paced, and mission-driven environment, Illumina is the place for you – imagine the possibilities.
title: Staff Scientist

description:
Exponent is a leading engineering and scientific consulting firm. Our multidisciplinary team of scientists, engineers, physicians, and regulatory consultants brings together more than 90 different disciplines to solve complicated problems facing corporations, insurers, government entities, associations and individuals. Our approximately 900 staff members work in 26 offices across the United States and abroad. Exponent has over 700 consultants, including more than 425 that have earned a doctorate in their chosen field of specialization.

Exponent's Materials & Corrosion Engineering Practice has provided over forty years of services related to the investigation and analysis of products ranging from aircraft and marine transportation to all types of industrial equipment and consumer products. Our in-depth knowledge of materials, combined with unparalleled breadth of collective expertise in virtually all areas of engineering and science, is used to understand how and why materials fail in medical, automotive, construction, recreational, and other applications.

Exponent is currently hiring an Engineer/Associate in our Menlo Park, CA office. This individual will work as a part of a team conducting materials, metallurgical, and mechanical failure analyses as well as product development and accelerated testing, with a primary emphasis on brittle materials, micro- and nanoscale material characterization techniques, and thin films. Duties will include communicating effectively with other engineers and technicians, managers, clients, and administrative reports as well as conducting hands-on failure analysis, planning and executing laboratory tests, field inspections, materials characterization, directing SEM operation, and metallurgical analysis and testing.

Qualifications for this position include:
Ph.D. in Materials Science and Engineering and familiarity with Mechanical Engineering and/or Electrical Engineering
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work within project teams with a strong desire to contribute
Specialized knowledge of materials characterization techniques (e.g., SEM, FIB, TEM, EDS, XPS, Auger, SIMS, FTIR, acoustic microscopy, X-ray, interferometry) is required
Specialized knowledge of the mechanical behavior of bulk brittle materials and thin films, experience with thin film fabrication, and experience operating a FIB and/or TEM system is desired

We are an Affirmative Action, Equal Employment Opportunity, Veterans and Disabled Employer.

title: Supplier Industrialization Engineer - Plating Process

description:
We are looking for a scientist with experience in Chemistry and/or Materials Science to contribute to a team within Consumables Development. Experience could be industrial or academic and could include polymer chemistry, functional coatings, surface modification, functional materials, biomaterials, drug delivery methods, and/or the analytical techniques associated with these areas.

As a successful candidate you will work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment to create genomic analysis consumable devices that enable leading-edge medical research.You will be a key contributor within integrated and multidisciplinary teams developing new, and improving existing nucleic acid sequencing and sample preparation technology platforms.

All About You

Responsibilities: • Develop new and existing materials and deposition methods for Illumina’s sequencing and sample preparation platforms.
• Explore new reaction methodologies to expand the Illumina portfolio of sequencing and sample prep chemical transformations and isolation techniques.
• Explore structural property relationships at the material-biochemistry interface.
• Perform in-depth analyses using techniques such as ellipsometry, DSC, TGA, FTIR, Raman, SEM, XPS, TOF-SIMS, AFM, high resolution spectroscopy and microscopy to characterize dimensions at the interface between Illumina’s chemistry and substrate materials.
• Modify surfaces and/or particles toward making functional materials at the biochemistry, chemistry, and/or physics interface.
• Perform and lead failure analysis.
• Teach methods developed to other scientists, engineers, research associates, of a range of experience and education levels.
• Work collaboratively with chemists, biochemists and bioinformaticians, developing new components for DNA analysis platforms.
• Present clear and concise written and oral communications to colleagues and supervisors, lead and/or participate in technical meetings, and provide recommendations based on technical results.
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.
Requirements:

Competitive candidates will have 0-4 years of postdoctoral or industrial experience (or a combination of the two). In addition, candidates will have performed many (but not necessarily all) of the following:
• Demonstrated experience solving challenging, interdisciplinary problems at the interface of biology, chemistry and materials science
• Characterized materials using techniques such as ellipsometry, DSC, TGA, FTIR, Raman, SEM, TEM, XPS, TOF-SIMS, AFM, or chromatographic techniques such as GC-MS and HPLC.
• Used fluorescence-based methods for protein or material labeling techniques such as characterization of surface functionalization and molecular interactions.
• Developed polymer chemistry or organic chemistry reactions in the context of materials. This could include methods for bioconjugation and cross functionalization of materials.
• Modified surfaces (could include particles) with adhesion layers, silanization, or metallic surface functionalization as well as utilized techniques to analyze modified surfaces.
• Explored different material deposition techniques including but not limited to spray coating, spin coating, vapor deposition.
• Demonstrated ability to overcome technical challenges in a fast-paced environment within an interdisciplinary team setting
Education:

The ideal candidate will have a PhD in Chemistry, Material Sciences, Biomedical Engineering, or a related field.

Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
title: Scientist 1

description:
Do you want to change the world? We do, too.

The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally, and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight, if harnessed, could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced, distributed and consumed on a global scale, and we’re looking for talented, committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals.

SunPower is a global solar energy solutions company with a rich heritage of pioneering the best energy technologies in the world. Our solutions are unrivaled in terms of long-term reliability, efficiency and guaranteed performance, and our company is unmatched in terms of global reach and scale. Through design, manufacturing, installation and ongoing maintenance and monitoring, SunPower provides its proprietary, world-record efficient solar technology to residential, commercial and utility customers worldwide.

SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a brilliant, passionate and driven team of more than 7,000 in North America, Europe, Africa, Asia and Australia. In an industry that is reshaping the world’s energy future, there’s no better place to be than SunPower.

We believe that our employees create our brand – with each project, each communication, each task completed and each interaction. Experience is critical to SunPower in regards to not only our customers but also our employees and dealer partners. As such, we strive to hire candidates that are service focused. The experience we would expect the ideal person to deliver is:

Cell R&D; Staff - Wet Process Engineer

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

As a Wet Etch Process Development Engineer within the Sunpower RnD team, you will be responsible for innovating and improving wet etch and wet cleans processing for current and next generation technologies. You will work in all facets of the photovoltaic device processing and integration including process development and optimization. You will team with Equipment Engineering to assess and develop necessary toolsets to achieve this objective. The team will be challenged by new materials, applications and device architectures. You will be responsible for establishing robust wet processes and chemistries through rigorous characterization and statistical validation before ramping them into high volume manufacturing.
  • Primary responsibility is the development and assessment of novel wet processing techniques to meet SunPower solar cell development goals.
  • Investigating and assessing new chemistries for performance and cost of operation.
  • Integration of these new processes to upstream and downstream processing and product requirements.
  • Designing experiments (DOE)
  • Coordinating/executing experiments in the laboratory, at production sites and at vendor sites
  • Analyzing and presenting data with recommendations
  • Communicating within a development team and with internal project customers
Qualifications and Experience
  • Minimum of Bachelor’s in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, or related fields. If a candidate has a B.S. or M.S. only, 4/2+ years (respectively) of industrial experience is required.
  • Demonstrated failure analysis work in which the candidate was responsible for choosing the best samples and metrology to quickly identify root cause.
  • Significant experience with semiconductor materials and equipment development
  • 2+ years’ experience in semiconductor research and development environment preferred
  • Experience with solar processes and integration a plus
  • Solar cell device physics background or equivalent (i.e. semiconductor physics) a plus
  • Self-starter, comfortable with owning a development project
  • Flexible, creative problem solver, willing to adapt to unexpected situations to get results
  • Team player, good at working with diverse groups
  • Excellent communicator, both in presentations and written reports
  • Willing to travel 10% of the time
Equal Employment Opportunity
The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer and makes employment decisions, including but not limited to, hiring, firing, promotion, demotion, training, and/or compensation, on the basis of merit. Employment decisions are based on an individual’s qualifications as they relate to the job under consideration. The Company’s policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions, the actual sex of the individual, or the gender identity or gender expression), race, color, religion, including religious dress practices and religious grooming practices, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, familial status, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran or military status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws, ordinances, or regulations. The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company, including supervisors and co-workers.

EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

SunPower Supports EEO

Accommodation for Applicants to SunPower Corporation
SunPower Corporation is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, you may use the following alternative email address to contact us about your interest in employment at SunPower Corporation: jobs@sunpower.com. title: Cell R&D Staff - Wet Process Engineer

description:
As a Principal Advanced Material Specialist you will plan, propose and lead development studies of new materials and fabrication and finishing processes. These materials and processes will be critical to Industrial Design and Product Development for defining roadmaps. You will participate as part of the Engineering Product Development team, working directly with the Industrial Designers, Product Design Engineers, Operations Supply Base Management and Contract Fabrication Engineering and production teams.

In this role, you will:
  • Enable new functionality for existing products or create new products based on innovations in materials
  • Provide guidance on the trade-offs in mechanical, electrical, optical, and acoustic device performance based on material properties
  • Provide materials leadership to design teams to understand limitations imposed by material properties
  • Own resolution of materials problems that arise during pre-production and production builds
  • Lead new technology investigations to demonstrate readiness of new materials for inclusion in future products
  • Participate in design & planning through DFM, as well as process yield, capacity and cost modeling
  • Travel to oversee fabrication process qualification and corrective action

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in related field
  • 10+ years of experience in Material Science or Manufacturing Processes
  • Experience architecting materials fabrication processes
  • Experience in materials innovations leading to new products or enhanced functionality of existing products
  • Experience tracing device performance issues to materials related root causes and rectifying the problems
  • Experience in production process qualification, measurement and analysis
  • Experience in high volume production
  • Working knowledge of data analysis and statistics

Preferred Qualifications
  • Advanced degree in Materials Science, Chemistry, Physics, or related field
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Enthusiasm for getting “hands on” with product and production equipment
  • Experience working with overseas partners
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills including effective presentation of complex data
  • Experience in plastic molding, including knowledge of IMD, transfer molding, Double Shot and insert molding
  • Experience in metal forming, including knowledge of forming, casting, forging and CNC techniques
  • Experience with high quality finishing, including knowledge of polishing, plating, painting, coating and metallization
  • Familiarity with ProEngineer Wildfire, MoldFlow
  • Demonstrated ability to start projects and drive to completion and achieve “actionable” results

title: Principal Advanced Materials Specialist

description:
Maxim Integrated is a highly successful, $2.4 billion company. With offices and manufacturing sites around the world, we design award-winning semiconductors that make the world more integrated. We also know that itâs our people who make us a great company. So we reward bold thinking, teamwork, personal growth, and community involvement. Want to make a difference and be challenged every day? Join us at Maxim Integrated. With analog integration, the possibilities are endless.

The successful candidate will join the Maxim Integrated Advanced Research and Development (AR&D;) organization as a AR&D; power packaging engineer. He/she will own/assist in identifying, defining, developing, driving new advanced packaging technology platforms for next generation products from concept to qualification and transferring to volume manufacturing. The successful candidate will be solving challenging packaging problems at Front End (bumping), Back End (assembly), and board applications, and will be supporting internal and external customers with design rules, application notes, FA, BLR, EM. Responsibilities include:
  • Performing research, design, and development of new innovative IC packages and technology platforms and derivatives that target needed product cost-performance, efficiency, density, and quality



  • Delivering the right package platform at the right time to enable product innovation and faster time-to-market



  • Assisting in forming and presenting technology roadmap from concept to qualification to technology transfer



  • Budgeting, handling requisitions



  • Testing and prototyping of new packages



  • Owning package design rules



Minimum Qualifications
Qualifications
  • Experience working with other engineers and product definers across different departments defining and driving strategic package technology platform roadmaps.



  • Proven skills and confidence defining and driving cost-performance solutions by gathering, organizing, and analyzing data



  • Capability in applying theoretical power electronics principles to define/analyze device thermal and electrical performance



  • Experience in defining, innovating, developing, qualifying, and applying advanced package technology architectures and systems from bump to assembly to PCB



  • Knowledge of package design/simulation tools such as Q3D, Flotherm, Solid-Works, AutoCAD, Cadence APD. Experience with any of these or other IC design and modeling software tools is a plus.



  • Excellent skills with budgeting, scheduling, organizing, presenting



  • Recent involvement in research and development of advanced package technologies



  • Good understanding of industry trends and supply chain in the fields of semiconductor design, process, packaging, manufacturing, quality systems & standards



  • Proven skills and confidence applying diverse semiconductor engineering skill sets to solve complex engineering challenges



  • Ability to multi-task within a fast-paced, dynamic, demanding technology-leader culture



  • Team player, detail-oriented, self-motivated and able to work independently

description:
Orbital ATK employs students from a variety of disciplines, including technical and engineering fields. College students may receive hands-on projects involved with such areas as the design, build and support work on space systems that support scientific missions to study near-earth and other space environments, and to advance new technologies. During these internships, a major project will be assigned and/or many discrete opportunities will be available. In many cases, internships serve as a potential stepping stone to full time employment.

Orbital ATK is currently looking to fill an intern position to support our Manufacturing Engineering team in the San Diego, California facility of our Space Components Division. While working as an ontern for Orbital ATK – San Diego you will be given the opportunity to learn/strengthen the following skills in a professional environment.

As an Intern in the Materials & Process Engineering group you will:
  • Work with M&P; Engineers and the Mechanical Test Laboratory on improvements in test methods and procedures to improve test accuracy and repeatability
  • Provide entry level M&P; support to varied programs
  • Work on approved IRAD activities.
  • Work to improve the existing M&P; standard specifications.
  • Perform related duties as assigned or required.
Desired Experience/Skills:

Preferred candidates will have completed two or more years of college-level engineering or other applicable field of study.
  • 3 rd year or later undergraduate student studying Materials Science, Composite Materials Engineering or related field preferred.
  • Candidates with curriculum including study of composite materials and / or processes preferred.
  • Experience and success in working within teams
  • Proven ability to multi-task and self-starter able to work independently
  • Strong interpersonal skills to drive actions necessary to accomplish assigned tasks
  • Customer focus
  • Strong organizational skills in managing time, projects and resources
  • High degree of attention to detail and level of accuracy required
In order to be considered, candidates must submit their resume online with the following education information: major, graduation date, and most current cumulative GPA (must be 3.0 or higher). It is also helpful if you indicate if you are seeking full time or internship opportunities.

Most positions will be filled as a 12-week internship (from mid to late May until mid to late August 2015).

Orbital ATK is applying entrepreneurial thinking and commercial practices to deliver reliable, innovative and affordable products and services to our customers and grow our core areas while harnessing new technologies that will take our products – and your ideas – into the future. When encouraged to think beyond the ordinary, you’ll be amazed at what you can do!

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
