description:
What Your Job Will Be Like

The Post-Doctoral Appointee Program is designed to recruit outstanding Ph.D. applicants to assist a line organization in meeting its mission objectives and to provide a professional technical work environment for the employee. The Ph.D. must have been conferred within one to five years prior to employment. These assignments are for a one-year period, with the option at management’s discretion to serve no more than five additional one-year assignments.

We are seeking a Postdoctoral Scientist to join a dynamic, interdisciplinary team of scientists at four DOE National Laboratories that constitute the Hydrogen Materials Advanced Research Consortium (HyMARC). HyMARC is using a combination of cutting-edge modeling, synthesis, and advanced characterization tools to provide the foundational understanding needed to design effective hydrogen storage materials. The primary focus of this job will be to conduct experiments using advanced neutron spectroscopic tools at the Spallation Neutron Source (SNS) located at Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL). As such, the postdoc is expected to be in residence for the majority of the year at ORNL. However, the postdoc will also work closely with the HyMARC research team at Sandia’s California site and will be in residence there for approximately one month each in January and June (coinciding with SNS accelerator down times). The successful candidate will be an integral member of the HyMARC team and will be expected to play a major role in synthesizing new hydrogen storage media, as well as advancing the structural and in-situ characterization of these materials using state-of-the-art X-ray, ion-scattering techniques, and spectroscopic tools, as well as the SNS neutron capabilities.

For additional information, please visit https://hymarc.org/

Qualifications We Require

A recent doctorate in chemistry, materials science or related field is required, with a strong emphasis on synthesis and characterization of bulk and/or nanoscale inorganic materials. Expertise in neutron techniques is not required. The candidate must have direct, hands-on experience with handling air-sensitive compounds, be versed in Schlenk line and glove-box techniques, and standard analytical techniques (spectroscopy, diffraction, etc.). Strong written and oral communication skills are required. Emphasis on a demonstrated record of high technical achievement (e.g. as evidenced by publication record) and the ability to conduct creative, independent research is preferred.

Qualifications We Desire

Advanced characterization techniques, such as neutron methods, soft X-ray techniques, small-angle X-ray scattering, XPS, TEM, solid-state NMR, PCT/Sieverts, mass-spectroscopy; Solid-state and wet-chemistry nanoscale materials synthesis.

About Our Team

The Energy Nanomaterials Department is a research organization specializing in the synthesis and characterization of nanomaterials for energy and national security applications. Projects and capabilities in the department's research portfolio include nanoporous materials for sensing, catalysis, energy harvesting, and gas storage; materials for energy and hydrogen storage; thermoelectrics; and nanoscale materials characterization including extensive electron microscopy, atomic force microscopy, and nanoindentation instrumentation. This organization supports a broad set of large analytical equipment critical to the operations of the California site. The department is a key element in a diverse set of materials science organizations and resources, managed both locally and across the corporation. We partner broadly with other personnel within Sandia and many external institutions, taking advantage of our proximity to other researchers and facilities in the San Francisco Bay Area and Northern California.

About Sandia

Sandia National Laboratories is the nation’s premier science and engineering lab for national security and technology innovation, with teams of specialists focused on cutting-edge work in a broad array of areas. Some of the main reasons we love our jobs:
  • Challenging work with amazing impact that contributes to security, peace, and freedom worldwide
  • Extraordinary co-workers
  • Some of the best tools, equipment, and research facilities in the world
  • Career advancement and enrichment opportunities
  • Flexible schedules, generous vacations, strong medical and other benefits, competitive 401k, learning opportunities, relocation assistance and amenities aimed at creating a solid work/life balance *

World-changing technologies. Life-changing careers. Learn more about Sandia at: http://www.sandia.gov

* These benefits vary by job classification.

Security Clearance

No clearance required.

This position does not currently require a Department of Energy (DOE)-granted security clearance.

Sandia will conduct a pre-employment background review that includes personal reference checks, law enforcement record checks, and employment and education verifications. Further, employees in New Mexico must pass a U.S. Air Force background screen for access to the work site. Substance abuse or illegal drug use, falsification of information, criminal activity, serious misconduct or other indicators of untrustworthiness can cause access to be denied or terminated, rendering the inability to perform the duties assigned and resulting in termination of employment.

If hired without a clearance, and one subsequently becomes required or you bid on positions that require a DOE-granted security clearance, a pre-processing background review that includes personal reference checks, law enforcement record and credit checks, and employment and education verifications may be conducted prior to a required federal background investigation. Applicants for DOE-granted security clearances must be U.S. citizens and be able to obtain and maintain the appropriate DOE security clearance as required for the position.
title: Postdoctoral Appointee

description:
Pacific Biosciences is looking for a highly energetic Semiconductor Packaging Engineer ready to work on our exciting next generation biologically integrated semiconductor chip sequencing technology. This position will involve working in a fast moving cross-discipline and highly creative environment. Daily job activities will include overseeing foundry assembly and packaging of integrated CMOS devices utilizing die level and die to wafer level bonding, bonding of injection molded plastic parts and ceramic substrates, wafer dicing, and wire bonding, all while having the unique opportunity of interfacing with a broad range of advanced scientists and engineers,

The ideal candidate is a highly mobile and adaptive forward thinking person able to take ownership of complex long range projects while executing on immediate short term deliverables. Key skills will include complex problem solving, team management, statistical design and analysis, superb documentation skills, and excellent team interaction. Hands on experience with CMOS packaging design, UV and thermal adhesives, die and wire bonding will make for a highly successful candidate.

Responsibilities:
This person will be responsible for ensuring high quality electrical packaging of integrated CMOS and fluidics products utilizing external foundry partners and for the improvement and ramp into high volume of said processes, tools, designs, and materials.

Key areas of focus are:
• Strong foundry/external manufacturing management experience.
• Pro-active assessment of risks/failure modes and crisp ownership of excursions
• Roadmapping and implementation of CIP projects to effect positive change in cost/quality/cycle time/functional performance
• Strong documentation skills including qualification plan, work instructions, technician training
• Integration of a standard CMOS component with injection molded plastics utilizing both standard and custom packaging techniques
• UV, thermal adhesive and encapsulant material evaluation, selection, and dispense/cure process development and improvement
• Wafer to wafer bonding, die attach with component tracking and traceability
• Wedge wirebonding experience
• Design and implementation of manufacturing systems and documentation for clean transfer into production environment
• Application of SPC/FMEA based approach to production line/data and system development to insure highly effective but low overhead approach to process capability monitoring
• Detail oriented data collection and analysis to enable tool and process validations
• Ability to interface with and lead integrated teams involving manufacturing and R&D;
• Development of experiments and methods to identify key relationships between inline parametric data and product functional performance.

This person will work very closely with external manufacturing partners and will represent the company for specific product lines.

Position Requirements:
• Bachelors’s degree or equivalent experience in Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering or Physics.
• 4+ years of industry experience in custom and volume manufacturing environments
• Proficiency with JMP, Excel, Project, SolidWorks
• Familiarity with ISO 9001 & 13485
• Experience with MES/manufacturing automation systems
• Strong ownership and drive for success
• Ability and willingness to travel up to 20% of the time
title: Semiconductor Packaging Engineer

description:
With more than 60 years of innovation and leadership, FEI enables customers to find meaningful answers to questions that accelerate breakthrough discoveries, increase productivity, and ultimately change the world. FEI designs, manu­factures, and supports the broadest range of high-performance microscopy workflows that provide images and answers in the micro-, nano-, and picometer scales.

Combining hardware and software expertise in electron, ion, and light microscopy with deep application knowledge in the materials science, life sci­ences, electronics, and natural resources markets, the worldwide FEI team of 2,700+ employees is dedicated to customers' pursuit of discovery and resolution to global challenges.

Job Purpose The Repair Technician is responsible for the troubleshooting, repair and testing of optical components such as laser sources, laser scan modules (LSMs), lenses, mirror assemblies, cameras and ancillary photonics devices. Primary responsibility is to repair defective assemblies returned from the field and to test and certify them for return to available spares inventory.

Duties and responsibilities

We’re seeking a Repair Technican who will troubleshoot to component level, repair and perform final test of electro-mechanical and optical assemblies, laser equipment and IR cameras. Additional duties may include assistance to the manufacturing group in the assembly, integration and test of this equipment on new systems.
  • Disassembles, repairs and reassembles a wide variety of electronic or electro-mechanical and optical sub-assemblies.
  • Applies logical and efficient troubleshhooting procedures to quickly isolate and correct equipment faults.
  • Performs final alignments and calibrations on repaired equipment.
  • Integrates repaired subassemblies into appropriate systems when necessary to enable verification of performance to design specifications.
  • Troubleshoot complex mechanical and electrical systems.
  • Work with product engineers and global product support engineers to identify and resolve quality or design issues.
Qualifications

The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:
  • Typically requires greater than 5 years of related experience, or a combination of education, training and experience that demonstrate the required skills.
  • Must have experience using basic hand tools to assemble and disassemble equipment, including screw drivers, wrenches, soldering equipment, wiring tools, etc.
  • Troubleshooting experience using oscilloscopes, DVM, and other test equipment
  • Familiarity with Windows and other PC based software.
  • Able to safely lift and manipulate 50 pounds.
  • Must be able to read technical drawings including assembly drawings, BoMs, schematics, etc.
  • Experience working with IR cameras is a plus but not required.
  • Experience working on equipment incorporating liquid nitrogen is a plus but not required.
  • Experience working to ANSI and OSHA laser safety standards is a plus but not required.
  • Excellent manual dexterity - ability to work with small objects and microscopes.
  • Quick learner with verbal and written instructions.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
  • Fluent in English.
  • US citizen or permanent resident.

EEO/AAP

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Other

This position requires a criminal history background check. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the applicant from employment. A drug screen will also be administered.

description:
St. Jude Medical is now Abbott
We are seeking an experienced, high caliber Principal Development Engineer. The position requires an experienced and highly inventive Principal, Mechanical Engineer to be responsible for the pioneering development of unique miniature implantable medical cardiac devices. The position consists of anatomical research, product concept origination, technology development including: rendering detailed engineering drawings, and other applicable documentation, identifying process requirements, equipment/tooling, and constructing prototypes. The individual shall Interface clinicians, field clinical engineering, designers, manufacturing, individuals in quality, regulatory, and other groups as necessary to accomplish project requirements within scheduled objectives.

Each employee can make a difference at St. Jude Medical and has the power, either individually or as a team, to influence the success of the company. We are team-oriented, fast-paced and progressive. We value people with great ideas who partner with others both internally and externally to take action and accomplish goals.

Impact this role will have on St. Jude Medical:
  • Formulates and implements research and development programs, policies, and procedures required to support profitable growth

  • Provides design/development teams with appropriate resources to perform assigned tasks

  • Interfaces with appropriate internal and external resources to ensure intellectual property is appropriately protected

  • Interfaces with appropriate internal and external resources (regulatory, customers, etc.) to ensure development programs meet regulatory and customer requirements

  • Support all Company initiatives as identified by management and in support of Quality Management Systems (QMS), Environmental Management Systems (EMS), and other regulatory requirements

    • Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors


  • Performs other related duties and responsibilities, on occasion, as assigned

Your experience(s), education and knowledge will further expand St. Jude Medical’s marketplace success:

title: Senior Scientist

description:
Base Salary: $100K+

Position Summary

We are seeking an experienced Chief Engineer/Director of Facilities Maintenance for our corporate headquarters in Vernon, CA. The successful candidate will develop, implement and oversee all of the plant and equipment maintenance and repair activities. The plant will be run 24/7 365. We're seeking an impact player - who is fully aligned with our mission - who can grow alongside us and impact our success story. The Chief Engineer will help to set our culture that will reward success, be inclusive, open to new ideas and be a meritocracy where individuals are promoted on the basis of their performance, ability to grow and contribute to our success.

The ideal candidate will have experience in the manufacturing sector – preferably in packaging materials manufacturing and/or PET recycling, be knowledgeable about California and Federal worker safety requirements, has developed new hire and ongoing worker training regimens for the maintenance/preventative maintenance of many types of equipment. This is a dynamic role that requires the ability to develop and track equipment maintenance regimens for front end PET sorting equipment, conveyers, grinders, wash lines, decontamination, pneumatic materials conveyance, sheet, thermoform and preform manufacturing lines along with auxiliary equipment that is critical to the plant’s operation. Engineering activities are designed to enhance people safety, product quality, protection of the environment and the performance of the operations.

Position Requirements and Responsibilities

  • BS Degree/Diploma in Engineering or related studies (Mechanical, Materials Science, Chemical, Food, Packaging, Electrical or other). Highly qualified candidates with significant work experience will be considered that do not have a four-year degree.
  • Highly motivated, self-starter with 5+ years related experience.
  • Manage and lead a team, ensuring adequate staffing levels, recruitment, training, development, appraisal, attendance and addressing any disciplinary issues.
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize a changing workload in a very fast paced environment.
  • Preferably project management skills in the upgrade of existing equipment and in the expansion, planning, oversight and installation of new lines.
  • Ensure the success of preventative maintenance as the multi-discipline, team-based approach to proactively maintain/ improve the reliability and performance of the company's assets to deliver continuous improvement in the value the assets deliver to the business.
  • Hands-on with experience in the maintenance and repair of state-of-the-art PET recycling and polymer processing and converting manufacturing equipment, i.e. sheet/film extrusion, injection molding, thermoforming, or other large, sophisticated manufacturing equipment.
  • Experience in the design, implementation and management of scheduled and ad-hoc equipment servicing, refurbishment and repair.
  • Regularly check the technical integrity and performance of plants’ PET recycling and packaging manufacturing equipment.
  • Be proactive in seeking additional resources or preparing training if a gap exists.
  • Diagnose operational issues and identifies appropriate plans to streamline operations, increase equipment uptime and reduce manufacturing cost and unnecessary repair costs.
  • Ensures a disciplined and consistent process for the periodic maintenance/preventative maintenance of all equipment and facilities.
  • An absolute intolerance for unsafe situations and actions.
  • Only implementing significant changes after understanding their impact on product safety/quality, people safety and the environment.
  • Experience with Process Improvement approaches (Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma, Organizational Excellence, Practical Process Improvement, etc.)
  • The desire to teach and mentor
  • Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills
  • Must possess computer skills in word processing, spreadsheets, email, etc.
  • Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills with the ability to communicate and influence personnel at all levels of the organization.
  • Benchmark rPET flake and polymer processing equipment efficiency, technical downtime, changeover and maintenance cost.
  • Ability to thrive in a rapid-paced and dynamic business environment.
  • Knowledge of accepted training and development practices.
  • An entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to have a meaningful role in the building of an industry leading organization.

Compensation & Benefits

We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $100,000.00 /year

Required education:

  • High school or equivalent

Required experience:

  • Chief Engineer: 5 years

description:
We are seeking a Senior Process Engineer for Advanced Gas Sensor Packaging in Newark, California, where the primary function of this position is to support the qualification and mass production of various gas sensor products. Additionally, the position will include the management of internal process development programs, and possibly co-development programs, in support of customers, off-shore outsourcing factories and supplier development teams. This individual will need to help define and concurrently manage multiple programs through internal management systems, as well as support customers.

Responsibilities Include:
  • Work with the factory to understand the assembly, reliability and scheduling requirements for various sensors and package assembly qualifications, material selection and supplier selection.
  • Understand and characterize material to sensor interactions that may be identified during prototype builds, qualifications and production ramp. This will include designing of experiments, analyzing data and supporting the root cause analysis and corrective action process.
  • Work with Spec Sensors R&D; development team on the transfer of new packaging technologies to production. This will include supporting the final qualification and initial production ramp.
  • Supporting key quality management processes such as PCN, PPAP, APQP, DFMEA, internal audit
  • Follow the quality documentation including document creation and document control processes in compliance with automotive, medical, and consumer compliance initiatives
  • Managing and hosting all customer quality audits
  • Driving company-wide continuous improvement initiatives to improve customer satisfaction and to reduce cost
Background and Skills :

This position requires a Bachelorâs Degree in Engineering (materials science, mechanical engineering, microelectronics or similar) and 10+ years of experience in the semiconductor industry or a Masterâs Degree in Engineering and 8+ years experience.
  • Project management experience with knowledge of packaging assembly,, materials, processes, and design.
  • Direct prior product management experience involving off-shore factory assets and the ability to multiplex across numerous programs is essential.
  • Knowledge of material and package characterization data analysis, test methods and qualification procedures is desired.
  • Experience in MEMS, environmental & chemical sensor or related product/process a plus
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and have experience with design and manufacturing systems used in modules or other highly integrated packages.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Technical presentations for customers and at industry seminars are required.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office is required.
  • This position requires 10% domestic and 10% international travel.
  • Must be eligible to work in the US without restriction(s)
title: Sr. Process Engineer

Purposeof this Position
The NDT Level II Technician will be qualifiedto set up and calibrate equipment, to conduct tests and to interpret, evaluateand document the results in accordance with procedures approved by a Level III.A Level II Technician shall also be familiar with the codes, standards, andother contractual documents utilized at Element. A Level II Technician shall bethoroughly familiar with the scope and limitations for the technique/method towhich certified and should be capable of directing the work of trainees andLevel 1 personnel. The ability to accurately document the results of thenondestructive tests is critical. A Level II Technician will have basicknowledge of product manufacturing and inspection technology. In this role theLevel II Technician will be responsible for providing reliable results whilepaying close attention to safety and project timelines.

Conductradiography (X-ray) tests in accordance with written company procedures

Thisposition does not supervise staff.

Familiarwith testing codes and standards
Experience with Radiographicprocesses
Some experience testing acombination of: Welds, castings, steel, titanium and aluminum is preferred

Language Skills
Abilityto read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenanceinstructions, customer testing specifications, and procedure manuals. Abilityto write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectivelybefore groups of customers or employees of organization.

Mathematical Skills
Ability to calculate figures and amounts suchas discounts, interest, commissions and proportions. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebraand geometry.

Reasoning Ability

description: IBM Research - Almaden invites applications for a Scientist/Engineer position in the area of the development of materials for advanced magnetic random access memory (MRAM). The scientist/engineer will carry out studies for the research and development of novel materials and devices for advanced deeply-scaled spin transfer torque magnetic random access memory (STT-MRAM). The position will involve the deposition of atomically layered magnetic tunnel junction materials by magnetron and ion beam sputtering and other thin film deposition techniques, the characterization of these materials by various structural, magnetic and magneto-transport measurements. The scientist/engineer should have a demonstrated record of achievement in experimental materials science and physical phenomena. The candidate is expected to be highly creative and capable of developing novel solutions to challenging problems. The candidate must be an outstanding team player who can work in a fast-paced and highly dynamic environment and contribute to several projects in parallel. Required: Masterâs degree in experimental Physics, Applied Physics, materials science or electrical engineering. Advanced knowledge of thin film materials. Advanced knowledge of magneto-transport characterization of thin film materials. Advanced knowledge of Heusler compounds.x The World is Our Laboratory: No matter where discovery takes place, IBM researchers push the boundaries of science, technology and business to make the world work better. IBM Research is a global community of forward-thinkers working towards a common goal: progress. Thin film deposition - 2 years Magneto-transport characterization of thin film materials - 2 years Knowledge of Heusler compounds - 2 years Nanodevice fabrication - 1 year Magnetic property characterization - 2 years Xray structural characterization of thin films - 2 years
title: MRAM JDA Support Engineer

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are stoked by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

Job Description

About This Division

Formulation Sciences

Organic chemists and synthetic biologists form the core of our Formulation Sciences Team. The Team develops routes and new methodologies to create or reassemble natural building blocks for use in our products. This includes employing enzymes to enable cleaner and more selective chemistries to arrive at our building blocks. The Formulation Team works in close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel to enable outcomes and discoveries, which include but are not limited to, the development of chemical transformations that are amenable to fast, efficient, and robust scale-up to enable commercial scale production of our materials.

Senior Formulation Scientist (Catalysis & Method Development)

Apeel Sciences is seeking a motivated, resourceful, and creative candidate with a background in catalysis for the Catalysis & Method Development team of Formulation Sciences. An individual interested in this position will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and optimizing new reaction platforms for accessing molecular targets. This includes the functionalization of biomass extracts, as well as new method development to access molecules for which we have not yet perfected our extraction techniques. Senior Formulation Scientists on the Catalysis and Method Development team are encouraged to develop novel catalysts, including heterogeneous, homogeneous, and protein based catalysts, as enabling tools to access novel molecular frameworks. Senior Formulation Scientists are expected to regularly interface with process engineers, extraction scientists, and the protein scientists to cohesively bridge the gap between the teams and aid in advancing processes through the product funnel.

Responsibilities and Outcomes (including but not limited to):
  • The design and implementation of individual research programs aimed at advancing the core competencies of the Formulation Sciences team and Apeel Sciences.
  • Characterization of synthesized substances using standard analytical techniques, including but not limited to: NMR, IR, UV/Vis, MS, GC, and/or LC
  • Characterization of designed catalysts using standard analytical techniques, including but not limited to: TGA, EPR, SDS-PAGE & other standard biochemical assays, and/or MALDI-TOF.
  • Management and analysis of research data.
  • A commitment to workplace safety through the adherence to corporate safety policies.
Requirements

  • Ideal candidates for this position will hold a Ph.D. in Chemistry or Chemical Engineering with an emphasis in catalysis or methodology, but a candidate with an MS in chemistry or chemical engineering and work experience will also be strongly considered.
  • Formal work experience in a catalysis or method development lab, either during the completion of an advanced degree or in an industrial/manufacturing setting is required.
  • Individuals with strong interpersonal skills and experience working in interdisciplinary teams, particularly those with project and/or people management experience will be given preference.
  • Candidates who have demonstrated effective written and/or verbal communication of scientific results will be given preference.
Qualifications

  • Ph.D in Organic Chemistry or Chemical Engineering with an emphasis in catalysis preferred, MS in Chemistry or chemical engineering with work experience considered.
  • Experience with relevant analytical techniques
  • Candidates with a background in areas of biomass conversion, organic methodology, or protein chemistry are preferred. Candidates with background in alternate areas of chemistry and chemical engineering are considered.
title: Senior Formulation Scientist (Catalysis & Method Development)

description:
SUMMARY: Job function would entail execution assistance for 2 large projects. Projects will include the replacement of existing liquid handling robotics with Hamilton liquid handling platform. Develop requirements, experiments/DOEs, and help with transfer capabilities from one platform to another. Develop novel capabilities that expand.

  • Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or chemical industries is desirable.
  • Experience with chemical processes (preferably organic) preferred.
  • Experience with Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques is a plus,
  • Experience with high volume manufacturing in a high tech, high volume consumables industry is a plus.
  • High level computer skills are required.
  • Experience with product development processes and project management is a plus.
  • Good interdepartmental communication skills and documentation skills are required.
  • Demonstrated ability to accomplish goals while working across departments is required.
  • Create test plans for equipment and software that have stated use cases, requirements and specifications
  • Troubleshoot and resolve mechanical and instrumentation problems.
  • Ability to evaluate and test new automation technologies/platforms.
  • Advanced proficiency in programming Hamilton robotics is strongly desired (or other liquid handler programming experience)
  • Experience integrating Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) with automated systems. Core Informatics LIMS experience a plus
  • Experience working as a member of a process/product development team, developing high-reliable solutions according to specifications and timelines.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • B.S./M.S./ PhD in Chemical, Biochemical, Bio/Biotechnical Engineering or MS/PhD in Materials Science, Biochemistry or Chemistry with at least 2 years of relevant experience in production or research in support/sustaining and process definition, design, scale-up, improvement and validation.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • San Diego, CA 92121

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS): 5 years
  • Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques: 5 years
  • product development processes: 5 years
  • Hamilton liquid handling platform: 5 years

description:
Leading aerospace manufacturing organization looking to hire a high skilled Design Engineer immediately. Reporting to the Flash R&D; Leader, this engineer will work closely with other members of the team in order to meet the goals and objectives of the Research and Development function and support the development of manufacturing processes primarily as it pertains to the cathode and lamp products.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on flash lamp development projects in cross functional teams using our New Product Introduction (NPI) process.
  • Develop innovative cathode solutions and/or equipment from the pressing phase through the firing or infiltration phase
  • Develop next generation lamps with best in class performance working in conjunction with other sites globally.
  • Assist to optimize cathode technology and production across a wide range of end use applications
  • Support collaborative work with customers, suppliers and external resources to deepen our understanding of applications and technology and to maintain technical leadership.
  • Support the Manufacturing Engineering team developing our understanding of complex manufacturing processes and help introduce best practice globally.

Requirements:

  • BS or MS in Physics or Materials Science, other disciplines will be considered only with relevant professional experience.
  • Experience with Powder Metallurgy, Sintering, Pressing and high temperature furnaces, especially pertaining to refractory metals
  • Experience in the design and manufacture of lamps is preferred.
  • Knowledge of advanced analytic techniques (e.g. SEM/EDX, GDMS) Able to implement effective technical solutions to problems under own initiative.
  • Experience of project management and problem solving in a technical environment is preferred.
  • Experience working in a Six Sigma environment preferred but not required.
  • Must be a US citizen or Green Card holder

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • flash lamp development: 1 year
  • Powder Metallurgy, Sintering, Pressing and high temperature furnaces, especially refractory metals: 5 years

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Division

All of our plant-based feedstock evaluations and targeted isolation of our building blocks and value-added natural products (e.g., structural plant components, antioxidants, etc.) is carried out by our Extraction Sciences Team. Objectives and discoveries on this Team are realized by employing a combination of strong, technical expertise in chemistry, chemical engineering, materials, and mechanical processes and technologies, and close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel.

Job Description

Apeel Sciences is seeking a Senior Extraction Scientist with a background in synthetic organic chemistry, natural product isolation, or biomass conversion research (e.g., lignin or cellulose conversion to value-added products) for the Research and Development arm of Extraction Sciences. The candidate will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and performing experiments on biomass, including: extraction, isolation/purification of the individual components of the extracts, and analysis the extract’s composition using a multitude of analytical techniques (including but not limited to solution and solid state NMR, GC-MS, MALDI-TOF, UV-VIS, etc.). Furthermore, the candidate should be comfortable using standard organic chemistry techniques to modify extracts in order to generate novel materials as well as be comfortable synthesizing library molecules for which we have not yet perfected our extraction techniques. Senior Extraction Scientists are expected to regularly interface with formulation scientists, analytical scientists, protein scientists, process development engineers, and the product development team through a design-develop-test product development cycle. Successful candidates will have strong independent and critical thinking skills, along with a willingness to learn about new areas of research.

Additional Responsibilities Include:
  • The design and implementation of both independent and complimentary research programs aimed at advancing the core competencies of the Extraction Sciences team and Apeel Sciences.
  • Characterization of isolated or synthesized substances using standard analytical techniques, including but not limited to: NMR, IR, UV/Vis, MS, GC, and LC.
  • Experience with SFE is a strong bonus.
  • Management and analysis of research data.
  • A commitment to workplace safety through the adherence to corporate safety policies and industry best practices.
Qualifications

  • Ideal candidates for this position will hold a PhD in Chemistry with an emphasis in organic synthesis, natural product isolation, or biomass conversion research; a candidate with an MS in chemistry and work experience in organic synthesis, natural product isolation, or biomass conversion research will also be strongly considered.
  • Formal work experience in a synthetic organic chemistry lab, natural product isolation, or biomass conversion research either during the completion of an advanced degree or in an industrial/manufacturing setting is required.
  • Experience with mechanical systems is a strong asset.
  • Individuals with strong interpersonal skills and experience working in interdisciplinary teams, particularly those with project and/or people management experience will be given preference.
  • Candidates who have demonstrated effective written and/or verbal communication of scientific results will be given preference.
title: Senior Extraction Scientist

About This Division

Organic chemists, polymer chemists, and synthetic biologists form the core of our Formulation Sciences Team. The Team develops routes and new methodologies to create or reassemble natural building blocks for use in our products. This includes employing enzymes to enable cleaner and more selective chemistries to arrive at our building blocks. The Formulation Team works in close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel to enable outcomes and discoveries, which include but are not limited to, the development of chemical transformations that are amenable to fast, efficient, and robust scale-up to enable commercial scale production of our materials.

Job Description

Apeel Sciences is seeking a motivated, resourceful, and creative candidate with a background in polymer synthesis and characterization for the Polymer Science team of Formulation Sciences. An individual interested in this position will be responsible for the synthesis of new functional (bio)polymers for use in the pre- and post-harvest preservation of produce. Candidates are expected to be fully proficient in modern polymer synthesis techniques such as controlled radical, polycondensation, transition-metal mediated, and ring-opening polymerizations, among others. Senior Formulation Scientists on the polymer science team are expected to design, synthesize, and characterize new
polymers with specific properties and/or functions. Senior Formulation Scientists are expected to regularly interface with protein scientists, extraction engineers, and the product development team through a design-develop-test product development cycle.

Responsibilities and Outcomes (including but not limited to):
  • The design and implementation of individual polymer science research programs aimed at advancing the core competencies of the Formulation Sciences team and Apeel Sciences.
  • Characterization of synthesized polymers using standard analytical techniques, including but not limited to: NMR, IR, UV/Vis, SEC, DSC, and TGA.
  • Management and analysis of research data.
  • A commitment to workplace safety through the adherence to corporate safety policies.
Qualifications

  • Ideal candidates for this position will hold a Ph.D. in Materials Science, Polymer Sciences, or Chemistry with an emphasis in polymer science, but a candidate with an MS and work experience in polymer synthesis will also be strongly considered.
  • Formal work experience in a polymer science lab, either during the completion of an advanced degree or in an industrial/manufacturing setting is required.
  • Individuals with strong interpersonal skills and experience working in interdisciplinary teams, particularly those with project and/or people management experience will be given preference.
  • Candidates who have demonstrated effective written and/or verbal communication of scientific results will be given preference.
  • This role is specifically seeking a polymer scientist with an advanced degree. Candidates who lack a polymer science background or an advanced degree will not be considered.

Job Description

Apeel Sciences is seeking a motivated, resourceful, and creative candidate with a background in synthetic organic chemistry for the Molecular Design team of Formulation Sciences. An individual interested in this position will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and synthesizing new molecular candidates for our formulations. This includes molecular modifications to our existing extracts, as well as synthesis of molecules for which we have not yet perfected our extraction techniques. Senior Formulation Scientists on the Molecular Design team are encouraged to develop fully synthetic pathways for new molecular components that we can use to screen for novel formulation properties. Senior Formulation Scientists are expected to regularly interface with process engineers, extraction engineers, and the product development team through a design-develop-test product development cycle.

  • The design and implementation of both independent and complimentary synthetic research programs aimed at advancing the core competencies of the Formulation Sciences team and Apeel Sciences.
  • Characterization of synthesized substances using standard analytical techniques, including but not limited to: NMR, IR, UV/Vis, MS, GC, and LC.
  • Management and analysis of research data.
  • A commitment to workplace safety through the adherence to corporate safety policies and industry best practices.

  • Ideal candidates for this position will hold a Ph.D. in Chemistry with an emphasis in organic synthesis, but a candidate with an MS in chemistry and work experience in organic synthesis will also be strongly considered.
  • Formal work experience in a synthetic organic chemistry lab, either during the completion of an advanced degree or in an industrial/manufacturing setting is required.
  • Individuals with strong interpersonal skills and experience working in interdisciplinary teams, particularly those with project and/or people management experience will be given preference.
  • Candidates who have demonstrated effective written and/or verbal communication of scientific results will be given preference.
Qualifications

  • Ph.D in Organic Chemistry preferred, MS in Chemistry with work experience considered.
  • Experience with analytical techniques such as NMR, IR, UV/Vis, MS, GC, LC.
  • Candidates with a background in the area of total synthesis of complex molecules are preferred. Candidates with a background in new method development will also be considered.
  • This role is specifically seeking a synthetic chemist with an advanced degree. Candidates who lack a synthetic chemistry background or an advanced degree will not be considered.

Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Division

Organic chemists, polymer chemists, and synthetic biologists form the core of our Formulation Sciences Team. The Team develops routes and new methodologies to create or reassemble natural building blocks for use in our products. This includes employing enzymes to enable cleaner and more selective chemistries to arrive at our building blocks. The Formulation Team works in close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel to enable outcomes and discoveries, which include but are not limited to, the development of chemical transformations that are amenable to fast, efficient, and robust scale-up to enable commercial scale production of our materials.

Job Description

Apeel Sciences is seeking a motivated, resourceful, and creative candidate with a background in synthetic organic chemistry for the Process Chemistry team of Formulation Sciences. An individual interested in this position will be responsible for aiding the scale-up of existing formulation processes in preparation for commercial manufacturing. This includes process improvement, parameterization and safety analysis of existing reactions, as well as small scale manufacturing for in-house testing. Senior Formulation Scientists on the Process Chemistry team are encouraged to consider alternate reaction conditions and/or pathways to target molecules, which improve process separations, efficiency, and/or safety. Senior Formulation Engineers are expected to regularly interface with process engineers, extraction engineers, and the product development team through a design-develop-test product development cycle.

Responsibilities and Outcomes (including but not limited to):
  • The development and implementation of analytical systems for in-situ reaction monitoring, including but not limited to: NMR, IR, UV/Vis, MS, GC, and LC.
  • The implementation of current Good Manufacturing Processes (cGMP) on new formulation processes.
  • Management and analysis of research data.
  • A commitment to workplace safety through the adherence to corporate safety policies
Requirements

  • Ideal candidates for this position will hold a Ph.D. in Chemistry with an emphasis in organic synthesis, but a candidate with an MS in chemistry and work experience in organic synthesis will also be strongly considered.
  • Formal work experience in a synthetic organic chemistry lab, either during the completion of an advanced degree or in an industrial/manufacturing setting is required. Experience in process chemistry is preferred.
  • Individuals with strong interpersonal skills and experience working in interdisciplinary teams, particularly those with project and/or people management experience will be given preference.
  • Candidates who have demonstrated effective written and/or verbal communication of scientific results will be given preference.
Qualifications

  • Ph.D in Organic Chemistry preferred, MS in Chemistry with work experience considered.
  • Experience with analytical techniques such as NMR, IR, UV/Vis, MS, GC, LC.
  • Candidates with a background in areas of physical organic chemistry, such as mechanistic elucidation, byproduct identification and monitoring, and kinetic and thermodynamic analysis will be given preference.
  • This role is specifically seeking a process chemist. Candidates with chemical engineering backgrounds will not be considered without significant experience in organic synthesis.
title: Senior Formulation Scientist (Process Chemistry)

description:
IBM Research - Almaden (San Jose, CA) is searching for a postdoctoral researcher to work in two distinct roles (i) as a physical chemist using nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy (NMR) to characterize non-covalent interactions between purines and hydrogen bonding synthons, metals and strong acids. Evaluation of these materials will then lead to materials development where the researcherâs role will shift to focus on the synthesis of materials based on their NMR studies in the Almaden Synthetic Development Laboratory. This chemist will be responsible for the design, synthesis, and development of organic materials to support internal and joint R&D; projects. The particular focus area will be on the development of solid supported particles for the sequestration of targeted organic molecules.

Details:
We are seeking a highly motivated individual who is interested in joining our multi-disciplinary research team. The candidate should have a background in analytical techniques including NMR, UV-Vis spectroscopy and HPLC. In addition experience in synthetic organic chemistry (necessary for the synthesis of functionalized solid supports) is preferred. Familiarity with modern polymerization techniques (free-radical, ring-opening polymerization, anionicâŚetc.) as well as contemporary polymer analysis and characterization techniques would be helpful, but is not required. Although the primary role of this position is molecular design and synthesis, knowledge of materials science and materials characterization techniques would be advantageous.

The candidate should have written and oral communication skills as evidenced by a proven record of publications and presentations and demonstrated success in team-based projects. The scientist will be expected to identify key problems, generate novel solutions and reduce them to practice, disseminate the results of such activities to internal colleagues/partners and capture relevant intellectual property via patent applications.

4 years of experience in NMR Spectroscopy
4 years of experience in Chemical Synthesis
4 years of experience in Chemical Characterization

1 year experience in Supramolecular Chemistry
2 years in NMR Titrations
2 years in Characterization of Host-Guest interactions

description:
The Electromagnetic Systems division is responsible for the design and development of the Hyperloop Propulsion Motor, Levitation, and Guidance Systems. These systems are all electromechanical in nature and are designed by a highly cross-functional team of exceptional engineers in the areas of Electromagnetics, Mechanical Design, Heat Transfer, Materials Science, Testing, Controls and Embedded Systems, and Electrical System Modeling. We are seeking candidates with broad skillsets and various levels of experience to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals at our Los Angeles facility.

Responsibilities

The Electromagnetic Design Engineer is responsible for:
  • Electromagnetic analysis of various motors (both linear and rotating machinery), as well as analysis of levitation and guidance systems
  • Use of analytic tools (Excel, Matlab, SPEED) to characterize machine performance for basic sizing, weight, cost, power quality, thermal performance estimates
  • Analysis and verification of preliminary and detail designs with FEA (Maxwell and JMAG) in both 2D and 3D as well as other techniques (FRM)
  • Top-level motor and levitation system topology tradeoff studies
  • Support system integration efforts with Electromagnetic FEA calculation (define no-fly zones, compute EM loads during magnetic structure assembly for use in mechanical fixture designs)
  • Contribute to custom toolsets for electromagnetic analyses (Matlab and Python)
  • Working with internal teams and external vendors to ensure timely completion of functional hardware
Requirements

  • B.S. in Engineering or related discipline and 4+ years OR M.S. in Engineering or related discipline and 2+ years experience
  • Minimum 3 years experience in one of the following:
  • Rotary electric motors
  • Linear electric motors
  • Magnetic bearings
  • Maglev systems
  • Induction heating elements
  • Familiarity with motor drive architectures and motor control algorithms
  • Experience developing a product from concept to production
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Hyperloop One is an Equal Employment Employer; employment is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected status. Hyperloop One will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with the âBan the Boxâ legislation.

description:
ABOUT THE NRG COSIA CARBON XPRIZE

The NRG COSIA Carbon XPRIZE is a $20 million global competition to incentivize breakthroughs in the conversion of carbon dioxide (CO 2 ) into valuable products. The winning team will convert the most CO 2 into products with the highest net value. The competition is now in the “semi-final” stage, during which 27 teams from six countries will demonstrate pilot-scale systems that convert CO 2 into products.

The Carbon XPRIZE will prove to the world that energy innovation can enable solutions to climate change. By demonstrating breakthrough technologies that turn CO2 emissions into valuable products, the Carbon XPRIZE will catalyze the development of markets for CO 2 mitigation technologies, and inspire other industries, governments, and educational institutions to take concrete positive action to combat climate change. In success, the competition will help shift the public sentiment to be more optimistic about climate change.

The XPRIZE Foundation is seeking an experienced, creative, and skilled engineer, technologist, scientist, or technical manager to support and drive technical and operational aspects of the NRG COSIA Carbon XPRIZE.

The Engineering Operations Manager will support the project in all areas relating to the day-to-day scientific and engineering operations of the competition. This person will assume primary responsibility for managing and supporting workflows of key external contractors, building templates and tools to evaluate team performance and competition scores, and supporting the external judging panel in their deliberations and evaluation of team performance. The Engineering Operations Manager will also support the Domain Lead for Energy and Prize Manager in managing day to day competition operations, execution of the field tests and technology validation in the competition semi-finals and finals, working with external partners to oversee construction of test facilities in the competition finals, and managing updates and publication of the competition Rules and Regulations.

Experience designing and/or managing large technical programs that involve testing and evaluation in either a laboratory environment and under real-world conditions will be a significant asset.

Ideally, this person will have a strong background in the science and technology of energy systems, carbon management technologies, chemical or materials engineering, materials and manufacturing, clean energy, and/or related hardware development. This person does not need to be an expert in CO 2 conversion. However, the ideal candidate should be comfortable acquiring knowledge relevant to the wide array of technologies and processes reflective of the competing teams. The Engineering and Operations Manager will be expected over time to develop subject matter expertise in all technical and science components of the Prize. S/he may be asked to represent the prize and XPRIZE Foundation at external events (e.g. technical conferences, panels, etc.).

GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES AT XPRIZE

XPRIZE is a cross-matrixed organization. This means that most staff members are shared across multiple projects at any given time, or move across projects as they evolve. While the Engineering Operations Manager will have a primary responsibility to the NRG COSIA Carbon XPRIZE, it is anticipated that in future there may be opportunities to contribute to the operations of other prize competitions, design and launch future XPRIZE competitions, and/or help drive XPRIZE impact programs. The ideal candidate will combine technical expertise and knowhow with creativity, people skills, and an ability and desire to learn new things and take on new projects.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

MSc, MEng or other advanced degree plus relevant experience

Two years’ minimum experience in some of the following areas:
Energy Systems

Environmental Technologies

Greenhouse gas technologies

Chemical Engineering

Materials Science

Materials Engineering

Data Management

Techno-Economic Analysis

Climate Science

Carbon Cycle

A general understanding of the energy, natural resources, and environment landscape, including the role of carbon emissions in that landscape, in North America and globally

Ability and desire to work across disciplines

Creative problem-solving

Experienced in working collaboratively with a wide variety of stakeholders from academia to government agencies and the private sector

Experience with written and verbal communications that may be technical in nature

Some experience with project or program management

Outstanding attention to detail

PERSONAL ABILITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

Self-starter who takes the initiative to develop projects, completes tasks on time, solves roadblocks and addresses issues before they become problems

Collaborative approach and appreciation/enjoyment working as part of a team

A demonstrated ability to respect and support peers

Willingness to, from time to time, to go the extra mile to complete a project or support a colleague

Exceptional organizational abilities and aggressive attention to detail

Rigorous time management

Creative and enthusiastic approach

Prioritization skills and ability to multi-task

Personable and professional demeanor

Patience and flexibility

Incredible interpersonal skills and can-do attitude

Sense of humor and work-life balance

Belief that a small group of motivated individuals can truly change the world for the better

Willingness to think and act creatively

XPRIZE FOUNDATION

Founded in 1995, XPRIZE, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, is the leading organization solving the world’s Grand Challenges by creating and managing large-scale, high-profile, incentivized prize competitions that stimulate investment in research and development worth far more than the prize itself. The organization motivates and inspires brilliant innovators from all disciplines to leverage their intellectual and financial capital for the benefit of humanity. XPRIZE conducts competitions in five Prize Groups: Learning; Exploration; Energy & Environment; Global Development; and Life Sciences. Active prizes include the $30 million Google Lunar XPRIZE, the $20 million NRG COSIA Carbon XPRIZE, $10 million Qualcomm Tricorder XPRIZE, the $15 million Global Learning XPRIZE, the $7 million Ocean Discovery XPRIZE, the $7 million Barbara Bush Foundation Adult Literacy XPRIZE, the $5 million IBM Artificial Intelligence XPRIZE, the $1.75 million Water Abundance XPRIZE, and the $2 million Anu & Naveen Jain Women’s Safety XPRIZE. For more information, go to www.xprize.org .
title: Engineering Operations Manager, NRG Cosia Carbon XPRIZE

description:
Engility is recruiting for a High Performance Computing (HPC) User Services Lead for a large Scientific Program within the government space. This is a HPC focused program that will be responsible for the full lifecycle of HPC services from technology identification and road mapping, HPC architecture design, development, acquisition integration and testing through operations including 24/7 user support.

This individual will be critical for understanding our customer and supporting the programâs many users with respect to the wide array of upgrades/enhancements being made to its HPC infrastructure. The program will focus on updating and, implementing technologies into the customer HPC infrastructure and services with the goal of seamless integration with minimal downtime for the systems and its users. The User Services Manager will be responsible for the many different domain areas the system supports, so knowledge in a multitude of these areas will be needed (see below for specific areas).

The HPC User Services Lead will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and optimization of codes; support for modeling and simulation, and support for scientific visualization and data analytics. A component of this work will be porting traditional parallel codes to novel architectures such as the massively parallel, multi-threaded environment(s) of GPUs and Intel MICs. This will include performance improvements from CPU to GPU, improving existing algorithms to increase the speed of specific modeling techniques, as well as optimizing and tuning systems for overall accelerated productivity.

Typical Duties and Responsibilities:
BS in STEM related discipline
14 years overall experience with 12~ years experience working in an HPC environment
Knowledge of current HPC technology both the science and IT domains
HPC Domain knowledge in at least one of the following is necessary: Application Computing, Materials Science, Chemistry, Fluid Dynamics
Familiarity with NASA science and engineering applications

Required Qualifications:
MS in STEM related discipline
Previous NASA, Space Remote Sensing and/or Science, and/or DOE experience
Experience working in Academia within a large data center/computing environment
ITIL, RHCE, Agile or like certifications
Current DoD clearance desired, but will process for the right candidate

description:
As Principal Reliability Engineer, you will play a key role in creating and improving new electronic
products that meet a high bar for reliability and performance. You will work closely with the
product management and design engineering teams to define standards, specify tests, and then
supervise test execution and failure analysis. A broad engineering background and command of
statistical methods will help to inform design of new products. Your strong interpersonal and
communication skills will be key to ensuring adoption of your technical recommendations.

Responsibilities:
  • Translate product management reliability goals into appropriate testable targets.
  • Facilitate efficient and actionable DFMEA risk analysis.
  • Lead reliability test planning, methodology and execution for all aspects of the product.
  • Drive failure analysis process for all failures discovered during reliability testing.
  • Develop reliability performance metrics and lead management reviews to review progress against those metrics.

Qualifications: Minimum qualifications:
  • BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Materials Science or
  • equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience with reliability engineering for consumer products or similar.
  • Statistical analysis experience including Monte Carlo Analysis, DoE, SPC, Gage R&R.;
  • Experience in applying design for reliability techniques such as FTA and DFMEA.
  • Experience with reliability modeling techniques such as Weibull, physics of failure
  • lifetime modeling and reliability block diagrams.

Preferred qualifications:
  • Masterâs degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Materials
  • Science or other technical field.
  • Experience working with manufacturing partners.
  • Leadership experience; ability to summarize and communicate issues to executives.
  • Well versed in organizational problem solving via CAPA and 8D process.
  • Experience with failure analysis techniques for electrical, mechanical or optical
  • components.
  • American Society for Quality Certified Reliability Engineer

Support technology development by creating device layouts and test structures. Use process control and electrical data to evolve device designs. Create phenomenological and/or physics based models to guide device development. Must be able to develop, conduct, and analyze laboratory experiments, write and edit effective research reports, and collaborate and communicate with team members in a goal-driven development effort. Must be able to present ideas and results in effective technical presentations and write technical papers and contribute to research proposals.

description:
As a Metrology Scientist, you will provide technical leadership in new product introduction and production process development, improvement and sustaining efforts in a high volume biotech manufacturing environment. You will work with R&D;, Quality, Manufacturing and other engineering groups to develop and implement test methods and metrology for new and existing products.

All About You

Responsibilities:
• Identify, select, develop, qualify, implement, and validate test methods and/or measurement systems for use in consumables manufacturing.
• Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's and gauge R&R; studies) to optimize test methods/equipment, and resolve quality issues.
• Analyze test results, issue reports and make technical recommendations.
• Work cross functionally with R&D;, Manufacturing and Quality to develop metrology processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
• Provide technical leadership to ensure optimal performance of production test methods and equipment.
• Define technical requirements and write procedures for inspection processes.
• Support development and transfer new processes/products to production and enhance their robustness.
• Drive implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals.

Education & Experience Requirements:
• B.S. & 5+ yrs experience/M.S. & 3+ yrs experience/Ph.D. in: Materials Science or Physical Chemistry, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biochemical/Biomedical/Biotechnical Engineering, Bioengineering
• Experience with developing analytical methods and tests for surface/materials characterization
• Experience with chromatographic, rheometric, and chemical material characterization techniques
• Strong background in surface characterization using complex measurement systems such as SEM, XPS, TOF-SIMS, AFM, tensiometry, FTIR, Raman spectroscopy, fluorescence/optical microscopy, profilometry, and vision systems
• Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or semiconductor industries is desirable
• High level problem solving and reasoning skills required.

• High-level experience with complex statistical analyses, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques required.

Software communication and application programming interface/wrapper knowledge strongly desired. Experience with turnkey solutions, integration, and custom applications desired.
• Experience with large volume manufacturing in a high tech consumables industry is required.
• Experience with product development processes and project management is a plus.
• Experience with physical and chemical processes, microfluidics, and complex assemblies a plus
• Good interdepartmental communication skills and documentation skills are required.
• Demonstrated ability to prioritize and accomplish goals while working across departments is essential.
