description:
Job Field: REDE - Research & Development
Location: Fremont, CA, US
Company: BASF Corporation
Job Type: Standard
Job ID: EN_US_1700673

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.
We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.
And we are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Best Employers in 2016. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
Where the Chemistry Happens…
We are seeking a Manager to lead our California Research Alliance (CARA) by BASF. The Manager is responsible for the management and further development of the Advanced Materials and Systems Research (RA/I) activities at CARA. CARA is comprised of collaborative research and development projects lead jointly by faculty and staff of public and private schools in California.
Additionally, the CARA Post-Doc Center Manager is responsible for exploring and connecting with relevant innovation centers and technology start up companies in California and the US West Coast. CARA Post-Doc Center Manager defines the broad general objectives of the technology scouting and then establishes long term and short term action plans and implements the plans in order to achieve the research objectives.
As BASF continues to grow and expand its businesses beyond traditional markets, the NA academic innovation environment continues to be a valuable source of ideas and technologies for innovation and new product development. In order to promote the BASF competitive advantage, regionally resident university research resources are highly desired to quickly and effectively address the BASF research and customer needs.
Manager, California Research Alliance (CARA) (1700673)
You will coordinate and facilitate the activities of the Advanced Materials and Systems research platform as well as relevant business units engaged in joint research work at institutions in California. You will work to further the expansion of the presence of BASF presence in California in research and development as well as serve as a key focal point for technology scouting in collaboration with top universities, venture capital firms, technology startups and companies for materials science and engineering. You will maintain the existing BASF network of relationships with scientists and staff at these institutions as well as develop further connections and networks with technology leaders in one of North America’s premier locations for innovation.
In addition, you will facilitate the establishment of a portfolio of business-relevant research projects with the universities’ faculty, an additional key deliverable is to identify technologies early that are relevant for the BASF group. You will increase visibility and enhance branding of BASF at leading US universities in California to get early access to new technologies and will organize visits of experts and management as well as workshops designed to establish collaborative research projects.
You will actively solicit project technology themes from the business units and research platforms which are associated with materials technologies. In union with the sponsoring unit, you will assist in the formulation of research projects to be pursued at the universities. Further, you will represent the talent recruitment efforts of BASF by identifying top talent to the BASF University Recruiting department.

Formula for Success: You Will…
  • Identify and establish meaningful relationships with high performing academics, engaging post-doctoral fellows, researchers, and graduate students in exploration and development of technologies germane to industrial research requirements.
  • Understand complex business, technical and operational landscapes requiring knowledge of BASF and partners’ organizations to achieve results within the framework of the BASF research master agreement.
  • Strategically develop multiple technologies and chemistries
  • Balance resources against shifting priorities, developing personnel and cost budgets to execute research and capital plans within time and resource limitations with multiple stakeholders.
  • Effectively execute event planning, hosting and following up for key exchange events involving scientists, engineers and technologists of academic partners and BASF
  • Influence and negotiate with internal and external stakeholders on a regional and global basis.
  • Manage challenging situations and resolve escalated issues pertaining to contracts, intellectual property, budgets, schedules, relationship management and resources and priorities.
  • Engage in negotiations for project work package definition and deliverables.
  • Provide effective administrative support and management for other research groups
  • EHS Champion in support of the BASF goals for sustainability
  • Represent company interests at universities, while championing university faculty/ideas and concepts within BASF
  • Organize and manage multiple priorities and maintain clear customer focus and communication as priorities change
  • Assess technical feasibility of ideas and concepts
  • Lead by example and sets environment for taking risks within the organization by addressing constraints and enabling resources
  • Foster the integration of a diversity of perspectives across the organization resulting in development of high performing teams and output
  • Lead multi-lateral negotiations
  • Engage in negotiations for project work package definition and deliverables
  • Fosters the integration of a diversity of perspectives across the organization resulting in development of high performing teams and output
  • Involves, trusts, and optimizes a diverse, high performing environment and creates a vision that fosters a sense of common ownership
·

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…
Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry.
The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…
Ph.D. degree in chemistry, physics, chemical engineering or materials science and minimum 4 years in industrial research including product development and innovation processes
Hands-on business experience is a big plus.
  • Broad knowledge in materials science
Experience in project management and leadership (at least in R&D;)
  • Understanding of the global business and R&D; landscape of BASF
Proven track record of collaborations with academic partners
Experience with external collaborations, intellectual property rights including licensing and legal contracts with public and private partners
Continuous contributions to the scientific literature
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to establish sustainable internal and external relationships

Knowledge/Skills

  • Has strong global technical network and able to lead global strategic research topics
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively influence and impact both externally as well as internally.
  • Inspires others and takes accountability for an innovation pipeline by championing and discerning new and creative approaches
  • Involves, trusts, and optimizes a diverse, high performing environment and creates a vision that fosters a sense of common ownership
  • Ability to communicate effectively at all levels with internal and external partners

description:
Princip al Process Integration Engineer

Lead p rocess e ngineer responsible for developing unit processes and integration of BEOL in silicon for bonding applications in both wafer to wafer and die to wafer applications. The successful candidate will w ork closely with the team to develop the clean room processes required to drive high yielding 2.5, 3D and hybrid wafer to wafer and die to wafer applications for industry. This position is hands on and requires developing unit processes , integrating these processes to develop a technology and continuously transferring these processes to coworkers and custome rs. A s we transfer the technology to our licensees /customers , you will have the opportunity to work with our customers to ensure the success of the technology transfer of our process to their facility. A keen sense of root cause analysis within the realm of process development and integration will be helpful. In addition to the wafer process integration, you will interface with the assembly team to drive innovative solutions in thin die handling for bonding technologies. Creation and execution of DOEs and statistical analysis to define the process windows combined with statistics will be necessary.

Requirements:
  • PhD in Materials Science, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering or Applied Physics with a min imum of 10 years of experience in industry .
  • Hands on experience in silicon process technology and integration, in both R&D; and manufacturing environments
  • F amiliar with the latest silicon processing including chemical mechanical polishing, Cu deposition, through silicon vias , low temperature oxides, nitrides
  • Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and bring useful contributions in different application fi e l ds .
  • Wafer ( heterogeneous/ homogeneous ) bonding experience
  • Familiar with Auger, SIMS, SEM, EDS, AFM, Ellipsometry and other standard characterization techniques for metrology of the cleaning, dicing, bonding and wafer fabrication specifications in our processes.
  • Understands the electrical and mechanical properties of materials and the tradeoffs in process integration on material properties.
  • Strong understanding of fundamentals with pragmatic approach to technology development
  • Highly technical individual with the unique combination of great organization and communication skills to work with teammates at various experience levels (technician, engineer, principal engineer).
Additional Experience a Plus:
  • Experience in MEMs processing integration
  • Assembly p ac kaging experience at 2.5, 3D or multichip modules
  • RF applications experience
title: Principal Process Integration Engineer

description:
Senior ProcessEngineer
Senior Process Engineer will be working as a key member of the device fabrication team for semiconductor lasers and photonic integrated circuits (PICs) for a variety of applications. Examples include both integrated active and passive photonic devices, in III-V and Si based platforms. The following job duties are of equal importance:
  • Participate hands-on in day-to-day semiconductor device fabrication working with fabrication engineers and technicians
  • Design, develop and qualify compound semiconductor wafer fabrication processes
  • Integrate various processes and develop wafer fabrication process flows for new product introductions
  • Improve various wafer Fab processes for manufacturability, design robustness, cycle time reduction, yield improvement, and cost saving
  • Conduct process capability analysis, failure mode analysis, and SPC review for continuous design and process improvement
  • Document process specifications, process work instructions and train production personnel when needed
  • Work very closely with different functional teams for device design, product development and process development including backend dicing/polishing and chip assembly processes
Requirements:
  • Advanced degree in Physics, Electrical Engineering, or Materials Science with emphasis in semiconductor materials and device fabrication
  • Knowledge of various wafer fab processes, such as photolithography, annealing, compound semiconductor wet etch and dry etch, thin film coating, metallization, dicing and polishing is crucial
  • Hands-on experience in wafer fab process development and process integration is preferred
  • In-depth knowledge and experience in semiconductor device physics and wafer process is highly preferred
  • Knowledge and experience in semiconductor material and device characterization tools, such as SEM, AFM, FIB, TEM, element analysis such as EDX, Auger, XPS and SIMS is a plus
  • The ability to learn new processes and technologies quickly is a plus
  • A self-motivated and directed individual is preferred
title: Senior Process Engineer

Job Title: NDT Radiography LevelI Technician

Department: Radiographic Testing

FLSA Status: Full-Time, Hourly/Non-Exempt

Purposeof this Position
The NDT Radiography Level I Technician willassist and facilitate the testing of an assortment of specimens through the useof radiographic equipment, processes and procedures. In this role thetechnician will be responsible for providing reliable results while payingclose attention to detail, safety and project timelines.

EssentialDuties and Responsibilities: Conducts a variety of tests using established methods. Prepares test specimens, sets up and adjusts test equipment and records test data. Analyzes and interprets test data verifying the information matches the work orders. Maintains related test equipment, tools, and machinery in good working condition. Works flexible hours and overtime when required. Complete reports using prescribed technology to include x-rays and computers. Provides excellent customer service when required. Performs other duties as assigned by the department supervisor or manager. Maintain a clean work station as well as participating in the cleaning and organizing of the darkroom on a weekly basis; will be assigned by the department manager. Follow the rules noted in the company employee manual at all times. Attend production meeting when required. Provide status updates of daily assigned jobs; information will be requested 4 to 6 hours after your shift begins. Follow company safety policies at times.

Thisposition does not supervise staff.

Or

previous qualification orcertification in at least one NDT method.

Ability to calculate figures and amounts suchas discounts, interest, commissions and proportions. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebraand geometry.

Reasoning Ability
Ability to solve practical problems and dealwith a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limitedstandardization exists. Ability tointerpret a variety of instructions, data and details furnished in written,oral, diagram, or schedule form.

The physical demands and workenvironment described here are representative of those that must be met by anemployee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilitiesto perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of thisJob, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee isfrequently required to stand; walk; sit and use hands tofinger, handle, or feel.
Required to routinely lift up to andno more than 50 pounds

Position is primarily based in alaboratory environment. Technicians will be exposed to, but may not come incontact with, noise, dust, dirt, oils, and other industrial airborne particles.

description:
– Office of the CTO

Overview

Lam Research is at the forefront of innovation in supplying sophisticated wafer fabrication equipment and services to the worldwide semiconductor industry. Virtually every leading-edge electronic device in our lives – from our smartphones and tablets to our cars and televisions – has been made using equipment from Lam Research. Headquartered in Fremont, Lam Research maintains a network of facilities throughout the United States, Asia, and Europe to meet the complex and changing needs of our global customer base. This position is based in our Fremont, CA facility. “A company where successful people want to work” http://www.lamresearch.com

The Challenge

The CTO organization, Corporate Technology Development (CTD), is responsible for long term research for current businesses ( >5 years out as well as disruptive approaches to long standing challenges) – working with external and internal stakeholders to identify and provide game changing emerging semiconductor manufacturing technologies. The Technology Scouting function is chartered with identification and evaluation of relevant emerging technologies from external entities (universities, start-ups and industrial partners) and facilitate the sourcing of those technologies that improve differentiation and speed to solutions in collaboration with our Strategic Development team.

In this position, Lam Research is seeking a Technology Scout to build the function – first developing the scouting or ‘long term technology needs’ list and then establishing a network of external sources to identify and evaluate technologies. The Technology Scout will build relationships with internal and external stakeholders, identify and report on emerging technologies and manage R&D; evaluations in collaboration with technologists. The Technology Scout will be recognized as a key source of technology intelligence and expert on emerging semiconductor manufacturing materials & processes that may be relevant to Lam’s businesses. This position reports to the Sr. Director, Strategy & Communications in the CTO Office. Up to 25% travel may be required.

What You’ll Do

Develop key understanding of long term development for the semiconductor equipment industry; this includes, for example, resulting equipment risks and opportunities resulting from future device structures.

Develop and prioritize a scouting or needs list of enabling long term technologies by interviewing key internal stakeholders on tech roadmaps and trends, pain points, long term challenges.

Map the technology space: start with understanding emerging semiconductor technologies, but also explore beyond semi for semi based on needs list.

Identify incubators, start-ups, industry associations, analysts, peers, companies, academicians and others to build into our network of informants and collaborators. Manage relationships.

Gather information, digest it and publish emerging technology intelligence reports and briefings for internal stakeholders.

Identify key technologies and companies that we should evaluate – partner with relevant internal technologists on evaluations.

Analyze evaluation results and make well informed and well-reasoned strategic recommendations to the decision makers with Lam.

Partner with Strategic Development throughout the process and develop a seamless handoff process for deal execution (venture investment, license agreement, acquisition, JDA, etc.).

Help support and evolve our technology scouting strategy and tactics; benchmark with peers.

Prepare relevant presentation materials as necessary both internal and external.

Promote the company by participation in expert panels, and with papers at conferences.

Other duties as assigned

What You Need to Succeed

Deep love and curiosity for science and technology from both the semiconductor industry as well as a reasonable set of other industries. We expect the ideal candidate to be an avid reader of relevant blogs, attend semiconductor and other related conferences, and participate in other techno events as well.

Lateral thinker - ability to make non obvious technology connections and have the technical competence to discuss many aspects of relevant technologies.

Ability to understand the technologies under consideration, but also think strategically about their application for the types of products and services that Lam Research provides.

Great communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to engage and adapt communication style between highly technical and business personnel and at all levels of the organization (engineer to C-suite) as well as externally.

Great collaboration and stakeholder management skills. Ability to gain mind share through valued interactions and win win mindset.

A masters in technical discipline (chemistry, materials science, physics, engineering discipline) and preferably an MBA.

A minimum of 7 years’ experience working in the silicon semiconductor manufacturing industry and knowledge of all pertinent technologies in semiconductor equipment (automation and robotics, software and controls, hardware components, equipment, spares and service, materials, etc.).

Fluency in semiconductor manufacturing technology and customers and specifically an understanding of the principles and techniques used in semiconductor research, to allow for the evaluation of new technologies. Prior experience in technical role highly desirable.

Established relationships with start ups, university incubators and at all points of the value chain

Demonstrated leadership and ability to influence colleagues and peers to achieve goals and drive decision making is required.

Serious attention to detail, well organized and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities.

Ability to manage and effectively utilize consultants and research firms.

Self-motivated individual, highly collaborative and great attitude.

Proficiency with PowerPoint, Sharepoint, Excel and MS Word.

For more information or questions, feel free to contact the hiring manager, Lubab Sheet-Davis at lubab.sheet-davis@lamresearch.com or 1.510.572.2464

description:
Caldera Medical is a rapidly growing medical device company located in Agoura Hills, CA and is focused on designing, manufacturing, marketing and selling implantable grafts into the Gynecology, Urology and Urogynecology surgical markets.

The RA/QA Engineer is responsible for the maintenance of the Quality System. All RA/QA employees shall seek to develop a quality- and results-centric company culture that drives customer satisfaction, employee satisfaction, meaningful regulatory compliance, and continually improving operational excellence. The RA/QA Engineer is responsible for identifying, evaluating, and ensuring meaningful compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and standards. Efforts to ensure company compliance shall be inherently established within the company’s Quality System.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Routinely pursue more efficient and effective operations (continual improvement).
  • Assist in incoming inspection of raw materials and product, as needed.
  • Inspect reusable product following reprocessing and perform inventory transfer, as needed.
  • Facilitate processing of Nonconforming Material Reports and Rework Orders.
  • Assure the quality of products and services, by creating, implementing, the Quality System including pertinent quality control tests and inspections and engineering change order support.
  • Assist with the creation, maintenance, and performance of change management tools: Corrective Action Reports (CA’s), Preventive Action Reports (PA’s), and Document Change Orders (DCO’s).
  • Participate in Supplier Management activities, as required.
  • Participate in the development of Management Review Presentations.
  • Participate in 3rd party audit and inspection activities (ISO, FDA, etc.)
  • Coordinate the creation, execution, and validation of all change orders.
  • Initiate and maintain pertinent metrics, trending, and statistical analysis.
  • Ensure that reasonable risk management controls are in place.
  • Collaborate with engineering to determine and execute engineering DHF plans in support of regulatory submissions.
  • Shall carefully review Work Order fulfillment activities to ensure completeness of manufacturing and installation work activities and assigned rework activities.
  • Shall review Device History Record (DHR) deliverables to ensure that production activities comply with Mandatory Device Master Record (DMR) requirements.
  • Review all Engineering Change Requests and Engineering Change Orders to ensure sound engineering practice, effective and adequate design, product safety, and Quality System compliance.
  • Remain aware of new or updated regulations, laws, standards and other official enactments that may apply to the company.
  • Provide detailed analysis, official recommendations, and gap analyses for new or revised enactments.
  • Assist/Perform root cause analysis for product complaints and non-conformances and document accordingly,
  • Submit medical device adverse and field corrective actions reports and recall notifications.
  • Assist in the submittal of registration applications. May assist in the preparation of IDE, 510(k), PMA, CE Mark, and other related regulatory filings.
  • May interface with FDA and other regulatory agencies regarding regulatory submission strategy and approval reviews, as per company marketing plans.
  • Shall participate in cross-functional design review teams to review all product improvement Design Inputs and potential Defect Reports. RA/QA Engineers shall focus on recognizing potential impacts to health or device efficacy (“Safety Issues”), criticality assessment, to ensure the application of reasonable and required Risk Management, Verification and Validation, and adequate record-keeping practices.
  • Other duties, as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • A Bachelor’s of Science Degree in engineering or biology-related science. Examples include biomedical/bioengineering, mechanical engineering, industrial engineering, or biological sciences, microbiology, materials science.
  • 3-5 years in a similar position involving medical device or pharmaceutical quality engineering duties.
  • Regular practice of RA/QA skills and activities.
  • Effectively manage multiple projects at once.
  • Excellent business and technical writing.
  • Experience with medical device development under FDA Quality Systems Regulations, European Union Medical Device Directive (93/42/EEC), CE Marking process, and ISO standards.
Compensation:
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Medical / Dental Benefits – 75% paid for employee and their family
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contributions
  • Basic Life and AD&D;
  • Unlimited Vacation
  • 6 Weeks Paid Maternity Leave
  • Kitchen stocked with free snacks and drinks
  • Surrounded by smart and engaged co-workers

description:
Illumina is looking for a highly motivated, energetic individual that is creative and strategic with a drive to deliver results in a fast-paced innovative space. This attorney joins a dynamic legal team and will be the legal advisor and strategist for product development projects and related portfolios. Responsibilities include capturing inventions, building enforceable global patent portfolios as well as setting and advising on IP strategy to create long term business value. Location will be Illumina’s San Diego Headquarters.

All About You

Responsibilities:
  • Drafts and prosecutes global patent applications.
  • Develops and executes against a forward looking IP strategy for projects and portfolios in line with company business goals.
  • Collaborates within and across business units to identify and capture high value innovation.
  • Cost-effectively manages high quality patent prosecution work by outside counsel in the US and abroad.
  • Effectively partners with product development teams to shape IP strategy for product offering.
  • Provides value/risk assessment on third party IP estates and/or landscapes for collaborations, consortiums and other third party complex agreements.
  • Contributes to intellectual property assessments in mergers, acquisitions and investments.
  • Works strategically and collaboratively with IP litigation team.
  • Contributes to educational efforts across business on best practices for IP and other legal matters.
  • Drives operational excellence within legal and across the business.

All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.

Requirements:

  • Top tier law firm experience strongly preferred.

description:
Job Description:

Major duties and responsibilities of this position include:
  • Routine technical and programmatic interface with JPL Project Managers, Project Element Managers, Task Managers, and Mission Assurance Managers to develop appropriate reliability engineering requirements and plans for JPL Space Projects.

  • Lead and perform duties related to the selection, procurement, manufacture, use, and/or testing/screening of electronic parts in high reliability applications.

  • Apply expert knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications and systems.

  • Provide technical oversight of flight electronic parts tasks including the creation of engineering requirements specifications and drawings, and advising projects on part selections maximizing reliability while considering cost and schedule constraints.

  • Apply extensive understanding of part and project risk knowledge to define part reliability and quality requirements and assess risks associated with waivers, deficiencies, and failures.

  • Support project system and design teams, advise projects on the electronic part selection that maximizes reliability while considering schedule and cost constraints.

  • Apply advanced understanding of electronic parts and project risk to define part quality requirements at onset of project work.

  • Report on screening and/or failure test results and advise senior management and project.

  • Advise project management on highly complex electronic part selections that maximize reliability while considering schedule and cost constraints.

  • Position supports continuous refinement and improvement of development methodologies and processes.

  • Position supports project team meetings and reviews, with a high degree of personal and professional responsibility.
Required Skills:
  • Requires Bachelor of Science degree with equivalent course work in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Materials Science/Engineering, Applied Mathematics or related technical discipline.

  • Requires 25 years of experience in parts engineering activities.

  • Must be a U.S. Citizen

  • Must be able to pass a National Agency Check

  • Experience must include expert knowledge in one or more of the following areas - RF Parts, Hybrid Parts, Photonics, VLSI Microelectronics or Passives Parts in support of parts development, fabrication, manufacturing, process integration, reliability assessment, and test and/or qualification.

  • Extensive understanding and experience in the selection, procurement, manufacture, use, and testing/screening of high reliability electronic parts for spaceflight applications.

  • Professional experience with EEE parts and supporting Mil-STDs.

  • Requires an understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in electronic parts technologies resulting in contributions to the development of new test and qualification methodologies.

  • Ability to work well with cross-functional reams, design engineers, line management, and project management.

  • Excellent computer skills, including and use of computer-aided engineering tools.

  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills, and ability to work with multiple interfaces is required.
Other Desired Skills:
  • Preferred knowledge of DoD, NASA, and JEDEC specifications and requirements related to electronic parts.

  • Clearance level at Secret/Top Secret level desired.
Bastion participates in E-Verify and EEO

description:
-------------
About Citrine
-------------

Citrine is the artificial intelligence platform for materials and chemicals. Our platform ingests and understands large-scale data from countless sources, such as patents, research papers, technical reports, and existing databases, and uses state-of-the-art AI to anticipate the behavior of all materials and chemicals under any relevant conditions. Check out our outstanding group of customers and partners ( http://www.citrine.io/partners ). Citrine is backed by top tier Silicon Valley venture capital firms including: Innovation Endeavors, Data Collective, Prelude Ventures, AME Cloud Ventures, Morado Ventures, and XSeed Capital.

----------------
Position Summary
----------------

Citrine's Scientific Community Manager (SCM) will be the driving force behind the rapid growth and cohesion of the international data-driven materials science and chemistry research community. Citrine presently faces an exciting opportunity and challenge: creating and engaging a global community of researchers dedicated to transforming materials science and chemistry with data and data analysis at an unprecedented scale. Our SCM works on a daily basis with researchers at universities, government laboratories, and consortia, and fosters a vibrant community for these researchers built around the free and open Citrination platform. Drawing on his or her domain expertise and superlative communication skills, Citrine’s SCM makes it easy, fun, and appealing for materials and chemistry researchers to uses the Citrination platform to store, search, and model data.

-------------------------
Specific Responsibilities
-------------------------

  • Design and execution of large-scale community-building initiatives
  • Prioritizing possible community initiatives with quantitative cost-benefit analyses
  • Obtaining product-related feedback from the research community and communicating it to relevant Citrine product managers
  • Real-time tracking of community growth and engagement metrics
  • Proactive communication of community opportunities and challenges to Citrine executive team, particularly the Chief Science Officer
  • Deployment of Citrine’s platform as a constructive force for democratization of materials and chemistry data and research
  • Training research community on Citrine platform tools
  • Engagement with Citrine’s scientific advisory board, a group of world-leading researchers in a variety of materials and chemistry sub-disciplines
  • Development of formal partnerships with organizations such as professional societies and universities
  • Travel to workshops, conferences, and seminars on Citrine’s behalf
-------------------------
Skills & Requirements
-------------------------

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field; advanced degrees in fields related to materials science strongly preferred
  • Proven ability to bring people together and create community, especially in technical contexts
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills, and a strong desire to engage with the research community on an ongoing basis
  • Proven ability to engage a diverse range of stakeholders in pursuit of a shared goal
  • Proven ability to teach new tools or methodologies to technical audiences
  • Proven ability to persuade third parties to take action
  • Strong plus, but not required: Experience building community with social media tools
This posting open to those with existing legal right to work in the United States. Citrine Informatics is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, or national origin.

description:
At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone – at every level in every function – is encouraged to have original ideas, to express them and to share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we invest in our employees’ ideas to change lives and the way people work. As the 3D Materials Lead you will;

title: 3D Materials Development Lead

description:
About PAX Labs:
PAX Labs is making smoking obsolete. Founded in 2007 by two Stanford graduates, the company is a leader in portable heat-not-burn, vaporization technology. PAX Labs has revolutionized the smoking industry by offering new, heat-non-burn experiences under the PAX and JUUL brands. With technology innovation and product design at the forefront, PAX Labs has sold over one million PAX devices (MSRP $280) in the loose leaf vaporizer category and JUUL (MSRP $50) is the number two selling U.S.-based independent e-cigarette, selling over one million JUUL pods per month. Drawing on the successful business and technology design of JUUL, PAX Era, a seamless extract pod system for extracts, was introduced in September 2016. Headquartered in San Francisco and backed by leading investors like Fidelity Investment and Tao Capital, PAX Labs is disrupting one of the world’s largest and oldest industries and improving the lives of millions of people.

Position Overview:
Reporting to the CTO, the Director of R&D; will lead the overall efforts of the R&D; team providing guidance, technical support, intellectual property strategy, critical and innovative thinking, and visionary leadership. This person will oversee all the scientific aspects of research efforts to develop underlying technologies that support PAX’s future product pipeline, and ensure that PAX maintains its lead in innovative science and technology. The PAX R&D; team is highly interdisciplinary, spanning mechanical engineering, industrial design, chemistry, pulmonary, and a high standard for consumer experience.

Key Responsibilities:
Leadership

  • Function as an innovation partner to collaborate, challenge and inform senior leadership on a regular basis
  • Provide the leadership and champion the innovation required to deepen PAX’s technologies
  • Take action and initiative in identifying and shepherding special projects and key initiatives
  • Develop a keen understanding of the developing regulatory arenas affecting the opportunity and freedom to operate for the company
General Management and Operations

  • Manage day to day coordination of the R&D; activities
  • Define project phases and milestones, and report progress in a reliable and timely manner to management team.
  • Execute research projects through our current spend rate but also plan to scale for growth
  • Support the development of operating plans and budgets including goal setting relative to spend, labor force, facilities and equipment
  • Prepare clear, concise communications to keep management informed of the current status and future plans
  • Define and execute a strategy for intellectual property that includes IP capture on existing initiatives, defining new initiatives to create unique IP, and understanding the IP landscape to ensure PAX establishes and maintains a defensible and leading IP strategy
  • Engage department leads to determine functional and strategic needs for new and existing products
  • Manage a team of people with varying levels of experience, and with a variety of technical backgrounds
Skills and Experience Required:
  • 5+ years experience managing research that spans a variety of scientific and engineering fields.
  • Experience in experimental design and the interpretation of results
  • Experience in preparing invention disclosures and working with patent attorneys
  • Demonstrated project management skills, including forecasting, project planning and the development of timelines.
  • Experience building a research team in a dynamic, fast-growing environment
  • Experience and understanding of key compliance needs, regulatory systems, and working with external parties in clinical trials
  • Ability to identify and involve external resources including consultants, research institutes, testing facilities, and academia
  • Ability to think several years into the future as it relates to the general evolution of technology
Key Attributes Necessary for Success:
  • A highly intelligent, self-confident, strategic manager with a style that fosters innovation, collaboration, and accountability, resulting in streamlined development and optimization of the best possible products that are loved by consumers
  • Brings energy and enthusiasm to the business, creating a culture of excitement and innovation to grow the business
Education:
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience in a related field. PhD or other advanced degree in chemistry, physical chemistry, materials science, or other relevant scientific discipline is also a plus
PAX Perks:
  • Equity
  • Periodic company lunches/team lunches
  • PAXtivities - Scheduled events and activities with other PAXers
  • A place to grow in your career, we’ll help you set objectives and meet them
  • Supportive team members and hiring managers
  • Generous referral bonuses
  • Fully stocked snacks and drinks
  • We’ll subsidize your monthly cell phone bill
  • Discounts on PAX products/devices
  • We’ll equip you with a Macbook or Dell
Benefits:
  • Full benefits (medical/dental/vision) for you and subsidized for your dependents
  • FSA (flexible spending account)
  • 401K Plan
  • PAX Labs observes 9 paid holidays throughout the year plus 3 floating holidays to be used at your discretion
PAX Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, disability or veteran status. We comply with San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance and do not unlawfully discriminate against applicants with criminal convictions.

description:
The Cardiovascular & Specialty Solutions (CSS) Group, part of the Medical Devices sector within Johnson & Johnson, is recruiting for a Principal Engineer -Partner Development located in Irvine, CA (preferred) or Irwindale, CA.

The CSS Group consists of six diverse businesses including Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products (ASP), Biosense Webster (BWI), Codman Neuro, Mentor, and Sterilmed. The CSS Group serves a diverse base of customers in Ear, Nose and Throat (ENT), Infection Prevention, Electrophysiolkogy (EP), Neurovascular and Neurosurgery, Surgical and Non-Surgical Aesthetics, and Reprocessing.

Advanced Sterilization Products (ASP), division of Ethicon, Inc. , a Johnson & Johnson company, truly makes a difference by Protecting Lives against Infection ® . ASP has been innovating since 1987 to help healthcare facilities protect patients with best-in-class infection prevention solutions. Learn more about Advanced Sterilization Products at www.aspjj.com/us

Job Description:

The Principal Engineer – Partner Development, Tech Support will:
  • Work on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors
  • Exercise judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selected methods and techniques to obtain the desired results
  • Act as manufacturing technical expert for the Global Procurement organization, responsible for process and product knowledge acquisition to identify and execute productivity improvement projects (on e.g. yields, materials and process efficiencies) in order to realize cost reductions.
  • Own the overall responsibility and technical oversight for the planning, organizing, execution, and coordination of continuous improvement projects at key, strategic external manufacturers of finished goods.
  • Lead projects, which may involve supervision (permanent or temporary) of technical personnel, to execute validations, troubleshooting efforts, or operational efficiency improvements
  • Advises teams on issues related to product design, validation requirements, appropriate test methods and manufacturing methods to meet quality, cost, and release to market objectives
  • Responsible for evaluating technical and regulatory requirements against business needs in development and maintenance of corporate level policies, procedures, and strategies impacting contract manufacturers.
  • Develop and implement sector-wide electromechanical and other processing related validation policies and procedures. Lead company teams to accomplish integration activities for proposed changes.

Qualifications
Qualifications:
  • The ideal candidate must have a Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 8 years experience.
  • Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering or Chemical Engineering or Materials Science or Equivalent Technical discipline is preferred.
  • General quality systems, change management and project management skills are required.
  • The ability to be effective in a global environment with the ability to manage and lead technical issues with global partners is required.
  • In-depth knowledge of electromechanical assembly is required.
  • Prior experience that encompasses a broad engineering knowledge of various processing operations such as plastics molding/extrusions and metal fabrication, etc. is preferred.
  • Experience with design and/or manufacturing of medical devices (Class II and/or Class III) is preferred.
  • Manufacturing systems and processes, including GMP requirements for medical devices.
  • Must demonstrate a strong understanding of engineering theoretical fundamentals and experimental techniques.
  • Strong understanding of the process excellence tool set (LEAN, Six Sigma) with a proven track-record of deploying these tools to improve operational performance.
  • Certification in LEAN and/or Six Sigma is preferred.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely across all levels of the company, across the Medical Device supply chain, and with the commercial franchises as appropriate.
  • Managing Complexity and the ability to lead and influence others in a complex matrix organization is required.
  • Organization & Talent Development with the ability to mentor and train junior engineers.
  • Excellent communication (written and oral) and negotiation skills are required.

This position is based in Irvine, California (Irwindale CA may be considered) and may require up to 50% travel (domestic and international).

Be VITAL in your career. Be seen for the TALENT you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.

Johnson & Johnson Companies are equal opportunity employers.

description:
With more than 60 years of innovation and leadership, FEI enables customers to find meaningful answers to questions that accelerate breakthrough discoveries, increase productivity, and ultimately change the world. FEI designs, manu­factures, and supports the broadest range of high-performance microscopy workflows that provide images and answers in the micro-, nano-, and picometer scales.

Combining hardware and software expertise in electron, ion, and light microscopy with deep application knowledge in the materials science, life sci­ences, electronics, and natural resources markets, the worldwide FEI team of 2,700+ employees is dedicated to customers' pursuit of discovery and resolution to global challenges.

Job Purpose


This position designs and implements system software for failure analysis and electrical fault detection equipment. As a member of the Electrical Fault Analysis (EFA) software team, you’ll be responsible for developing UI, workflow, and hardware control modules and integrating that work into existing software platform. To be successful, you’ll need to proactively manage development needs and build relationships not only within the software organization, but also with hardware engineers, application engineers, research scientists and others.

Duties and responsibilities
  • Collaborate with Product Marketing and Applications to define new features
  • Write requirements, design and other documentation
  • Design, implement, and test new features in accordance with EFA SW engineering standards and processes
  • Maintain software packages for the ELITE group which includes fixing software defects, refactoring existing code base, and resolving critical customer issues in a timely manner
  • Participate in system architecture, design and development for software features in EFA products
  • Provide engineering support and debug problems for existing products

Qualifications

Required:
  • 5+ years developing object oriented software that works hand-in-hand with hardware systems
  • 3-5 years UI/UX experience building desktop applications
  • Strong C# with WPF and/or C++ development skills
  • Experience in image acquisition, image manipulation, and image processing
  • Strong oral, written, and presentation communications skills
  • Ability to produce results independently while tightly coordinating efforts with multi-disciplinary team
Preferred:
  • Semiconductor Equipment industry experience
  • Experience with optical or imaging systems, esp. microscopy
  • MS or PhD in related discipline
Education
  • A BSCS, or a BSEE with significant CS coursework (or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, and work experience).

EEO/AAP

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

You will work closely with an internal inter-disciplinary team, and outside partners to drive key aspects of product definition, execution and test.   • Manage the technical relationship with internal teams and external vendors to deliver new display components to the required specification and schedule
