description:
Seeking a candidate with a Ph.D. in materials science, chemical engineering, chemistry, or similar, with prior experience synthesizing porous polymers, to advance the materials synthesis capabilities at PARC.

About the Job

The Hardware Systems Lab (HSL) has an immediate need for a Member of Research Staff or Postdoc (depending on the experience level) with expertise and research interests in porous polymers such as aerogels, and functional polymers.

Requirements

  • Ph.D. in materials science, chemical engineering, or chemistry, with 0-3 years of experience post-graduation
  • Deep knowledge of nanoporous polymer synthesis such as aerogels, with hands-on experience with their design, fabrication and characterization
  • Hands-on experience on polymer synthesis by controlled radical and condensation polymerization
  • Highly self-motivated and capable of developing, leading, and executing his/her own experimental plan
  • Strong academic achievement as demonstrated by publications and/or patents
  • Passion for entrepreneurship and commercialization of new technologies
  • Strong communication, teamwork, and leadership skills
Strongly Desired Qualifications:
  • Experience in the development of functional polymers for energy-related applications
  • Experience in the characterization of optical properties of thin polymer films
Responsibilities

The candidate will lead the nanoporous polymer synthesis work at PARC on a major funded project. We also expect the candidate to advance PARC’s polymer-synthesis capabilities on other projects, and to explore new opportunities. It is expected that the candidate will work closely with team members, subcontractors, vendors, and market-facing partners. The candidate must also be able to contribute technically to other leading-edge technologies in the hardware labs, with opportunities to independently develop novel concepts and seedling projects.

Benefits

We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K). PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria. The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).

About PARC

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D; services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.

Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.

PARC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with PARC should contact PARC Human Resources.
title: Polymer Chemist

description:
Senior Chemist-Newport Beach, CA Area

DESCRIPTION:
This position is responsible for developing novel optical adhesives and films involving functional nanoparticles, such as quantum dots and nano-crystals. Responsibilities may include design, formulation, testing, processing, and scale-up of proprietary electronic materials. Products must be developed in a timely manner that will permit their evaluation, qualification, and implementation by customers. Additional responsibilities include determining development strategy and direction, valuing projects, leveraging technology across different projects, and interacting with Research Platforms.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead long and short term product development projects with focus on the use of functional nanoparticles in display applications; determine technology approach and conceive innovative routes in the formulation, processing, and testing of materials; employ sound experimental designs to effectively develop new materials for electronic applications.

Prepare and deliver presentations on research projects for customers, management and technical audiences; provide technical support services to manufacturing and quality as required.

Actively promote technology across various groups and development teams; leverage new technologies and experiences from other groups and from the Research Platforms; support intellectual property activities and provide guidance and recommendations on patents, trademarks and proprietary agreements; contribute to the development of IP strategies for area of responsibility.

Assure all PD laboratory work is carried out in a safe manner including employees wearing personal protective equipment, trained on safety practices, 5s, etc; and that products and processes comply with all deferral and state regulatory agencies; assure all new products meet international chemical health and safety requirements.

Supervise and coach technicians and associate chemists on chemistry and processes and on day to day activities; able to work in a chemical lab environment and with lab equipment and computers; able to carry out laboratory activities; may be required to reach, squat, bend and lift up to 25 lbs.

REQUIREMENTS:
Ph.D. degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or other relevant discipline plus 2+ years of experience in the areas of optical/display materials, surface chemistry/physics, adhesive or film.

Film processing or optical film expertise highly desirable; alternatively, a Masters or Bachelor?s degree plus 5+ years of experience may be considered.

Full understanding and extensive knowledge in the relationship between chemical structures and physical/mechanical/optical properties is a must; experience in the analysis and application of chemical, physical, mechanical and optical data to problem solving and product development; demonstrated ability to partner with customers in product development programs.
title: Senior Chemist

description:
Vencore is a proven provider of information solutions, engineering and analytics for the U.S. Government. With more than 40 years of experience working in the defense, civilian and intelligence communities, Vencore designs, develops and delivers high impact, mission-critical services and solutions to overcome its customers most complex problems.

Headquartered in Chantilly, Virginia, Vencore employs 3,800 engineers, analysts, IT specialists and other professionals who strive to be the best at everything they do.

Vencore is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Responsibilities: Vencore supports the Mission Assurance Support Services (MASS) contract formerly known as Reliability
Engineering Support Services (RESS) as a subcontractor to Bastion Technologies. Bastion was awarded the prime
contract by the California Institute of Technologies (Caltech) Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), which operates
under a prime contract with the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).

Within JPL, there is a Mission Assurance Division which manages the Reliability Engineering and Mission Environmental Assurance Office, the Quality Assurance Office, and the Electronic Parts Engineering (Component Engineering & Assurance) Office. These three Offices are responsible for providing specialized technical engineering services for all JPL in-house projects/missions.

These services include engineering support in the following areas: reliability, environments, electromagnetic compatibility, probabilistic risk assessment, quality assurance and inspection, electronic parts engineering and failure analysis.

Major duties and responsibilities of this position include:
1. Routine technical and programmatic interface with JPL Project Managers, Project Element Managers, Task Managers, and Mission Assurance Managers to develop appropriate reliability engineering requirements and plans for JPL Space Projects.
2. Lead and perform duties related to the selection, procurement, manufacture, use, and/or testing/screening of electronic parts in high reliability applications.
3. Apply expert knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications and systems.
4. Provide technical oversight of flight electronic parts tasks including the creation of engineering requirements specifications and drawings, and advising projects on part selections maximizing reliability while considering cost and schedule constraints.
5. Apply extensive understanding of part and project risk knowledge to define part reliability and quality requirements and assess risks associated with waivers, deficiencies, and failures.
6. Support project system and design teams, advise projects on the electronic part selection that maximizes reliability while considering schedule and cost constraints.
7. Apply advanced understanding of electronic parts and project risk to define part quality requirements at onset of project work.
8. Report on screening and/or failure test results and advise senior management and project.
9. Advise project management on highly complex electronic part selections that maximize reliability while considering schedule and cost constraints.
10. Position supports continuous refinement and improvement of development methodologies and processes.
11. Position supports project team meetings and reviews, with a high degree of personal and professional responsibility.

Qualifications: Requires 10-12 years with BS/BA or 8 to 10 years with MS/MA or 5 to 7 years with PhD.

1. Requires Bachelor of Science degree with equivalent course work in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Materials Science/Engineering, Applied Mathematics or related technical discipline.
2. Requires 10+ years of experience in parts engineering activities.
3. Experience must include expert knowledge in one or more of the following areas - RF Parts, Hybrid Parts, Photonics, VLSI Microelectronics or Passives Parts in support of parts development, fabrication, manufacturing, process integration, reliability assessment, and test and/or qualification.
4. Extensive understanding and experience in the selection, procurement, manufacture, use, and testing/screening of high reliability electronic parts for spaceflight applications.
5. Professional experience with EEE parts and supporting Mil-STDs.
6. Requires an understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in electronic parts technologies resulting in contributions to the development of new test and qualification methodologies.
7. Preferred knowledge of DoD, NASA, and JEDEC specifications and requirements related to electronic parts.
8. Ability to work well with cross-functional reams, design engineers, line management, and project management.
9. Clearance level at Secret/Top Secret level desired.
10. Excellent computer skills, including and use of computer-aided engineering tools.
11. Excellent verbal/written communication skills, and ability to work with multiple interfaces is required.
title: Parts/Components Sr Engineer

description:
Coherent Inc. is currently hiring a Staff Manufacturing Engineer to work in our Diode Pumped Solid State Business Unit located in Santa Clara, CA. The Manufacturing Engineer will develop, evaluate and improve manufacturing methods and processes for the purpose of sustaining the manufacture of existing Laser products as well as the introduction of new products. Coherent is looking for a hands-on candidate for our two newest products, AVIA NX and Monaco.
Other responsibilities include:
• The Manufacturing Engineer will provide day-to-day technical support for the production line including cleanroom, sub-assembly, optical build, and laser final test areas
• Maintain the quality, reliability, and cycle time standards of the current laser build process
• Continuously improve current production methods using knowledge of product design, materials and parts, fabrication processes, tooling, production equipment capabilities, quality control standards, and warranty metrics
• Take responsibility for electronic travelers, assembly and process methods, and bills of materials
• Work with quality, reliability, and supply chain teams to improve product performance
• Implement corrective actions for problems reported by our customers
• Participate in transferring new products from R&D; into production following project management strategies (Cadence principles, and MS project)

Education and Work Experience

The ideal candidate will have the following:
• BS in Applied Physics, Materials Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or other relevant Physical Science majors or equivalent level of demonstrated knowledge.
• 10+ years of hands-on Manufacturing Engineering experience with diode-pumped solid-state lasers, diode-pumped fiber lasers and/or high-power harmonic conversion
• Must be a US Citizen or Green Card holder (position is ITAR regulated).
• Very good verbal and written communication skills
• Experience in a manufacturing environment with a high mix of standard and modified products.
• Ability to collaborate and coordinate with team members to complete tasks in timely manner.
• Passionate about lasers and producing best performing Laser products.
• Strong working knowledge and understanding of Product Data Management (PDM) software used to manage BOMs and documented manufacturing processes through an ECO workflow. (e.g. Agile PDM)
• Self-motivated, hard-working, goal oriented, task focused, and a reliable team player.
title: Manufacturing Engineer Staff

description:
Founded in 2003, InvenSense Inc. (NYSE: INVN) is the world’s leading provider of MEMS sensor platforms. InvenSense’s vision of Sensing Everything™ targets the consumer electronics and industrial markets with integrated Motion and Sound solutions. Our solutions combine MEMS (micro electrical mechanical systems) sensors, such as accelerometers, gyroscopes, compasses, and microphones with proprietary algorithms and firmware that intelligently process, synthesize, and calibrate the output of sensors, maximizing performance and accuracy. InvenSense’s motion tracking, audio and location platforms, and services can be found in many of the world’s largest and most iconic brands including smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones, gaming devices, internet of things, automotive products, and remote controls for smart TVs.

InvenSense is headquartered in San Jose, CA and has offices in Boston, China, Taiwan, Korea, Japan, France, Canada, Slovakia, and Italy. We’re looking for top-notch MEMS Engineers and Software Engineers (etc.) to join our global team. If you’re interested in being a part of our journey and helping us grow to become the leading provider of SoC platform solutions, we definitely want to hear from you.

Job Summary:

Work within MEMS engineering team providing leadership in the areas of package design, packaging materials selection and structural analysis. She/he is expected to explore new materials and new assembly methods in areas of MEMS packaging. The scope of work will include:

Evaluation of design robustness, drawing technical conclusions, making appropriate recommendations to ensure the product conforms to engineering design intent.
Assembling prototypes, performing experimental testing, analyzing results in conjunction with statistics, tolerance analysis, FMEA.

Skills and Qualifications:
  • MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Physics or similar disciplines



  • Minimal of 10 years of experience in semiconductor assembly and packaging
  • Experience in WLCSP, QFN, LGA and flip chip packages
  • Hands-on knowledge in assembly processes, such as backgrinding, dicing, die attach, die stacking with thin die, flip chip, wirebond, encapsulation, underfill, molding, ball attach, singulation
  • Expert in problem solving/trouble shooting and providing a solution
  • Broad material and fabrication knowledge and extensive assembly process development experience in microelectronic packaging
  • Advanced knowledge in laser dicing, plasma dicing and embedded substrate (resistor and capacitor) is a plus.
  • Capability of addressing chip/package interaction stress issue
  • Knowledge of MEMS (e.g., accelerometer, gyrometer, microphone and magnetometer) devices.
  • MEMS microphone experience is plus
  • Fundamental knowledge of one or more of the following domains: structural mechanics, vibrations, acoustics and reliability



  • Proven track record to bring a product from conceptual stage to HVM stage with overseas manufacturing house
title: Manager - Assembly/Packaging Dev

description:
The Electromagnetic Systems division is responsible for the design and development of the Hyperloop Propulsion Motor, Levitation, and Guidance Systems. These systems are all electromechanical in nature and are designed by a highly cross-functional team of exceptional engineers in the areas of Electromagnetics, Mechanical Design, Heat Transfer, Materials Science, Testing, Controls and Embedded Systems, and Electrical System Modeling. We are seeking candidates with broad skillsets and various levels of experience to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals at our Los Angeles facility.

Responsibilities

The Senior Motor Design Engineer is responsible for:
  • Use of analytic tools (Excel, Matlab, SPEED) for first principles motor design
  • Electromagnetic analysis of various motors (both linear and rotating machinery)
  • Analysis and verification of preliminary and detail designs with FEA (Maxwell and JMAG) in both 2D and 3D as well as other techniques (FRM)
  • Optimization of motor winding topology, magnetic circuit, and electrical loading for system top level priorities
  • Top-level motor topology tradeoff studies
  • Selection of motor materials including magnet grades, magnetic steels, insulation materials and insulation system layout, electrical connection processes (welding/brazing)
  • Review FEA models produced by the broader team
  • Contribute to custom toolsets for motor and electromagnetic analyses (Matlab and Python)
  • Working with internal teams and external vendors to ensure timely completion of functional hardware
Requirements

  • B.S. in Engineering or related discipline and 7+ years OR M.S. in Engineering or related discipline and 5+ years experience
  • Minimum 5 years experience with exposure to all of the following:
  • Linear PM motors
  • Axial flux air-core motors
  • IPM motor for traction applications
  • SynRel or PM assisted SynRel motors
  • Insulation systems at medium voltage ( > 4 kV)
  • Detailed knowledge of motor drive architectures and motor control algorithms
  • Experience developing motors/generators from concept to production
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Hyperloop One is an Equal Employment Employer; employment is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected status. Hyperloop One will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with the âBan the Boxâ legislation.
title: Senior Motor Design Engineer

description:
II-VI Optical Systems' designs, manufactures, assembles and tests precision optical systems and components. Our products have been deployed on military platforms such as submarines, tanks, missiles, fighter jets and UAV's. II-VI Optical Systems has grown over the years from a provider of specialty optical materials to a full service provider of optical components and optical systems.

Since its establishment in 1961, II-VI Optical Systems has maintained a commitment to customer satisfaction and continuous improvement. Our commitment to customer satisfaction is achieved by continuous training of our staff with focus on quality, on-time delivery, and cost reduction. From the initial customer inquiry to final delivery, meeting the customer's requirements is our primary objective.

Job Function:

Supports activities for thin film coating processes, including coating design, tooling design, process development, qualification, and process documentation, and support of coating operations including specification and installation of new equipment, substrate cleaning, deposition, inspection, and characterization. Assist in monitoring of process controls parameters, and support of preventative maintenance programs and repairs for coating equipment. Supports program management and operations personnel with technical guidance on assigned projects.

Education:

Minimum BS in engineering or related discipline, preferably in physics, optics, materials science, electrical or mechanical engineering.

Experience:

0-3 years; familiarity with thin film coating technologies and metrology preferred.

Special Skills:
  • Strong verbal and written technical communication skills.

  • Computer skills in word processing and spreadsheet software, including MS Word, Excel, Access, some CAD (Solidworks preferred), to support requirements for technical reports and analytical studies.

  • Strong analytical, fault isolation, and problem solving skills. DOE and SOE experience strongly desired. Strong organizational skills and attention to details required.

"II-VI Optical Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law."
title: Coating Engineer I

description:
The weld engineering position reports to the Value Stream Manager for Additive Manufacturing, and leads and acts as a subject matter expert. The engineer may work in any number of functional areas, including, but not limited to, product design, development, simulation, research, metallurgy, materials, quality, reliability, manufacturing process, product performance/support,service, and facilities. Individuals may have multiple assignments that may require the engineer to review the work of technicians or other support personnel, and provide technical advice to individuals at various levels in the organization. Assignments will become more complex and require the engineer to assume a significant role, either as an individual contributor or as part of a project team, with increasing emphasis on analyzing, identifying, and applying engineering techniques to solve problems and make recommendations. The role is responsible for:

- Keeps abreast of advancing technologies and champion new initiatives
- Develops requirements for high quality welds through process control, metallurgical testing, and nondestructive testing procedures (FPI, X Ray, CT Scan, etc.)
- Develops and maintains welding specifications
- Supports welder certification and training
- Supports the development and growth of 3D Metal Printing
- Contributes to the design of new products, processes and tooling
- Establishes robust qualification and preventative maintenance plans
- Drives continuous process improvements on a regular basis
- Works with quality to support welding audits
- Maintains an emphasis on Environmental, Health and Safety

**This position is eligible for domestic relocation**

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in Welding Engineering, Materials Joining Engineering, Materials Science, Industrial Engineering, or Metallurgical Engineering
  • 3 to 5 years’ experience
  • Extensive welding process knowledge of some of the following: GTAW, SAW, Furnace Brazing, LBW, EBW, RSW
  • Understanding of the metallurgical effects of welding and heat treatment on a variety of alloys
  • Well developed analytical, critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills
  • Ability to organize, plan, schedule, and prioritize a complex workload to meet established deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal, collaboration, teaming, communication, and presentation skills
  • Ability to build consensus and influence decisions
  • Ability to network and establish collaborative relationships within and outside Solar, particularly in areas of R&D;, equipment manufacturers, and industry

Preferred Qualifications
  • CWI (Certified Welding Inspector)
  • Experience in the application and technical aspects of welding (joining), and related manufacturing experience
  • Experience using engineering specifications and standards and various industry welding specifications
  • Knowledge and experience with 6 Sigma, Lean and CPS; Blackbelt preferred
  • Knowledge of processes including coating, machining, heat treating, EDM, casting and forging
  • Familiarity with nondestructive testing procedures (FPI, X Ray, CT Scan, etc.)

Travel Requirements
Less than 25%

Benefits Eligibility
Solar Turbines offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, vacation, 401k, incentive bonus, tuition reimbursement and professional development/advancement opportunities.

Visa Eligibility
Applicants must be currently eligible to work in the country in which this position is located. For information on employment eligibility in the United States, please visit the U.S. Immigration Services website.

EOE Plus
Solar Turbines is an EEO/AA Employer. All qualified applicants – including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities – are encouraged to apply. Solar Turbines conducts Drug Screens and Background Checks.
title: Sr. Weld Engineer

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

Job Description

The Plant Manager will be responsible for all manufacturing-related activities associated with Apeel’s Product Launch Facility. This position will initially be responsible for overseeing the construction and commissioning of the manufacturing facility, in collaboration with our EPC [MDG1] partner. In parallel, this position will also recruit, manage, and grow the manufacturing operations team including plant supervisors and operators.

After commissioning and start-up of the Product Launch Facility, the Plant Manager will also be responsible for day-to-day plant operations including production planning, facility management, and safety and regulatory compliance.

Key Responsibilities

  • Serve as key liaison with our EPC partner during the design, construction, and commissioning of Apeel’s Product Launch Facility.
  • Meet production demands within safety, quality, scheduling and budgetary requirements.
  • Ensure facility meets and exceeds governmental, industry, and internal standards for safety and regulatory compliance including but not limited to OSHA, HACCP, and GMP guidelines.
  • Collaborates with Process Engineering and R&D; groups to integrate and validate process improvements.
  • Responsible for operational and capital improvement budgets including recommendation and implementation of process improvements and optimizations.
  • Builds and grows organizational talent and capability through hiring, employee training programs, mentoring, feedback and development. Promotes and maintains a positive culture consistent with Apeel’s Core Values.
Qualifications

Education and Experience

  • An ideal candidate for this position will hold a bachelors or master’s degree in chemistry, chemical/biochemical engineering, mechanical engineering or industrial engineering or a similar/related field.
  • At least 7-10 years of experience in manufacturing operations, chemical process design or engineering.
  • At least 4-5 years of experience in a management or supervisory role in engineering, production operations, or technical support areas.
  • Experience in a pilot manufacturing facility, including familiarity with new capital projects and/or regular introduction of new processes strongly preferred.
  • Experience in highly regulated manufacturing environments (e.g. cGMP) preferred.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Knowledge and understanding of chemical manufacturing processes, including batch and continuous unit operations, equipment maintenance, control systems, and quality assurance.
  • Strong organizational and problem-solving skills required.
  • Ability to function in a dynamic work environment.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills required.
  • Ability to schedule, coordinate, and lead both internal and external teams.
  • Familiar with lean manufacturing and continuous improvement tools and methodologies.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
title: Plant Manager (Product Launch Facility)

description:
Keysight is the world's leading electronic measurement company, helping scientists and engineers address their toughest technical challenges with confidence through innovations in wireless, modular, and software solutions. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to deliver measurement solutions in wireless communications, aerospace and defense, automotive & energy and semiconductor markets with world-class platforms, software, consistent measurement science. This job is within the nanomeasurement solutions division, which provides test and measurement solutions across a broad group of university/government labs and industrial research markets, focusing on high-growth applications.

Qualifications :
• Ph.D. in Materials Science, Mechanical engineering or related field is required.
• 3+ years in solid mechanics (plasticity), performing Nanoindentation/ small-scale mechanical testing measurements are required.
• Strong background in mechanisms of deformation and fracture in solids and/or high temperature mechanical testing is desirable.
• Experience with AFM/SEM is a plus
• Ability to work well within cross-functional teams
• Good written and spoken communication skills are expected
• Able to work in US without sponsorship.

Keysight Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

description:
With more than 60 years of innovation and leadership, FEI enables customers to find meaningful answers to questions that accelerate breakthrough discoveries, increase productivity, and ultimately change the world. FEI designs, manu­factures, and supports the broadest range of high-performance microscopy workflows that provide images and answers in the micro-, nano-, and picometer scales.

Combining hardware and software expertise in electron, ion, and light microscopy with deep application knowledge in the materials science, life sci­ences, electronics, and natural resources markets, the worldwide FEI team of 2,700+ employees is dedicated to customers' pursuit of discovery and resolution to global challenges.

Job Purpose


We design and manufacture equipment that enables localization and characterization of electrical faults in integrated circuits, packages and board assemblies.

Duties and responsibilities
  • Develop next generation Digital controller to support multi-axis Atomic Force Microscope.
  • Complete PCB board layout, and part selection for analog and digital components including FPGAs, D2As, A2Ds and DSPs.
  • Keeper of the Stakeholder design requirements and the overall architecture of the controller.
  • Work closely with software and firmware engineers to implement solutions for feedback, oversampling, automation routines and Digital-lockins.
  • Work with ME and SE engineers to develop next generation semi-automated probe manufacturing fixtures.
  • Assure product quality by designing electrical testing methods; testing finished products and system capabilities.
  • Provides engineering and manufacturing with a key troubleshooting resource in new product development and assembly issues.
  • Significant individual contributor in a small development team.
  • Disciplined to follow an ISO product development cycle and manufacturing release.
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Required:
  • Strong experience with PCB layout using Altium
  • Strong understanding of analog design for low noise and low leakage applications
  • Experience using Micro Controllers for DC and Stepper motor control
  • Experience using SPI and I2C communication protocol
  • Experience using FPGA for oversampling, filtering, and performing digital locking.

Preferred:
  • Experience in Verilog programing for FPGA
  • Strong troubleshooting skills using a Multimeter, Oscilliscope, logic analyzer, function generators and other diagnostic equipment.
  • Understanding of Semi-Conductor Device Physics to protect the stakeholder requirements

Performance Skills

Electronic Systems Design

Electronic Testing Design

Project Management

Electronics Troubleshooting

Education
  • Bachelor’s Degree from a four year university with an emphasis in Analog or Digital Electronic DesignAttendance is a required function of this position

EEO/AAP

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Other

This position requires a criminal history background check. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the applicant from employment. A drug screen will also be administered.
title: Electrical Engineer Sr.

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Division

Apeel Sciences’ Technical Operations team supports all aspects of our company’s operations—from taking raw materials, transforming them into our food and post-harvest preservation products, ensuring our products and facilities meet and exceed internal and regulatory requirements, facilitating product demonstrations at our customers’ facilities, and moving our products, equipment, and personnel—to serve customers all over the world.

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated, customer-focused, and highly detail- and process-oriented individual to implement and execute the supply chain planning and management, international import/export, and related aspects of our technical operations. The individual will represent Operations, work in close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel, and will report to the Vice President of Operations.

Outcomes and Responsibilities (including but not limited to):
Outcomes

  • Design and maintain a robust and reliable global supply chain to support our manufacturing and product distribution operations while ensuring that compliance and traceability are preserved in alignment with Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs) and food safety principles. This includes, but is not limited to:
  • Establishing, verifying, and nurturing strong relationships with a variety of suppliers, distributors, transportation service providers, customs brokers, freight forwarders, etc.
  • Running bid processes and managing schedules with regards to raw material procurement and finished goods and equipment shipments to allow the company to maintain its aggressive growth, minimize costs and delays, and enable our teams to take full advantage of our most critical market opportunities.
  • Author, implement, and revise company Supply Chain Standard Operating Procedures and templates (e.g., company issued documents used in the processing of shipments).
  • Establish and validate shipping lanes/routes with carriers.
Responsibilities

  • Develop a strong technical understanding of our products (e.g., their manufacture, their mode of action, intended uses, etc.).
  • Develop and implement strategies to support the production, distribution, use, and sale of Apeel products globally.
  • Lead a cross-functional team to coordinate demands between product manufacturing, regulatory compliance, product demonstrations, and product sales.
  • Develop systems and workflows to automate processes.
  • Identify and resolve issues in a timely manner.
Requirements

  • Direct experience designing and managing complex supply chains.
  • Direct experience with the implementation and use of ERP and business process management systems.
  • Direct experience working in a highly regulated industry (e.g., food product manufacturing or pharmaceutical industry).
  • Experience working within a global chemical supply chain is strongly preferred (including expertise with Export Promotion Programs, etc.).
  • Excellent verbal, written, negotiation, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in a STEM (science, technology, engineering, or mathematics) field, business management, finance, or economics.
  • Strong expertise in transportation regulations (e.g., DOT).
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with international tax rules/VAT subject matters.
  • Certification as a CSCP and/or CPIM is a strong asset.
  • 5+ years of experience working in a chemical or related and regulated industry.
  • 2+ years of management experience.

description:
We're looking for a Product Designer / Mechanical Engineer to join our team in creating a breakthrough touch-technology product that will change the way people interact with mobile devices.
You will be be a key early team member taking the idea from its early stages of product definition all the way to successful mass production.

Your specific responsibilities include:
  • System mechanical architecture & design
  • Design of high-cosmetic, mass produced parts & assemblies (including plastic, metal & glass)
  • Interface with both customer-OEMs and internal engineering team to understand design and ensure technical feasibility
  • Interface with and manage 3rd party vendors to execute prototype builds
  • Hands-on building of prototypes / mock-ups / test fixtures for early proof-of-concepts, early manufacturing, testing & demos
  • Create and maintain detailed CAD database, drawing set, and specs for documentation & vendor communication
  • New material and vendor sourcing during design stage (glass, aluminum, adhesives, flex circuits, plastics, etc.)
  • Create and maintain BOM with part cost estimates
  • Assist in product testing & qualification, including internal reliability testing & agency approval certification (UL, CE, etc)
  • Do what it takes to bring a brand-new product to market, together with your Operations, EE & Product Management colleagues
Requirements:
  • BS and/or MS in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent is preferred, with at least 5 years of experience.
  • Experience designing mass-produced electronics products (consumer, medical, industrial fields)
  • Familiarity with mobile phone and tablet technologies is desired
  • Acoustic vibration and materials science experience is a plus
  • CAD experience (Solidworks preferred)
  • Excellent communication skills with internal team & external vendors
  • Ability to work independently and within a fast-paced team environment
Benefits:
  • Competitive package including salary, benefits & stock options
  • Great team to work with!
title: Mechanical Engineer - Touch Sensors

description:
The Institute for Collaborative Biotechnologies (ICB) is an Army-sponsored University Affiliated Research Center (UARC). The ICB is a uniquely interdisciplinary research alliance led by the University of California, Santa Barbara, in collaboration with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, the California Institute of Technology and partners from the Army and industry.

ICB research is driven by more than 50 premier faculty working together with graduate students project scientist, specialists, and professional researchers as interdisciplinary teams of biologists, chemists, physicists, psychologists, physicians, social scientists, and engineers. These teams develop biologically inspired, revolutionary technological innovations in systems and synthetic biology, materials science and engineering, biotechnology tools and cognitive neuroscience.

The ICB is actively seeking Project Scientists (in the full, Associate, and Assistant ranks) to commit effort on ICB projects. This is a large, pooled recruitment covering many disciplines and research foci. Screening of applicants is ongoing and will continue as needed through October 31, 2017. The number of positions varies depending on the needs of the department. The use of a pooled recruitment does not guarantee that an open position exists at the time you are applying. Positions may range from 0% (without salary) to 100%.

Appointees to the Project Scientists make significant and creative contributions to a research or creative project. Appointees may be ongoing members of a research team, or may contribute high-level skills to a specific project for a limited time. Demonstrated capacity for fully independent research or research leadership (at the level of the Researcher series) is not required in this series; however, appointees with the Project Scientist title should have broad range of knowledge and competency and be able to operate at a higher level of independence.

Candidates for appointment, and subsequent personnel cases, will be reviewed on the following criteria:

1) Demonstrated significant, original, and creative contributions to a research or creative program or project

2) Professional competence and activity

3) University and public service (encouraged but not required)

The ICB has a vast research portfolio, indicated by (but not limited to) the following to projects and disciplines:

Systems and synthetic biology

Control and dynamical systems

Photonic and electronic materials

Electronic materials and devices

Cellular structural materials

Biotechnology and biotechnology tools

Cognitive neuroscience

Psychological and brain sciences

Medical/biomedical

Nanofluidics and microfluidics

Biomimetrics and biofilms

Automated analysis in online communication

Social media analysis and predictive modeling

Molecular, cellular, ecosystems, marine science, and biology research

Engineering, materials, and computer science research

Chemistry and biochemistry

Salary is dependent on experience, qualifications, and hiring level. The UCSB salary scales may be found at https://ap.ucsb.edu/compensation.and.benefits/ucsb.salary.scales/

Minimum requirements

Appointees to this series must possess a doctorate or its equivalent at the time of initial appointment.

Previous research experience in applicable or relevant field

Desirable requirements

University and public service are encouraged but not required.

Mentorship/supervision of junior researchers and students.

To apply, please submit:
1) An updated CV

2) Statement of interest/cover letter

3) Name and contact info of at least 3 references

Samples of scholarly publications and/or recommendation letters may be requested at a later date.

Equal Opportunity:
The department is especially interested in candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of the academic community through research, teaching and service.

The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job location
Santa Barbara, CA
Learn More

More information about this recruitment: http://www.icb.ucsb.edu

Requirements
Documents

Curriculum Vitae - Your most recently updated C.V.

Cover Letter

Samples of scholarly work - 1-3 samples of published, in print, submitted, or in-preparation scholarly work (article, book chapter, book, etc.). (Optional)

References
3-5 references required (contact information only)
How to apply

Create an ApplicantID

Provide required information and documents

If any, provide required reference information
title: Project Scientist (all levels) in interdisciplinary biotechnology research

description:
We are looking for driven, talented Process and Product Engineers to join our growing Life Cycle Management (LCM) group. The LCM group works as an integral part of our Consumables Manufacturing process and is tasked with increasing quality and yield within our high volume production environments.

We are growing at a rapid rate and hiring engineers at all levels (I, II, Sr. and Staff) to support multiple groups within LCM (Flow Cells, Reagents, Microarrays & Microfluidics). These individuals will provide technical leadership to new product introduction, production process development, improvement and sustaining efforts. Additionally, these teams will partner cross-functionally with R & D, Quality, Production and other engineering groups to develop processes for new products and sustain and improve processes for existing products.

All About You

Responsibilities:

• Participate in process development, definition and improvement, and other activities in the making of consumable products or support of processes/equipment used to sequence genomes.
• Troubleshoot new product process issues related to yield, quality and throughput.
• Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's) to optimize processes, address yield and quality issues and drive implementation of solutions into a production environment to meet project goals.
• Analyze process test results, issue reports and make technical recommendations.
• Work cross functionally with R&D;, Manufacturing and Quality to develop processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
• Represent Operations needs on development teams.
• Define technical requirements and write procedures for Production to process product.
• Work on teams to develop and transfer new processes/products to production and enhance their robustness.

Requirements:

• Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or semiconductor industries is desirable.
• High level problem solving and reasoning skills required.
• Experience with chemical processes (preferably organic) preferred.
• Experience with statistics, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques is a plus.
• Experience with high volume production in a high tech, high volume consumables industry is a plus.
• High level computer skills are required. Intermediate level programming knowledge is a plus.
• Experience with product development processes and project management is a plus.
• Good interdepartmental communication skills and documentation skills are required.
• Demonstrated ability to accomplish goals while working across departments is required.

Education:

• B.S./M.S./ PhD in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Bioengineering, Biotechnical Engineering, Bioinformatics or MS/PhD in Materials Science or Physical Chemistry, with at least 4 years of relevant experience in production support/sustaining and/or process definition and development, design, scale-up, improvement and validation.
• Recent or near term college graduates are encouraged to apply.

Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
title: Sr Process Engineer, Clinical NPI

description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:
Do you enjoy collaborating with a diverse group of people to solve complex challenges? Does contributing to breakthrough discoveries in science and working with unique experimental instrumentation in a world-leading scientific research environment excite you? The Photon Controls and Data Systems (PCDS) Department within the Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) Directorate at SLAC is seeking two Controls and Data Systems Engineers to help with planning, implementing, and operating customized experimental installations, and developing enhancements to our scientific instrumentation and supporting hardware and software for the Controls, Data Acquisition, and Data Analysis systems for two of the LCLS scientific instrument departments: (1) the Matter in Extreme Conditions (MEC) scientific instrument/department, and (2) the Soft X-ray Department (SXD) consisting of the Atomic, Molecular and Optical (AMO) science instrument and the Soft X-Ray (SXR) materials science instrument.

Reporting to the Photon Controls and Data Systems Department Head, the Controls and Data Systems Engineer will be a member of a multidisciplinary team comprised of electronic engineers and software developers focused on developing software and hardware solutions to support scientific instrumentation, laser systems, controls, and data acquisition systems. This position will also work with scientific and operations support staff involved in advancing scientific instrumentation capabilities. LCLS is the worldâs first hard x-ray free electron laser (FEL) with unprecedented capabilities in photon energy range, peak power, and pulse lengths. There are seven independent instruments currently in operation, which are specifically designed to utilize the exceptional beam characteristics of the LCLS to probe the structure and dynamics of matter at atomic size and timescales. The evolution of science and experimental techniques on these instruments, along with upgrades in the x-ray FEL source and optical lasers (LCLS-II), require regular improvements to the supporting software and hardware platforms. The MEC instrument is used to study extreme states of matter using high-frequency X-rays to detect changes induced by high power optical laser pulses. The AMO instrument is used to perform fundamental studies of light-matter interactions in the extreme x-ray intensity of the LCLS FEL beam, time-resolved photoionization, x-ray diffraction of nanocrystals and single shot imaging of non-reproducible objects. The science performed at the SXR beamline covers wide-spread fields such as catalysis, magnetism, correlated materials, laboratory astrophysics and biological structure. See https://portal.slac.stanford.edu/sites/lcls_public for more on LCLS and the unique capabilities of our instrument facilities.

CORE DUTIES :
Plan, implement, and operate customized experimental installations.

Reconfigure hardware and software to meet experimental need; develop software for data analysis, data acquisition, controls, and to support new instrumentation.

Manage hardware and software for the controls, data acquisition, and data-analysis systems and related infrastructure such as computers and local networks, x-ray detector systems, digitizers, scopes, cameras, power supplies, motion systems, vacuum and PLC systems, etc.

Participate in upgrades to scientific instrumentation and capabilities including laser systems, timing systems, hardware and software selection, and lead teams of engineers and technicians to implement and integrate the control, data acquisition, and analysis aspects of these upgrades.

Additional opportunities include development toward, or project management for:

Core capabilities of the CDS systems including

Real-time and offline data analysis frameworks which run on Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), teraflop computing clusters, multi-petabyte storage systems at SLAC and NERSC.

Real time Data Acquisition and EPICS (Experimental Physics and Industrial Control System) control system software and driver development.

Hardware-level data reduction and veto systems in custom FPGA based platform(s).

Graphical User Interface framework.

New and unique instrumentation and electronics systems such as

Petawatt laser systems.

Femtosecond timing systems.

X-ray sensitive CCD cameras and detectors.

Machine and human protection systems.

QUALIFICATIONS:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree and five years of relevant experience in computer science, mathematics, physics, engineering or related discipline. Advanced degree strongly preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to learn and understand the workings of a broad range of hardware and software.

Demonstrated programming skills with C and/or C++ and experience with Linux/Unix and a scripting language such as (and preferably) Python.

Exceptional communications skills and ability to work well in a research and development team.

Demonstrated project leadership, planning, and excellent organizational skills.

Ability to understand the basic functionality and scientific purpose of each part of the x-ray science instrument.

Experience in one or more of the following preferred

Real-time and networking software, familiarity with EPICS framework, knowledge of motor, vacuum and camera controls.

Developing scientific instrumentation, laser and laser diagnostic systems, high fidelity RF and timing systems.

Background in x-ray or material science.

SLAC Employee Competencies

Effective Decisions : Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner.
Self-Development : Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing.
Dependability : Can be counted on to deliver results with a sense of personal responsibility for expected outcomes.
Initiative : Pursues work and interactions proactively with optimism, positive energy, and motivation to move things forward.
Adaptability : Flexes as needed when change occurs, maintains an open outlook while adjusting and accommodating changes.
Communication: Ensures effective information flow to various audiences and creates and delivers clear, appropriate written, spoken, presented messages.
Relationships : Builds relationships to foster trust, collaboration, and a positive climate to achieve common goals.

Certifications and Licenses:
None

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:
Frequently grasp lightly/fine manipulation, perform desk-based computer tasks, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.

Occasionally stand/walk, sit, twist/bend/stoop/squat, grasp forcefully.

Rarely kneel/crawl, climb (ladders, scaffolds, or other), reach/work above shoulders, use a telephone, writing by hand, sort/file paperwork or parts, operate foot and/or hand controls, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh >40 pounds.

  • - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
May be exposed to high voltage electricity, radiation or electromagnetic fields, lasers, noise > 80dB TWA, Allergens/Biohazards/Chemicals /Asbestos, confined spaces, working at heights >10 feet, temperature extremes, heavy metals, unusual work hours or routine overtime and/or inclement weather.

May require travel.

WORK STANDARDS:
Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.

Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.

Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu

description:
Sigray, Inc. has an immediate need for a full-time engineer with at least 5 yearsâ experience (non-negotiable).

The Job: At this job, you will be working closely under the guidance of experts on x-ray sources to carefully assemble, process, data-collect, and troubleshoot next-generation x-ray sources. The daily tasks will involve mostly hands-on assembly, collaboration, process management, with some communication with outside vendors.

On the day-to-day, you will:
  • Perform high-level assembly (e.g. fritting, spot welding) at fine precision, typically performed under a microscope

  • Braze medium-to-small sized components

  • Assemble x-ray tubes and perform vacuum processing and bake-out

  • Maintain detailed records on parts and order statuses, input data on computer

  • Create tooling, improve processes, data collection, for product improvement

  • Keep lab straight (clean-up) and label items
The Environment: Sigray is a rapidly x-ray technology company located in Concord, CA. The company was started by Dr. Wenbing Yun, who previously founded Xradia, a world leading x-ray microscopy company that was later successfully acquired by Carl Zeiss as its x-ray microscopy unit. Sigray is well-funded by government grants and has customers from around the world. The company's culture is dynamic and R&D; focused, and this is an excellent opportunity to work in a rapidly growing, dynamic company under the guidance and mentorship of leading experts in the x-ray instrumentation field.

Requirements

: The ideal candidate is someone who has pride in their work and is driven to have every product be of the highest quality possible. Training will be provided as needed This job may be for you if:

  • You enjoy hands-on work

  • Are organized, meticulous and have high sensitivity to detail

  • You are patient and diligent

  • Have high standards for craftsmanship

  • Are willing to ask clarification questions on concepts you are unsure of

  • Meets schedule and takes ownership of processes
Bonuses:

  • Clean room experience

  • Metallurgy and chemistry experience

  • Experienced with: UHV (ultra-high vacuum), EHV, and high temperature brazing

  • Working under microscopes

  • Electrical background, automated data collection, analog circuits

  • Metallurgy and materials science knowledge

description:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.

NDE (NON-DESTRUCTIVE EVALUATION) LEVEL III â EDDY CURRENT SPECIALIST

Overview:
As an NDE level III technical expert at SpaceX you will be required to interface across the business building a link and providing solutions between initial R&D;, engineering, production and quality assurance in the development of specifications, process, procedures and people to support targets and goals such as cycle time, right first time manufacture / assembly, probability of detection and indication/defect reduction. Principle technical understanding of your specific area of expertise and a wide industry knowledge of best practices, tools, equipment and procedures are needed to ensure we have the best possible solutions deployed to maintain compliance and ensure our launch vehicles maintain reliability and performance for our customer

Responsibilities:
  • Technology Development:
  • Systems & tooling selection
  • Systems & tooling qualification
  • System introduction project management
  • Process Development:
  • Hardware and software qualification/testing
  • Method process documentation
  • Part specific technique development, testing, documentation & deployment
  • Development of customer relevant reporting packages for multiple data sets as well as single sample results
  • Engineering drawing interpretation and where applicable engineering specification definition support
  • Technical Production Support:
  • System level production maintenance & support
  • Tooling / system calibration
  • Production cell technical oversight: Daily meetings, trouble shooting
  • Continuous improvement: Process Efficiency, Speed Accuracy
  • Technician Training & Development:
  • Level I & Level II technician qualification: Written test definition, invigilation, and administration of written /practical, general and specific tests
Basic Qualifications:
  • Minimum 2 years of experience as a Level III in Eddy Current
Preferred Skills and Experience:
  • Engineering Related Degree: e.g. Materials Science, Aerospace, Mechanical
  • 5+ years of experience as a level III preferred to ASNT Level III national certification standards in at least 2 methods Including 1x advanced method
  • 5+ years of Aerospace experience
  • Operational experience of utilizing a range of electromagnetic inspection systems
  • Operational experience in the use of single coil inspection probes and associated systems
  • Knowledge and understanding of SNT TC-1-A & NAS410 standards
  • Experience with proven track record in the training and development of others
  • Knowledge of AMS, AWS / ASME, ASTM etc
  • Problem solving tools and techniques: Practical Problem Solving, 8D etc
  • Lean principles, Kaizan, Continuous improvement, 5s
  • Experience is Computed Tomography systems
  • Knowledge of NASA 5009 Standards
  • Basic computer skills: Microsoft office applications - Word, Power Point, Excel etc
  • CAD packages Such as Siemens NX*, Catia, Pro-E, E
  • Experience in working with fracture critical products & parts
Additional Requirements:
  • Must be able to lift 25 lbs unassisted, bend, stretch, stand for extended periods of time, climb stairs, reach, twist, sit, walk, and/or run
  • Must be willing to work extended hours and on weekends if needed
ITAR Requirements:
To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about ITAR here.

SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

description:
With more than 60 years of innovation and leadership, FEI enables customers to find meaningful answers to questions that accelerate breakthrough discoveries, increase productivity, and ultimately change the world. FEI designs, manu­factures, and supports the broadest range of high-performance microscopy workflows that provide images and answers in the micro-, nano-, and picometer scales.

Combining hardware and software expertise in electron, ion, and light microscopy with deep application knowledge in the materials science, life sci­ences, electronics, and natural resources markets, the worldwide FEI team of 2,700+ employees is dedicated to customers' pursuit of discovery and resolution to global challenges.

The Sales and Service Division (SSD) of FEI is charged with selling and servicing FEI products in geographical territories worldwide. The SSD Organization serves as the primary FEI contact to both potential customers and current customers alike, providing a range of value-added products and services and maintaining the highest levels of customer satisfaction.

Duties and responsibilities

The Field Service Manager works closely with the market divisions and the sales and service management team to ensure that the following key objectives are achieved:
  • Strategies for effective global support are developed, agreed and executed
  • Customer satisfaction is maintained at high levels when compared competitively
  • Global resourcing levels are understood and achieved
  • Appropriate service account management (site management) capabilities are established at each key site, together with required technical skills
  • Service revenues and costs are in line with business plan/budgetary requirements
  • Manage region P&L; and define strategy for continuous growth
  • Key reporting and metrics are set up and maintained for each key site and product
  • Through the Technical Support group, push for product quality and reliability improvements as indicated by data derived from site activity
  • Represent FEI company and service as a manager in customer interactions
  • Ability to manage staff, assign specific duties, and create a constructive and cooperative working relationship.
Qualifications

The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:
  • Typically requires a University degree in a related field
  • Typically requires 12+ or more years of relevant professional experience within a related industry
  • Typically requires 5+ years’ experience leading service organizations within a medium to large scale company, providing support to equipment customers
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience with international customers
  • Superior influencing and leadership skills
  • Demonstrated ability to drive change within organizations
  • Strong business management skills
  • Ability to drive to worksites and maintain a valid drivers license
  • Ability to travel 30% domestically
  • Ability to travel internationally and obtain a valid passport

EEO/AAP

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Other

This position requires a criminal history background check. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the applicant from employment. A drug screen will also be administered.

description:
Corning is the world leader in specialty glass and ceramics, creating and manufacturing keystone components that enable high-technology systems.

Corning’s history is filled with breakthrough technologies that have played an important role in the way the world works. We thrive on solving difficult, commercially relevant problems through an innovative and collaborative research and development process. Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D;, more than 160 years of materials science and process engineering knowledge, and a distinctive collaborative culture.

Corning Life Sciences brings new and innovative laboratory tools to researchers. Our core technical competencies include polymer science, biochemistry and molecular biology, glass melting and forming, surface modification, and characterization science. As part of Corning Incorporated, we are a world leader in specialty glass and have a 150-year tradition of innovation.

We are committed to meeting customers’ unique and changing needs with original solutions for today’s emerging life sciences technologies. Our dedication to quality, technology and innovation has enabled us to produce the world’s most comprehensive line of laboratory tools for life science research. Corning Life Sciences also offers custom capabilities such as special packaging, bar coding, and printed lot numbers, to meet specific customer requirements

To know more about Corning Life Sciences, visit us at: http://www.corning.com/products_services/life_sciences.aspx

description:
We currently have an opportunity for

a manufacturing process engineer with knowledge of and hands-on experience working on vacuum electronic device manufacturing processes for high frequency microwave and millimeter wave power amplifier products. Microwave amplifiers are employed in a variety of applications including radar, electronic warfare, and high-speed data communications. This position will

initially be located at our San Carlos, California location for approx. 6-9 months, then move to our Torrance, California facility when production relocates there.

MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support all manufacturing operations in a fast-paced production area, ensuring that key yield metrics are consistently met

Develop and implement processes in support of manufacturing activities

Document processes and procedures; conduct periodic training of assemblers and operators

Design, build, and test new equipment, tools, and fixtures for streamlining and improving manufacturing efficiency

Monitor key process parameters and analyze performance data. Identify risks and implement corrective actions. Spearhead continuous improvement efforts

Conduct

cost estimation and budgeting activities. Introduce new cost-saving methods

As required, source new tools, equipment, and material suppliers to ensure the uninterrupted manufacture and continuous flow of product

Support manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, and material review board (MRB) activities

Support internal and customer funded R&D; efforts

Interface with customers to understand needs and requirements. Map customer requirements and expectations to product specifications and manufacturing activities.

Qualifications

You will need at least three years of manufacturing engineering experience, with

experience in the microwave or RF device industry

preferred. Other qualifications that will enable you to perform successfully in this position include:

Hands-on experience with standard manufacturing methods and production processes for microwave and millimeter wave traveling wave tubes (TWTs)

Hands-on experience with high temperature thermal processes for hermetically joining dissimilar materials, including brazing and diffusion bonding methods

Hands-on experience operating and troubleshooting industrial furnaces for the heat treatment of metals and thermal processing of insulators

Good understanding of materials science and engineering principles for processing metals and insulators

Experience with mechanical design software such as SolidWorks

Ability to multi-task and interact effectively with colleagues from various disciplines, as well as customers

Excellent time management skills

Effective verbal and written communication skills

Microsoft Office skills

A bachelor’s degree in Materials, Mechanical Engineering, or a related engineering discipline is needed; a master’s degree is preferred.

US citizenship is required

In use on satellites, land-based devices, and airborne platforms that meet the critical needs of our customers, L-3 products have a proven history of high reliability. Be a part of that heritage by putting your unique skills to work with us as we develop and manufacture some of the most advanced products to be found on – or above – the planet. As you contribute to our success you’ll enjoy a competitive salary, excellent benefits, a 9/80 work schedule, and a small-company atmosphere with the backing of a Fortune 500 organization. be L-3

, we look forward to hearing from you.

description:
We are looking for an Engineering Technician focusing on the development of novel micro and nano-fabrication tools for the fabrication and testing of next generation scanning probe instruments.

Responsibilities:
- Operate state-of-the-art nanofabrication tools, including thin-film deposition tools, nanoscale inspection processes (AFM, TEM, SEM etc.).
- Assemble, install, and test homebuilt scientific instruments.
- Perform experiments and write documentation independently.

Qualifications:
- Proven ability to work in research environment.
- Self motivated and energetic person with good attitude on problem solving.
- Strong communication and people interaction skills. Good at presentation and documentation.
- Ability to work in a clean room environment.
- Ability to handle different projects in parallel.
- Experience with vacuum setups, optical, mechanical and electrical systems.
- Interest in mechanical or electrical engineering, physics, materials science.
- Experience with statistical process and quality control principles.
- Familiar with scanning probe instrumentation, and advanced control methods and image analysis is a plus.
- No engineering degree required.

Work is to be performed in a state-of-the-art research facility at the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, where you will be in extensive contact with highly motivated international scientists and R&D; professionals. Self-motivated persons with the ability to work in a dynamic start-up environment are given priority. Candidates must have excellent problem solving and communication skills for successful team interactions.
