description:
In support of product development programs, participates in the development of formulations (focused on oral solid dosage forms). Responsible for managing the dosage form manufacturing process development activities leading to technology transfer/scale-up of drug products. Responsible for the management, troubleshooting/ manufacturing investigations and validation activities at the Contract Service Providers (CSPs). Contributes both internally and externally in resolution of complex technical issues and implementation of new manufacturing process technology. Responsible for the manufacturing of clinical trial materials.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Leads the design and development of pharmaceutical formulations and manufacturing processes to support clinical trials, registration and commercialization.
  • Manages development, scale-up to manufacturing of clinical formulations and finished dosage forms at CSPs.
  • Serves as person-in-the plant at the CSP sites.
  • Plans project-related scientific and technical activities, e.g. interpretation of results, evaluation of data, formulates relevant and scientifically based conclusions, writes and presents technical reports.
  • Aurhors and reviews technical reports and documents suitable for regulatory submissions. Reviews MBRs, BPRs, development reports and relevant documents prepared by CSPs.
  • Drafts SOPs as needed to support manufacturing of finished drug product and clinical trial materials (CTM).
  • Liaises with analytical, manufacturing, quality and regulatory counterparts to develop plans and protocols for drug product development and for life cycle management of the established products.
  • Adheres to cGMP work practices and w orks closely with the Quality group to ensure strict compliance with applicable GXP procedures and compliance requirements.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned.
Education/Experience/Skills:

Advanced degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or related field. Ph.D. desirable. An equivalent combination of relevant education and applicable industry experience may be considered. A minimum of 7 yearsâ experience in progressively responsible roles with a focus on oral dosage form formulation and manufacturing process development with 4 years in a leadership role. Demonstrated success in the field of formulations and dosage form development. Experience authoring technical reports and CMC sections for regulatory filings.

Must possess:
  • Comprehensive understanding of the dosage formulation development process.
  • Comprehensive understanding of the oral dosage form manufacturing process development, scale-up, optimization and validation processes.
  • Extensive knowledge of cGMPs.
  • Skilled at managing CSPs.
  • Skilled at negotiating with business partners or management and influencing senior level leaders regarding matters of significance to the department or segments of the organization.
  • Adept at creating and communicating a clear vision among team members effectively aligning resources to achieve functional area goals.
  • Flexibility to travel domestically and internationally.

description:
Do you have what it takes to be challenged every day? Essai, Inc. is in search of inquisitive, creative, determined candidates who enjoy problem-solving and taking a theoretical concept into real-world applications to fill our Jr. Mechanical Engineer (Design Checker) position.

Essai, Inc. is a dynamic and innovative high-tech manufacturing company located in Fremont, CA. We are looking for exceptional individuals to join our team, who have high desire and drive to succeed both personally and professionally, in a fast paced and growing company. Located in the heart of Silicon Valley, Essai is a diverse, environmental-friendly company whose commitment to excellence has been recognized by America’s Fastest–Growing Private 5000 Companies.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• Quickly and accurately review drawings as part of a design review team for adherence to correct GD&T; standards and internal company standards
• Review designs as part of a design review team and check for adherence to correct product design standards, DFM and so forth
• Communicate with designers and applications engineers during the project review process
• Interact with Solidworks PDM to process files through various workflows
• Aggressively pursue knowledge about various product types and systems in order to understand how to create product that adheres to company design rules and drawing standards such as ASME GD&T;
• Interact with ERP software to manage BOM’s and review item cards for accuracy and adherence to company standards
• Quickly and accurately process Engineering Change Orders (ECO’s)
• Work independently to get multiple simultaneous projects into production while keeping a balanced schedule
• May be called upon to occasionally perform design activities as indicated by the department manager
• Use knowledge and experience with hands-on manufacturing methods to model products that adhere to design for manufacture and design for assembly practices
• Assist with achieving general department goals

Other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualification Requirement:

  • Candidate must have a minimum of a BS in Mechanical Engineering or a closely related field.

  • 2+ years of professional CAD experience are desired and preference will be given for candidates with official Solidworks certification.

  • 2+ years of daily professional experience with design checking and GD&T; (educational experience not applicable).

  • He/She must be capable of understanding mechanism design, dimensioning complex geometry, measurement standards, and have a general understanding of force deflection, materials science, thermodynamics, refrigeration and heat transfer.

  • The candidate must have very good oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.

  • Enthusiasm is highly valued, as is the ability to adapt quickly in a dynamic and demanding work environment.

  • Candidate should be self-started, disciplined, and willing to work with a flexible work schedule.
    • Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

  • Working grasp of GD&T.;

  • Understanding of design for manufacture.
    • Please note : This position is for our Fremont, CA location. There is no relocation assistance or visa sponsorship offered at this time. Job offers are pending successful completion of a background check, drug screen, and reference check.

    Please indicate your name and job title in the subject line when applying.

    Due to the large volume of resumes received, we are unable to acknowledge receipt of all applications. Candidates who meet specific qualifications will be contacted during the course of this search.

    This is a full-time, contract to hire position.

    Since 2003, Essai has been at the forefront of developing innovative solutions for leading technology and electronics companies. These include the world's largest consumer electronics company, the world's largest semiconductor company, and significant global players across our other market sectors. Developing from process automation and validation tools for product development, Essai is now a global player in engineering solutions and rapid prototyping.

description:
Job Description
About Thermo Fisher Scientific

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of $17 billion and 50,000 employees in 50 countries. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics and increase laboratory productivity. Our five premier brands â Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services â offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive support. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Patent Agent to join its Life Sciences Solutions Group at a site in the San Francisco Bay Area. This position will support the next-generation sequencing business, including its sample preparation instruments and its sequencing chips, instruments, and systems. Working closely with a diverse and talented group of researchers and engineers as well as a dynamic legal group, this position will help drive IP tactics and strategy for cutting-edge next-generation sequencing for research and clinical applications. Many different challenges and opportunities await the right candidate.

The Patent Agent will support a variety of IP initiatives, including: invention harvesting, patent preparation and prosecution, portfolio development and management, IP searching and/or landscaping, and support for freedom-to-operate analyses. Our Patent Agents are expected to develop an understanding of the business strategy for the groups they support to both inform the various IP initiatives as well as the underlying business decision-making processes. Further, agents actively participate in engaging and representing to the business the IP legal position on various opportunities that arise from this important work.

Technical areas of focus for this position include: automated sample preparation instruments, semiconductor designs and chips for sequencing, and more generally next-generation sequencing instruments, systems, and workflows.

Essential Qualifications:
  • Experience in invention harvesting, patent preparation and prosecution, portfolio development, and patent searching;
  • Excellent scientific and technical expertise;
  • An advanced degree in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics, materials science, chemical engineering, or a closely related field;
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and interpersonal, a collaborative instinct, and a high level of initiative; and
  • Registration to practice before the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Six or more years of experience preparing and prosecuting U.S. and international patent applications (writing samples will be requested);
  • A track record of success as a patent agent (ideally also including industry experience); and
  • Experience with next-generation sequencing technologies and related instrument platforms.
*LI-KP1 *IND-CORP

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
title: Sr Patent Agent

description:
FormFactor Inc.

Livermore, CA

FormFactor serves the top names in the semi-conductor industry. Our customers are producing cutting edge microchips to meet the demands of a fast-paced mobile driven world. These leaders need an expert to test their breakthrough technology, ensure it performs and get it to market fast. That's where FormFactor's revolutionary test equipment probe cards come in. These devices are created, designed and manufactured using complex, electrochemical processes in our growing Livermore fab.

We have an opportunity for a Process Engineer with electroplating expertise to develop and oversee electroplating processes to take our technology from R&D; into production. This role is responsible for the development, implementation, ramp, and continuous improvement of various advanced electrochemical processes used to manufacture our proprietary advanced MEMS probe cards. This engineer will also own and oversee the equipment used to run our electrochemical processes. Successful candidates must demonstrate a balanced and in-depth understanding of both the process physics and chemistry required to achieve a highly stable and predictive process.

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Unit process development, new design and technology setup.

Troubleshoot and manage overall process sustaining activities for MEMS electrochemical processes and equipment.

Partner with process technicians to provide training, gather information and improve processes.

Analyze data from production and engineering process runs, qualifying changes or additions to manufacturing toolsets and process flows.

Design and execute engineering experiments to either resolve process excursions or to drive process performance improvements.

Demonstrate a disciplined use of statistical methods to establish robust process controls and healthy process capabilities, analyze process yield, and perform experimental design and analysis.

Lead cross-functional projects to successfully solve complex unit process and integration challenges.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED

Ph.D. in Electrochemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or related field required.

Minimum of one year of related experience in process manufacturing or as Process Development Engineer in a MEMS, semiconductor, or other relevant production fab environment.

Ability to demonstrate a balanced and in-depth understanding of both the process physics and chemistry required to achieve a highly stable and predictive process.

Demonstrated experience setting up and sustaining electrochemistry equipment, processes, and various metrology methods associated with the control and monitor of such processes.

Hands-on experience with process, chemistry, and hardware development required for advanced electrochemical processes.

Proven track-record of developing and deploying creative and practical process solutions for high-volume manufacturing is a plus.

General familiarity with other standard MEMS unit processes and/or materials associated with thin films, photolithography, chemical-mechanical polishing and micro-assembly.

Proven ability to analyze and make meaningful inferences from large and sometimes incomplete data.

Experience working with a wide variety of different functions including R&D;, Process Integration, and Operations to effectively accomplish tasks in a timely manner.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Capability to adapt to the companyâs changing needs and priorities and be a self-motivated team player.

Willingness to take responsibility and ownership to aggressively focus on problems either individually or part of a larger team.

FormFactor is committed to providing a work environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and are committed to compliance with all Federal, State, and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, sex (including breastfeeding and related conditions), gender (including gender identity and gender expression), national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, registered domestic partner status, medical condition, military or veteran status, genetic characteristics or information, or any other legally protected characteristic. These protections extend to all employment and management decisions including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotions, pay practices, benefits, disciplinary actions and terminations, and all other terms and conditions of employment.

description:
Program Manager Req # 2006-26 Senior Engineer: Metrology and Failure Analysis

Position Description

The senior failure analysis and metrology engineer will be responsible for driving the technical direction of metrology, characterization , data and failure analysis for electronic packaging within Invensas . The engineer will be responsible to define the appropriate test and characterization protocols for application specific products. The engineer will work closely with the reliability and failure analysis as well as process development and assembly team s to promote a strong team environment.

Job Responsibilities
  • Assume tool ownership of multiple metrology and characterization equipment at Invensas labs. Operate the tools, oversee the operators, schedule PM and oversee consumable inventory management
  • Maintain understanding of technical roadmaps and latest technology tre nds in packaging of electronics
  • Develop methods , either standard or unique , to perform testing and FA in electronic devices and packaging
  • Research topics of interest and develop appropriate theories, test and characterization methods to prove or disprove a particular theory
Qualifications & Experience
  • Have a deep understanding of the physics of materials with hands-on experience in understanding semiconductor package, process and or product related improvements
  • Minimum of 6 years of experience with hands-on, direct technology or product development experience or metrology and characterization experience in the broad semiconductor or packaging industry
  • Able to learn new skills and tasks with depth of understanding quickly since our technical environment is an ever changing process
  • Some e xperience operating and maintaining equipment such as AFM, SEM, EDS analysis, profilometers , auger , SIMS, EELS and FTIR. Understands the fundamental physics behind these and broader characterization tools and techniques
  • Capable of working on a cross trained team ; exhibits good written and verbal communication skills
Additional Qualifications
  • Direct experience with failure analysis or reliability testing for electronic or optical devices and or packages
Education Requirements

description:
Corning is the world leader in specialty glass and ceramics, creating and manufacturing keystone components that enable high-technology systems.

Corning’s history is filled with breakthrough technologies that have played an important role in the way the world works. We thrive on solving difficult, commercially relevant problems through an innovative and collaborative research and development process. Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D;, more than 160 years of materials science and process engineering knowledge, and a distinctive collaborative culture.

A world leader in industrial research and development, Corning staunchly believes in change. We thrive on seeking new opportunities to make a difference for mankind and bringing them to life.

Our dedicated scientists conduct their research with the highest integrity, finely tuned processes and superb skill. Breakthroughs occur when our researchers leverage existing technologies across product lines or come as the result of a profound moment of inspiration or even as an unexpected, experimental outcome. That is when research is at its most exciting.

We do everything possible to sustain our culture of innovation. We continually invest in research and development to provide our scientists with the resources they need. This has enabled our scientific community to develop a unique ability to solve complex problems and maintain a keen focus on things that really matter -- technologies that improve our lives and change our world.

R&D; is the foundation on which Corning’s history has been built, and we have no doubt it will lead us to future technological triumphs.

To know more about Corning's Science and Technology division, please visit the R&D; website at:
http://www.corning.com/r_d/index.aspx

Scope of Position:

Corning West Technology Center is a small research and development firm in Sunnyvale, CA. CWTC leverages expertise in materials science and processing into the areas of optoelectronics, sensors, novel display applications and high-speed electronics. We are looking for a mechanical engineer with expertise in optical principles, components, and systems to help build and design prototypes and lab experiments in these areas.

Day to Day Responsibilities:

Activities include testing, building and debugging prototypes and experiments, collaborating with internal and external partners across many disciplines, and constantly learning and applying new skills to develop new technologies and products.

Travel Requirements: Minimal, mostly domestic.

Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time: 5 day, 40 hour work week.

Reference Number: 184097

Required Education: BS

Required Years and Area of Experience: Will consider junior to senior level applicants.

Required Skills:
  • Proven hands-on skills in mechanical assembly
  • Fundamental optics knowledge (TIR, waveguides, polarization, lenses, mirrors, prisms…)
  • Familiarity with optical bench components (optical tables, stages, mounts)
  • Familiarity with ME CAD software
  • Good computer skills including advanced Excel
  • Programming experience, preferably C.
  • Laboratory Experience
Desired Skills:
  • Aptitude for clean and safe laboratory practices
  • Machine shop experience (Lathe, mill, CNC)
  • Knowledge of light sources and detectors (LEDs, Lasers, photodiodes)
Soft Skills (Communication/Team/Leadership):
  • Good spoken and written communication skills
  • Flexible team player

EOE/AA including Veterans and Disabled.

description:
D-Wave is seeking to expand its Fabrication team with a full time Senior Process Integration Engineer to support our superconductor IC fabrication process development. Though an asset, existing knowledge of superconductivity is not a requirement. Based in Palo Alto, CA, you will conduct various process development projects, and oversee and maintain the process of record (POR) fab technology in production. You will have the capability to lead the development effort at our foundries; travel anticipated to be approximately 20% of the time.

We have established a unique, proprietary, state-of-the-art superconducting electronics fabrication capability that includes a broad range of Jc targeting, 6 wiring layers, planarized dielectrics, 0.25µm features, and 0.6µm diameter Josephson junctions. Comprising over 128,000 Josephson junctions, the D-Wave 2000Q processors are the largest and most complex superconducting circuit in the world ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josephson_junction_count ). You will face the challenge of designing fabrication processes in uncharted territory as we develop and implement novel superconducting devices at unprecedented levels of integration.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead new process developments at foundry
  • Design, execute, and analyze experiments
  • Responsible for critical or complex steps or layers in the wafer fabrication process
  • Communicate and present technical information to stakeholder and senior leadership across the organization

Required Qualifications:
  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or Materials Science ( Master's or Ph.D. is preferred)
  • Preferably 10+ years’ experience in process integration
  • Working knowledge of module processes including thin films deposition, lithography, etch, diffusion, wet process, and CMP
  • Experience with LSI manufacturing or R&D; is strongly preferred
  • Demonstrated understanding the interactions between process and yield, product performance and reliability
  • Must be legally able to work in the US. Ability to obtain US Federal security clearance is preferred
  • Ability to travel within the US (potential for future overseas travel) approximately 20% of the time
  • Strong organizational and decision making skills
  • Excellent written & verbal communication
  • Ability to work well in a fast-paced team environment that is focused on priorities and end results
  • A track record of high productivity and a proven ability to meet deadlines

Interested applicants should apply on our website at http://www.dwavesys.com/careers . We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those who are selected for interviews will be contacted.

It is D-Wave Systems Inc. policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status , or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, local law.

This business uses E-Verify in its U.S. hiring practices to achieve a lawful workforce. E-Verify® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.
title: Senior Integration Engineer (Palo Alto)

description:
The Institute for Collaborative Biotechnologies (ICB) is an Army-sponsored University Affiliated Research Center (UARC). The ICB is a uniquely interdisciplinary research alliance led by the University of California, Santa Barbara, in collaboration with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, the California Institute of Technology and partners from the Army and industry.

ICB research is driven by more than 50 premier faculty working together with graduate students project scientist, specialists, and professional researchers as interdisciplinary teams of biologists, chemists, physicists, psychologists, physicians, social scientists, and engineers. These teams develop biologically inspired, revolutionary technological innovations in systems and synthetic biology, materials science and engineering, biotechnology tools and cognitive neuroscience.

The ICB is actively seeking a Postdoctoral Scholar to conduct research on bioinformatics and synthetic biology projects, primarily focused on studies of the microbiome and bacteriophages, under the mentorship of Dr. Irene Chen.

Postdoctoral Scholar appointments are intended to provide a full-time training program of advanced academic preparation and research training under the mentorship of a faculty member.

The appointee will engage in one or more of the following: analysis of sequencing data from complex microbial systems, including analysis of the phage fraction, bioconjugation of phages and phage proteins to report nanostructures and molecules, phage display selection, and interdisciplinary research.

The postdoctoral scholar will assist with mentoring graduate students, junior researchers, and undergraduate students who will also work on the project.

Appointees to this series must possess a doctorate or its equivalent at the time of initial appointment, and PhD must be conferred within the last 5 years. Additional qualifications include" PhD with emphasis in Biophysics, Biomolecular Science and Engineering, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, and or related research, and previous research experience in applicable or relevant field.

Initial appointment will be made for one year. Reappointments are made based on continuation of funding and performance.

The committee will begin reviewing applications by 12/3/16, following the initial application deadline of 12/2/16. Applications received after this date will be reviewed every 2 to 3 weeks. Recruitment for this position will end on 1/13/17. We anticipate the position to begin on 1/26/17 or later.

Equal Opportunity

The department is especially interested in candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of the academic community through research, teaching and service.

The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job location Santa Barbara, CA
Requirements Documents
  • Curriculum Vitae - Your most recently updated C.V.



  • Cover Letter



How to apply
  • Create an ApplicantID
  • Provide required information and documents
title: Postdoctoral Scholar in Bioinformatics and Synthetic Biology

description:
Senior Starff Engineer – ROS

Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Through our dedication to customer-centric innovation and strong partnerships, we have established end-to-end advantages in telecom networks, devices and cloud computing. We are committed to creating maximum value for telecom operators, enterprises and consumers by providing competitive solutions and services. Our products and solutions have been deployed in over 170 countries, serving more than one third of the world’s population. Huawei has over 150,000 employees, approximately 70,000 of which are engaged in Research & development. Huawei operates a global network of 14 regional headquarters, 16 R&D; Centers, 28 Innovation Centers jointly operated with customers, and 45 Training Centers. Huawei is leading the way by rethinking the future. From devices to telecom infrastructure to cloud computing and convergence solutions, we are rethinking every link in the chain with ICT based innovation to deliver a better future... faster.

In this role, you’ll analyze and define the ROS system requirements of home service robot applications. Participate in the system design of the environment sensing and human-robot interaction. Implement functional integration for robot subsystem. Top candidates will have experience with implementation and integration of environment sensing and human-robot interaction components for robot applications. Ensure good user experience.
  • Ph.D. or M.Sc. in Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other related degrees.
  • Hands-on experience with robotics software development in C, C++ or Python.
  • Experience with one or more of the following areas:
  • Robotics Operating System (ROS)
  • Robot Perception and Manipulation,
  • Motion Planning and Control.
  • Excellent knowledge of Linux as well as RTOS embedded systems
  • Sensor fusion or algorithm experience relevant to Robotics systems.
  • Strong research and problem solving skills
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills

Huawei Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
Development Scientist-Newport Beach, CA Area

DESCRIPTION:
This position is responsible for developing novel optical adhesives and films involving functional nanoparticles, such as quantum dots and nano-crystals. Responsibilities may include design, formulation, testing, processing, and scale-up of proprietary electronic materials. Products must be developed in a timely manner that will permit their evaluation, qualification, and implementation by customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Additional responsibilities include determining development strategy and direction, valuing projects, leveraging technology across different projects, interacting with Research Platforms, and supervising technicians and junior chemists.

Lead complex, long and short term product development projects with focus on the use of functional nanoparticles in display applications; determine technology approach and conceive innovative routes in the formulation, processing, and testing of materials; employ sound experimental designs to effectively develop new materials for electronic applications.

Prepare and deliver presentations on research projects for customers, management and technical audiences; provide technical support services to manufacturing and quality as required.

Actively promote technology across various groups and development teams; seek new technology directions from other groups and from the Research Platforms; support intellectual property activities and provide guidance and recommendations on patents, trademarks and proprietary agreements; contribute to the development of IP strategies for area of responsibility.

Assure all PD laboratory work is carried out in a safe manner including employees wearing personal protective equipment, trained on safety practices, 5s, etc; and that products and processes comply with all deferral and state regulatory agencies; assure all new products meet international chemical health and safety requirements.

Supervise and coach technicians and associate chemists on chemistry and processes and on day to day activities; able to work in a chemical lab environment and with lab equipment and computers; able to carry out laboratory activities.

REQUIREMENTS:
Ph.D. degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or other relevant discipline plus 3+ years of experience in the areas of optical/display materials, surface chemistry/physics, adhesive or film.

Film processing or optical film expertise highly desirable; alternatively, a Masters or Bachelor?s degree plus 7+ years of experience may be considered.

Full understanding and extensive knowledge in the relationship between chemical structures and physical/mechanical/optical properties is a must; experience in the analysis and application of chemical, physical, mechanical and optical data to problem solving and product development; demonstrated ability to partner with customers in product development programs.

May be required to reach, squat, bend and lift up to 25 lbs.
title: Development Scientist

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Division

Our Regulatory Affairs and Compliance Team enables the company’s “freedom to operate” through: the filing and management of product registrations and patent and trademark applications; the design and implementation of compliance, traceability, and quality programs; and the execution of a robust and creative global, regulatory strategy that paves the way for the timely and competitive introduction of new products and technologies to the market. Alongside the Operations Team, the Regulatory Affairs Team works in close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel to move the company’s vision forward.

Job Description

The Regulatory Specialist will be responsible for understanding food, environmental, and import/export regulations for products and operations in the US and abroad, and relaying this information to team members and Apeel Sciences Management. The Regulatory Specialist’s role is to help anticipate areas in which Apeel Sciences will require ‘freedom to operate’, coordinate and execute on the procedures necessary for gaining the appropriate authorizations, and ensure that the company remains in compliance with local, state, and federal regulations for its food products, R&D; operations, manufacturing operations, and overall business development. The Regulatory Specialist will work closely with the Regulatory Team and the Operations Team, but will also coordinate regulatory efforts across all Divisions.

Responsibilities and Outcomes (including but not limited to):
  • Work in a cross-functional group (including but not limited to R&D;, Manufacturing, Operations, and Marketing and Sales).
  • Interaction with government agencies (local, state, and federal).
  • Manage working relationships with various consultants external to Apeel Sciences.
  • Review product changes for impact on regulatory filings within the US and globally.
  • Prepare, review, and finalize reports and other documents for formal submission to regulatory agencies.
  • Keep up with current changes to regulations and understand how they may impact Apeel Sciences (be proactive, not just reactive).
  • Recommend and develop compliance programs within Apeel Sciences, and assist with conducting internal audits.
  • Maintain permits, licenses, and registrations for both food and environmental regulatory compliance.
  • Prepare research and other materials to assist company Management with official communications.
  • Create and review Standard Operating Procedures in accordance with applicable regulations.
  • Assist in domestic and international trade compliance procedures, including generating shipping documentation and understanding applicable regulatory requirements.
Requirements

  • Thorough understanding of food, environmental, and trade regulations and requirements.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong team player.
  • Extremely detail oriented.
  • Strong critical thinking skills.
  • Effective communication, both verbal and written (including proficiency with technical writing), and willing to engage across multiple scientific/engineering disciplines.
  • Ability to take initiative without significant direction, implementing independent judgment to determine objectives on a variety of projects.
Qualifications

  • Candidates with an advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in life or health sciences (e.g., toxicology, biochemistry, food sciences), physical sciences, engineering, public health, or regulatory affairs are preferred, but strong candidates with an undergraduate degree (BA or BSc) in science, engineering, regulatory affairs, food science, or an equivalent thereof and relevant experience are also encouraged to apply.
  • Individuals with 2-5 years of experience in a regulatory compliance role relating to food or the environment will be given preference. Experience with foreign jurisdictions will be a strong bonus.
title: Regulatory Specialist (Food/Environmental)

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Division

Comprised of an interdisciplinary team of materials scientists, chemists, biologists, chemical engineers, mechanical engineers, and software engineers working in close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel, the Product Team encompasses the Product Research & Development, Product Quality, and Product Integration functions of the company. Using custom-built tools and software, these functions address both pre-harvest and post-harvest product optimization and performance evaluation on fresh produce. In addition, the Team is responsible for the design, fabrication, and implementation of our product delivery systems for both infield and packinghouse product application.

Job Description

Apeel Sciences is seeking a motivated, resourceful, and creative candidate to be responsible for activities conducted on-site at customer locations such as packinghouses and distributions centers and which are required for successful implementation of programs utilizing Apeel Sciences’ technologies. These technologies include natural products designed to maintain the postharvest quality of fresh fruits, vegetables and ornamentals. The successful candidate will represent the Product Team and work closely with both the technical and non-technical teams at Apeel.

Responsibilities and Outcomes (including but not limited to):
  • Responsible for on-site activities required for successful implementation of programs utilizing Apeel Sciences’ products
  • Responsible for conducting needs assessments, advising customers on product use and product application
  • Provide ongoing post-sales support
  • Conduct product trials and demonstrations.
  • Participation in sales related activities as a technical expert
  • Continuously improve skills and expertise in three key areas: sales skills, Apeel Sciences’ technologies, postharvest horticulture
  • Identify and resolve issues in a timely manner.
Key Interactions

  • Internal interactions will involve working with a cross-functional team consisting of scientists, engineers, sales and marketing personnel.
  • External interactions involve working with Operations and QA Managers at fruit and vegetable packing operations, as well as packinghouse and field employees at those locations. Similar interactions at food distribution centers.
Travel

  • This position involves up to 65% travel. The travel is mostly U.S. domestic travel involving trips of 1-3 days to visit customer sites. On-site work will involve occasional travel outside the U.S. as required.
Qualifications

Experience Required:
  • Three years of work experience in the fruit and vegetable industry. Preferably with experience in packinghouse operations, QA or production.
Essential Knowledge and Skills:
  • BS or MS preferably in Postharvest Horticulture, Agronomy, Food Science or related field. Other science or engineering degree acceptable with appropriate work experience in produce industry.
  • Experience in fruit/vegetable production, packing and distribution operations or QA activities
  • Experience in customer facing roles
  • Ability to work independently while on-site at customer locations
  • Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills required
  • Strong technical writing skills required
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Must be organized and detail oriented
  • Creativity and problem-solving skills required
  • Spanish language skills not required, but strongly preferred
title: Postharvest Application Specialist

description:
The Applications Engineering Manager balances an outward, or customer focus and an internal focus, meeting the needs of the Company to meet those customers’ needs. The position calls for technical marketing responsibilities and development of new or modified processes in support of Revasum’s strategic direction. The Applications Engineering Manager collaborates with current and potential customers regarding specific needs and recommends changes and modifications which help improve overall machine functions over final test results. Evaluates test results to determine if any machine design or modifications are necessary.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Manage process demonstration and development schedule, allowing mechanical and software engineering access, as needed. Requires coordination with Sales and Marketing.
  • Develop applications, define system and performance specifications.
  • Write and negotiate product performance specifications based on customer need and Revasum’s capabilities.
  • Provide summarized data and process information to Marketing for publication.
  • Write technical papers for publication and presentation at technical conferences.
  • Travel to customer sites (domestic and overseas) to deliver technical presentations and interact with customers to support sales efforts.
  • Direct and perform experiments on Revasum polishing and grinding equipment to determine a BKM (Best Known Method) for superior results on polishing and grinding tools.
  • Directly supervise three non-supervisory employees.
  • Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

Skills & Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Computer Skills:

To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of MS Excel and MS Word

Language Skills:

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.

Mathematical Skills:

Ability to comprehend and apply principles of advanced calculus, modern algebra, and advanced statistical theory.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Other Skills

Familiarity with governing standards in the semiconducting industry, including but not limited to: SEMI

Competencies:

  • Accuracy
  • Accountability
  • Adaptability
  • Communications - Oral & Written
  • Customer Service Skills
  • Decision Making
  • Dependability
  • Ethics
  • Job Knowledge
  • Interpersonal Skills
  • Managing People
  • Ethics
  • Loyalty & Dedication
  • Judgment
  • Planning/Organizing
  • Problem Solving
  • Quality
  • Safety and Security

FIELD OR BACKGROUND: Semiconductor device manufacturing, CMP and grinding or related wafer manufacturing methods

EDUCATIONAL DEGREE REQUIRED and/or EQUIVALENT EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree, plus ≥10 years experience

PREFERRED FIELD OF STUDY: Materials science, chemistry, mechanical engineering, physics

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Semiconductor device manufacturing, CMP and grinding or related wafer manufacturing methods: 10 years
title: Applications Engineering Manager 2

description:
Description PURPOSE

This position commonly reports to both the Operations Manager and has a dotted line relationship to the Responsible Plant NDT Level 3. Supervisory responsibility for department production and throughput, managing hourly workforce planning, reviews, time and attendance, turnover, hiring / firing, and progressive disciplinary actions within their department.

Incumbent provides expert judgment and analysis for the design, development and implementation of processes, plans and procedures. Designs methods to improve efficiency in production, reduce process variability and assure compliance with approved methods and quality standards exercising discretion and independent judgment in the evaluation of possible courses of conduct and acting or making decisions after the various possibilities have been considered.

Purpose:

Essential Job Functions:
  • Responsible for the safe manufacture of products, safety in the areas of responsibility, and maintaining a safe, injury free work environment. Ensures compliance with legal requirements and company safety policies.
  • Ensures that all employees work in a safe manner and that employees are properly trained in all safety procedures. Ensures that good housekeeping practices are consistently followed.
  • Ensures effective employee relations. Provides employee coaching and development. Resolves employee issues through problem resolution.
  • Responsible for adherence to process control procedures, operating instructions, and all quality control instructions.
  • Plans, organizes and supervises shift operations in accordance with production schedules and requirements in the most cost effective manner.
  • Responsible for process control in area of responsibility. Maintains awareness of policies and procedures and assures compliance by assigned employees.
  • Ensures that thru-put and target earned hours are attained and budget criteria is met or exceeded.
  • Works with employees to effectively resolve work place issues, gives necessary feedback on employee performance.
  • Conducts formal performance appraisals and recommends/approves pay increases, transfers and promotions in accordance with company policy and procedures and state and federal laws.
  • Interviews and hires (recommends for hire) employees.
  • Develops, trains, and involves employees in maintaining and improving departmental efficiency, productivity, quality, safety, cooperation and morale.
  • Maintains adequate staffing to meet required production schedules.
  • Assists with and provides input for annual budget for areas of responsibility. Thereafter, adheres to budget plans. Meets monthly budgets.
Incumbent may be tasked with qualification and certification of NDT personnel to NAS 410, auditing NDT systems at their assigned facility and evaluation and compliance of all NDT processes and systems.

1. Prepare and verify work instructions for NDT methods to be in compliance with customer specification and requirements.
2. Train, test and certify NDT inspectors in the method(s) and techniques certified per the latest revision of PCC’s Quality Control procedures and the Responsible Level 3.
3. Analyzes and interpret inspection quality data, conduct research on product defects, and recommend modification in products or quality standards, where such appear to be warranted.
4. May serve as liaison with customers on items NDT related inspection and visit customers and suppliers where necessary on specific inspection matters.
5. Provide guidance and expertise to sales, engineering and manufacturing on NDT issues with regards to customer inquires.
6. Perform system audits on all NDT areas of the assigned campuses and annexes.
7. Assist in the development of new NDT process and procedures with regards to new technology and customer approval of that technology.
8. Insure compliance with customer and government regulations as pertaining to the inspection departments, including ability to interpret codes standards and other contractual documents.
9. Assist Responsible Level III as required and directed in aspects of the NDT inspection program.
10. Develop new inspection methods and/or programs that promote cost reduction activities.

Qualifications:

1. Two or Four years of college with a degree, may have an emphasis in NDT, or four years of experience operating as a certified level two lead in Penetrant and Radiographic testing
2. Investment casting experience (3 to 5 years)
3. Certified ASNT level II in Radiography (RT), penetrant (PT).
4. Must have excellent communication and analytical skills.

Supervisory Skills:

Manufacturing Expertise

Demonstrates a fundamental knowledge of and ability to apply PCC budgeting process and financial management tools. Demonstrates a fundamental knowledge of and ability to understand and apply the PCC planning process. Demonstrates fundamental knowledge of and ability to apply the PCC manufacturing processes in area of responsibility. Demonstrates fundamental knowledge of and ability to apply “lean”, “TOC”, “interference management” and “NEI” processes in areas of responsibility.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS:

· Internal: Engineers, production employees and various levels of management. Discuss product related issues. Requires tact, leadership, and influence.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS:

1. Requires an AA or BS degree with 3-4 years relevant experience OR equivalent experience.
2. Broad practical knowledge of RT & PT inspection of mechanical, industrial, materials science engineering along with investment casting technology.

WHY PCC:

A career at PCC Structurals opens countless opportunities for employees to grow their skills, push limits and uncover their potential. PCC has facilities around the world. We are proud of our roots, the people we employ, and the products that we manufacture. Each day, we are committed to safety, providing quality products and striving for operational excellence. PCC Structurals is proud to foster a culture of success and accountability among employees and an electric atmosphere for professional growth. No matter the location, or the role, every PCC employee shares one mission: excellence by design and success through execution.

Why join the Structurals Team?

The Structurals Division is run by leaders who when faced with problems choose to see it, solve it, drive it and own it. We are smart, resourceful, "Type A Personalities" who are committed to winning daily. We are completely comfortable challenging upwards, focused on finding innovative solutions and able to roll up our shirt sleeves and operate tactically, yet think strategically.

Precision Castparts is the world leader in structural investment castings, forged components, and airfoil castings for aircraft engines and industrial gas turbines. Airbus, Boeing, GE, Rolls-Royce, and many other leading manufacturers depend on us for critical airframe, engine, power generation, medical, and general industrial components. With few exceptions, every aircraft in the sky flies with parts made by PCC.

The Structurals Division is the world leader in manufacturing high-quality, complex investment castings for aircraft engine, industrial gas turbine, airframe, and other applications, including the world's largest diameter investment cast components.
PCC Structurals is committed to a diverse workforce. As Equal Opportunity Employer, VEVRAA Federal Contractor, affirmative action employer we provide equal opportunity to all persons, regardless of race, religion, age, gender, disability, status as a protected veteran, national origin, color, or any other classification in accordance with federal, state, and local statutes, regulations and ordinances "Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran Status/VEVRAA Federal Contractor". Veterans are encouraged to self-identify as PCC Structurals desires to provide protected veterans priority referrals for open positions. PCC Structurals complies with all laws and regulations associated with the Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA).

In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans’ Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 503-652-3512 for assistance. Veterans are encouraged to self-identify as desires to provide protected veterans priority referrals for open positions. description:
As a Senior Optical Engineer, you will engage with an experienced inter-disciplinary staff to conceive and design innovative consumer products with display and optics features. You will work closely with an internal inter-disciplinary team to drive key aspects of display definition, execution, test and delivery. We are looking for candidates who thrive in a fast paced start-up like environment and want to invent the future.You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. To be successful you need to be highly motivated and detail oriented while delivering to the highest standards.

Responsibilities include:
  • Serve as the technical lead for optics + display hardware through the entire product life cycle, from developing roadmap through design to mass-production support
  • Manage the technical relationship with optics and display vendors to deliver new display components to the required specification and schedule
  • Perform hands-on bring-up, testing and troubleshooting of optics and displays and associated control electronics
  • Function as a subject matter expert on optics technology by providing up-to-date, accurate information to colleagues and management

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Optics, Physics, Computer Engineering and/or Materials Science
  • 7+ years of experience in the consumer electronics, optics or display industry as a hardware engineer
  • Experience with optics and display development or product integration
  • Strong background in electrical engineering
  • Experience with optics and display test equipment and methods
  • Experience working with overseas partners
  • Ability to travel internationally when required

Preferred Qualifications
  • Masterâs or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics or related field Âˇ Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with attention to detail
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Serve as the technical lead for optics and display components through the entire product life cycle, from road mapping through design in to mass-production support
  • Manage the technical relationship with optics and display vendors to deliver new components to the required specification and schedule
  • Perform hands-on bring-up, testing, and troubleshooting of optics, displays and associated control electronics
  • Function as a subject matter expert on optics, display technology by providing up-to-date, accurate information to colleagues and management
  • Experience in working with international, cross-functional teams
title: Senior Optical Engineer

description:
Join the Quantum Dot Pioneers!
Nanosys is building a materials revolution, combining scientific expertise with awareness of the system needs of TV and display manufacturers. We are looking for people who are not only energetic, committed and passionate about what they do, but focused on applying innovation to help industries overcome obstacles through materials architecture. We have a roll-up your sleeves culture that is based upon individual empowerment, mutual respect, integrity and recognition of successes.
Our quantum dots are designed to increase the range of colors emitted by standard displays by up to 50% and thats why we are interested in the color emitting characteristics of the semi-conductor materials we synthesize into fluorescent nanocrystals. Once created, the dots are coated onto a barrier film that we call QDEF, which in turn is added to a display during the manufacturing process. We are constantly developing new dots, looking at new methods of encapsulation and always pushing the R&D; envelope regarding the materials we design and manufacture. We have been very successful in developing the market for quantum dots in the display industry and we are currently developing our next generation of game changing devices which involves the development of Quantum Dots as emitters of light & color and it is for this reason that we invite you to consider the following opportunity at Nanosys:
Director of R&D; - QLED Devices

We are looking for an experienced, up-beat, highly technical manager who can lead a ground breaking R&D; program. Innovation in both materials and devices are required for development of the next generation of emitters for the display industry (think of an OLED that uses Quantum Dots!).

The ideal candidate will come from a light-emitting device background (preferably OLED) and will have a successful track record in the development of thin-film / electro-photonic devices and will have led projects in either the display, lighting or solar cell industry.

Summary of essential job functions:
Work with the VP of R&D; to develop and then execute agreed upon research and product development timelines.

Manage a multi-disciplinary team who are developing both the materials, devices, and characterization of these devices.

Build consensus around ideas and projects.

Develop budgets, timelines and materials performance criteria and appropriate measurement criteria.

Lead the QLED (Quantum Dot Electroluminescence) team to develop and execute agreed upon materials performance timelines.

Work with the material scientists to modify materials for improved device performance.

Work with external partners and collaborators to accelerate development.

Recruit, train and motivate team members into a strong, cohesive team.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
A highly creative leader. Able to bring out creativity in staff while adding his/her own ideas collaboratively.

Structures a technical approach to meet time-based deliverables.

Excellent leadership, collaboration and interpersonal skills and the ability to work with cross-disciplinary groups.

Extensive experience in the development and characterization of novel materials; especially where little or no literature exists.

Strong test methodology background associated with electro-optical characterization of these devices; including measurement of EQE, device lifetime, as well as approaches to probe failure modes of these devices.

Experience with semiconductor device modeling, band diagrams, and approaches to resolving issues illuminated by these models.

An understanding of materials science and device physics as it applies to improving both device efficiency and lifetime. Experience determining origin of device failure modes highly desired.

Superior problem solving skills.

A willingness to take chances, think beyond the conventional and then test a hypothesis and re-calibrate in order to reach a materials performance goal.

Education & Experience:
A Ph.D. in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Material Science or a very closely related discipline.

Experience managing and leading the people, processes, projects and budgets associated with new product development in an R&D; environment.

10+ years of relevant industrial experience developing OLED or other thin film devices ideally in the display or lighting industry.

Experience with the development of innovative/novel materials in the thin film space.

Hands-on experience with semiconductor device physics including device fabrication and testing.

Ideally have experience working with Quantum Dots.

Nanosys offers competitive salary including stock options with a wide range of benefits including a comprehensive health plan, basic life and AD&D;, short and long-term disability insurance, 401(k) savings plan, 4 weeks paid time off, and 11 paid holidays.

description:
IBM is hiring a Hardware Developer Co-op to perform Electrical and Magnetic Design and Test of Magnetic Recording Head sensor for tape drives. This position is located at the IBM Almaden Research Center and the individual will work in and with the Tape Head Development Team. In addition, the qualified candidate will work with our key fab supplier in San Jose who develops and manufactures the wafer and head modules for our tape drives. Finally, the individual will also work closely with our Zurich Research team to develop advanced tape head sensors for advanced tape drive research.

This is an opportunity to work with technically diverse team which develops archive storage for the CLOUD. Work with key technical and engineering challenges to advance the technology for new products and for research. As Moore's law reaches its fundamental limits in other technologies, tape sensor technology can be advanced for the next 15-20 years. Additional opportunity to reach and define new novel storage technologies. New patents in current and new areas are a major plus.

Teamwork is key in this job role. Candidate must be able to work with diverse personalities and have humility and drive to get the job done. Attention to design detail and execution are very important. In addition, interest in the current technology and developing new technology are equally important.

This role is a 6 month Co-op opportunity.

Pursuing an EE, Mechanical or Materials Science advanced degree, with interest in Magnetics and magnetic recording
Desire to work in Magnetics

Exposure to Magnetic recording development/industry
Masters or PhD Student
title: Hardware Developer Co-op - Tape Head & Channel Design-San Jose, CA

Job Description
  • Leads failure mode analysis (FMA) of device failures associated with solder creep, delamination/voids, and device performance degradation
  • Identifies root cause for failures and proposes containment and corrective actions
  • Recommends and executes qualification tests for new processes/components compatible with automotive, telecom and consumer semiconductor products
  • Performs data analysis utilizing DOE and FMEA tools regularly throughout product life cycle
  • Generates failure analysis reports and engineering/qualification reports for new processes/products
  • Plan and execute on schemes to improve product yield and reliability
  • Communicates/contributes effectively in cross-functional teams (such as manufacturing, quality and supply-chain management)
Requirements
  • Hands-on experience with failure analysis of semiconductor devices
  • Experience with analytic tools to interrogate failures (e.g., SEM/EDX, FTIR, Sonoscan, X-Ray)
  • Familiarity with DFX, FMEA, and DOE tools
  • Familiarity with Automotive, MIL-STD-883, GR-468-CORE, and JEDEC qualification standards
  • Education should be MS in Materials Science or equivalent with 5+ years of experience in optoelectronic components industry
  • US citizenship or permanent residency preferred

description:
Citrine is the artificial intelligence platform for materials and chemicals. Our platform ingests and understands large-scale data from countless sources, such as patents, research papers, technical reports, and existing databases, and uses state-of-the-art AI to anticipate the behavior of all materials and chemicals under any relevant conditions. Check out our outstanding group of customers and partners ( http://www.citrine.io/partners ). Citrine is backed by top tier Silicon Valley venture capital firms including: Innovation Endeavors, Data Collective, Prelude Ventures, AME Cloud Ventures, Morado Ventures, and XSeed Capital.

Position Summary

The Senior Data Engineer will lead our efforts to build and implement robust tools and systems to automate the aggregation, extraction, and structuring of large-scale materials science data to our organization for modeling and analysis. Data are the lifeblood of Citrine, comprising the essential input to our artificial intelligence models of materials behavior. This role involves extensive processing of unstructured data, construction of large-scale data-processing systems, and close collaboration with the Data Science, Scientific Engineering, and Web Engineering teams. The ideal candidate has experience building very flexible systems, enjoys solving complex problems, and is comfortable operating with a fast-paced and iterative work style.

Responsibilities

  • Selecting, structuring, verifying, and processing large sets of materials science data from a variety of siloed sources for inclusion in Citrine’s materials science data platform
  • Selecting and integrating any relevant big data tools and frameworks appropriate for Citrine’s data
  • Building automation tools
  • Implementing efficient, robust, and flexible ETL workflows
  • Building proof of concept demos
  • Maintaining Citrine’s materials database; cleaning data to remove errors from the original datasets and to identify possible spurious or physically unreasonable data points that would have a detrimental effect on the models
  • Integrating new data management technologies
  • Providing technical mentorship to junior team members
Required Skills

  • Creative problem solving ability; love of solving complex technical challenges
  • Strong scripting ability (python highly-preferred)
  • SQL-based technologies
  • Experience with Scala
  • Experience in large-scale distributed systems
  • Experience with integration of structured and unstructured data
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Highly desirable, but not required

  • Predictive modeling, NLP, and text analysis
  • Materials Science, Chemistry, or related physical science expertise
Educational Requirements

A bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, mathematics, or other technical discipline OR equivalent work experience (minimum of 3 years in data engineering, software engineering, or data science is highly preferred).

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, or national origin.
title: Senior Data Engineer

There is no greater calling or opportunity for a fluid management company than today's challenge helping customers protect people, the environment and our natural resources. Together we are implementing technologies that purify and conserve water, consume less energy, make alternative energy sources possible and practical, advance medicine and minimize emissions and waste. Our collective efforts are enabling a greener more sustainable future.

Position Summary:
As Product Manager you are responsible for development and maintenance of product features from concept to launch that deliver business value to our customers. You will partner with other product management team members to define business requirements, develop product plans, and drive engineering efforts across the company. Successful candidates will have a strong background in gathering user requirements, prioritizing roadmaps, and working with a cross-functional team to deliver a first-class user experience. A successful Product Manager is an expert on their products with excellent communication skills to evangelize products internally across teams as well as externally. To succeed in this role, you must be able to move fast, break down complex problems, and make data-driven decisions to delight our customers.

Specific responsibilities will include:
  • Responsible for managing the development, introduction, and continual product management of products and customer facing services. Including managing relationships, the development and management of new products, and product enhancements
  • Be the voice of our customers. Engage directly with partners and customers to understand how they work with our products, their challenges and opportunities for growth
  • Drive the development of end-to-end quality metrics, be the voice of quality within the company, and measure the effectiveness of the product
  • Work closely with engineering and product teams to develop an engineering plan to meet business requirements and prioritize features
  • Build strong cross-functional partnerships at multiple levels within the company, including engineering, sales, and operations
Qualifications:
  • 2+ years of experience in a product related role and proven track record of delivering products from conception through launch
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field; advanced degrees and degrees in fields related to materials science, chemistry, or chemical engineering preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills, both in technical and business-oriented settings
  • Proven ability to keep many balls in the air and work independently in a high-stakes, high-pressure setting
  • Distilling complex technical issues for business audiences, and elucidating business priorities to technical audiences
  • Rapidly and autonomously devising and implementing creative, efficient, and economical solutions to challenges that inevitably emerge in product development
title: Product Manager

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Division

Our Operations Team works in close collaboration with the other Divisions at Apeel and is responsible for determining, implementing, and facilitating the means by which the company may realize its strategic goals and objectives. This is reflected by the different functional roles encompassed by Operations, which include: Supply Chain Logistics and Management; Facilities; IT; Environmental Health & Safety; and Regulatory Affairs & Compliance. In short, Operations keeps the “wheels on the bus” and is a central function that touches all aspects of the company’s work.

Job Description

Apeel Sciences is seeking a motivated and highly detail- and process-oriented individual to implement and execute facilities planning, maintenance, and management, manufacturing logistics, and related aspects of our technical operations. The individual will represent Operations, work closely with the Regulatory Compliance, Safety, Formulation, Process Engineering, and Product Development teams at Apeel, and will report to the Vice President of Operations.

Outcomes and Responsibilities (including but not limited to):
Outcomes

  • Coordinate and drive the actions required as part of the renovation and build-out of our second, expanded facility. This includes:
  • Working with our property brokers and project contractors to ensure high-quality and efficient progress of the project.
  • Establishing and managing relationships with local, regional, state, and federal officials and professionals to support the project.
  • Working with our Plant Manager and contracted engineering professionals to support timely construction, assembly, commissioning, and operation of the pilot plant.
  • Coordination of the company's relocation from our current headquarters into the new space.
  • Keep the wheels on the bus and the building, its systems, and the laboratory equipment purring! This includes, but is of course not limited to:
  • Designing and maintaining the facility to meet Good Manufacturing Practice and Food Safety requirements.
  • Coordinating (and preferably being able to carry out) maintenance and repair of HVAC systems, as well as other mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems so as to ensure safe, reliable, and effective operation of all such systems (which include both general building and research laboratory systems).
  • Coordinating (and preferably being able to carry out) maintenance, calibration, and repair of laboratory instruments.
Responsibilities

  • Develop a strong technical understanding of our products (e.g., their manufacture, their mode of action, intended uses, etc.).
  • Work in a cross-functional team to coordinate and support demands between product manufacturing, regulatory compliance, product demonstrations, and product sales.
  • Develop systems and workflows to automate processes.
  • Identify and resolves issues in a timely manner.
Requirements

  • Direct experience using and managing complex/multi-faceted, electronic building controls systems.
  • Direct experience working in a highly regulated industry (e.g., food product manufacturing or pharmaceutical industry).
  • Excellent verbal, written, negotiation, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Great attention to detail.
  • Previous experience in leading cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize so as to simultaneously enable progress and outcomes on several parallel projects.
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in physical sciences, life sciences, engineering, materials, mathematics, computer science, or equivalent.
  • Trade experience (e.g., as a general contractor, electrician, mechanic) also a strong asset.
  • 5+ years of experience working in a manufacturing environment (including, for example, but not limited to: pharmaceutical, chemical, biologics, semiconductor or other hard goods).
  • 2+ years of management experience.
