description:
The Sr. Manager, Materials Science will support Global HVT Operations in driving supplier evaluation, selection, validation, and integration. This leadership role will develop strategic supplier plans to scale up the global supply chain capacity and to ensure sustainability for both transcatheter and surgical heart valve implantables. A key element of this role will include the development of innovative, designed to cost and critical-to-quality, reliable components for new products. The Sr. Manager will lead materials sciences subject matter experts internally and externally toward technical developments such as new manufacturing process designs for polymer-based and metal components. This leadership role will also identify project risks, mitigations and business impact in concert with cross-functional teams from global Operations sites.

Responsibilities:
Manage experienced professionals and oversee the work of one or more areas, functionalities, and locations and have some budgetary responsibilities

Lead cross-functional (and across all sites) and department to develop and provide requirement and specifications that integrate in to complex component(s)

Plan and direct complex project activities with large scale or significant business impact with the accountability for successful completion of all project deliverables to the business and develop project plans and schedule, scope, and quality objectives

Lead in identifying risk, developing mitigation strategies, alternative solutions, resolving issues, etc. in collaboration with cross functional groups

Lead efforts to optimize business processes and systems by assessing business needs and developing, proposing and implementing technology solution options

Qualifications

Required Education/Skills/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Materials Science or Polymer Science is required; a Master’s degree is highly preferred.

A minimum of 12 years of regulated industry experience within a manufacturing environment is required with a Bachelor’s degree; a minimum of 10 years of experience is required with a Master’s degree.

Black belt certified, or equivalent preferred.

Demonstrated track record in management of technical and/or engineering disciplines.

Experienced in polymer sciences and engineering of metal components used in the biomedical device industry.

Technical and managerial leadership enabling process development in global manufacturing sites, and engaging internal and external engineering resources toward harmonized goals and objectives.

Proven successful project management leadership skills.

Excellent documentation and communication skills, interpersonal relationship skills including negotiating and relationship management skills with ability to drive achievement of objectives.

Expert understanding of engineering procedures while identifying applications of functional knowledge and existing methodologies to complex problems.

Expert understanding of related aspects of engineering processes and/or systems.

Knowledge of financial acumen and ROI as it relates to engineering.

Demonstrated ability to manage one or more teams and provide coaching and feedback, including responsibility for all employee actions including hire/fire authority and partnering with HR on all aspects of employee relations.

Ability to develop and integrate metrics into the projects and operations that clearly demonstrate the value of engineering to the business.

Ability to interact professionally with all organizational levels and proactively escalate issues to appropriate levels of management in the organization.

Ability to work and excel within a fast paced, dynamic, and constantly changing work environment.

10% - 20% travel required.

About Edwards

Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in the science of heart valves and hemodynamic monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company partners with clinicians to develop innovative technologies in the areas of structural heart disease and critical care monitoring that enable them to save and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs about 8,200 individuals worldwide.

For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life. description:
BS Degree required MS preferred in Materials Science, metallurgy, Chemistry or closely related discipline combined with at least 7 years experience, in an industrial role managing all aspects of manufacturing activities of thick film metallization and conductive coatings.

GENERAL FUNCTION:
A process engineer with direct experience in the formulation of conductive paints and in thick-film metallization processes for aluminum oxide (Al 2 O 3 ) materials, used in high frequency microwave and millimeter wave vacuum
electron amplifier products, is needed. Microwave amplifiers are employed in a variety of applications including radar, electronic warfare, and high-speed data communicatio ns.

Duties
  • Manage all manufacturing activities in the paint chemistry and thick-film metallization production area, ensuring that key yield metrics are consistently met
  • Communicate requirements and specifications to suppliers of raw and metalized ceramic bodies; identify supplier issues and assist in their resolution
  • Ensure that established processes fully support manufacturing requirements; conduct periodic audits to assess the effectiveness of the processes; train operators to ensure that a high level of skill and expertise is effectively maintained
  • Design, build, and test new equipment, tools, and fixtures for streamlining and improving manufacturing efficiency in the production area
  • Monitor key process parameters and analyze performance data; identify risks and implement corrective actions; spearhead continuous improvement efforts
  • Support manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, and material review board (MRB) activities
  • Interface with internal customers to understand needs and requirements. Map requirements and expectations to product specifications and manufacturing activities
  • As required, source new tools, equipment, and material suppliers to ensure the uninterrupted manufacture and continuous flow of product.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES
  • Hands-on industrial experience formulating conductive paints and in the thick-film metallization of aluminum oxide
  • Good understanding of pre- and post-metallization processing requirements for raw and metalized aluminum oxide
  • Good understanding of modern manufacturing and grinding techniques for ceramics
  • Hands-on experience operating and troubleshooting industrial sintering furnaces
  • Experience in dye penetrant, transmitted light, and X-Ray Fluorescence (XRF) inspection techniques for metalized ceramic bodies
  • Experience in viscosity, density, fineness of grind, and drying rate measurement methods for conductive paints
  • Familiarity with mechanical testing methods (i.e. lap shear testing, tensile testing, etc.)
  • Ability to multi-task and interact effectively with colleagues from various disciplines, as well as customers
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Excellent verbal, written word, and Microsoft Office skills
Must be a US citizen

If interested please send resume to
title: Process engineer Ceramics / Metallics / Coatings

description:
Citrine is the artificial intelligence platform for materials and chemicals. Our platform ingests and understands large-scale data from countless sources, such as patents, research papers, technical reports, and existing databases, and uses state-of-the-art AI to anticipate the behavior of all materials and chemicals under any relevant conditions. Check out our outstanding group of customers and partners ( http://www.citrine.io/partners ). Citrine is backed by top tier Silicon Valley venture capital firms including: Innovation Endeavors, Data Collective, Prelude Ventures, AME Cloud Ventures, Morado Ventures, and XSeed Capital.

Being an early engineer at Citrine means you have the opportunity to have an outsized influence on the technology, culture and quality of the engineering organization. Work with top scientists in chemistry, physics and materials science to make your mark with technology that is changing how every physical product is designed, manufactured, and brought to market.

Responsibilities

  • Write front-end and server side code for the our platform with focus on searching, displaying, and analyzing materials data.
  • Create enterprise-ready, robust, secure and scalable production infrastructure and services.
  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
  • Work with materials and chemicals subject matter experts to define and implement product roadmap
  • Maintain & scale enormous clusters of materials data. Our public platform, Citrination, is the largest online public materials database and contains over 17,000,000 instantly searchable materials data files.
  • Deploy machine learning infrastructure & visualizations to a worldwide network of scientists developing next generation functional and structural materials
-------------------------
Skills & Requirements
-------------------------

Minimum qualifications:
  • BS degree in Computer Science OR similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of production web software experience (backend or frontend)
  • Production experience with at least one of: Java, Ruby, Python or JavaScript
  • Linux skills
Preferred qualifications:
  • Production Ruby on Rails, AngularJS, ElasticSearch, Postgres, Ansible and/or AWS API automation experience
This posting open to those with existing legal right to work in the United States. Citrine Informatics is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, or national origin.
title: Senior Software Engineer

description:
Series B generously funded by top VC firms company is looking for a Process Engineering Manager to join their fast-growing team in Campbell, CA, and to work on a disruptive 3D metal printing technology .

The team is looking for a self-starter that enjoys working in a highly dynamic startup environment. You will enjoy small company atmosphere and excellent benefits including healthcare coverage and 401(K) matching.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead a group of process engineers to solve key technical problems related to a new, highly sophisticated metal 3D printer.
  • Be responsible for a portfolio of research, development, and continuous improvement projects that translate the company's unique processing capabilities into a revolutionary volume production solution for aerospace, automotive, and other industries.
  • Interface with technical leads on other teams to translate process learnings into specific improvements in printer functionality and reliability.
  • Work with senior technologists and managers to generate a long-term process roadmap and resource allocation to meet company goals.

Qualifications:
  • Strong desire to work for an early stage startup company on disruptive technologies and make it a success.
  • Proven track record of invention of new processes, developing them into robust solutions, and solving complex technical problems.
  • Broad knowledge across multiple fields and ability to apply this knowledge and ideas to solve complex technical and engineering problems.
  • Demonstrated track record of simultaneously leading multiple technical projects and achieving high impact results through others.
  • Experience providing effective technical leadership to develop and mentor team members.
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience as process engineer / technologist.
  • Current hands-on data and statistical analysis experience.
  • 2+ years direct management experience of process engineers, technologists, or equivalent.
  • Post-graduate degree in materials science, chemical engineering, physics or related field.
  • Experience using structured problem solving approaches to solve complex technical problems in multiple disciplines.

Pluses:
  • Prior start-up experience is strongly preferred
  • Experience with statistical design of experiments and statistical analysis using JMP or equivalent software.
  • Experience or familiarity with programming languages such as Matlab.
  • Demonstrated track record of changing scientific disciplines or fields

To apply:
  • Please send your resume in PDF or WORD format to lilia@eltisolutions.com
  • Place the text "Process Engineering Manager" in the subject line.
  • Please provide the date you are available to start work.

Approaches life with a ‘can do’ attitude.

Exemplifies highest ethical standards.

Advanced technical degree (Masters or Doctorate) in the above disciplines strongly preferred.

Experience prosecuting medical device patents preferred.

U.S. Law degree and license required.

USPTO Registration Number required.

Knowledge of genetics and other biological sciences is beneficial.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Drafts and prosecutes global patent applications.

Develops and executes against a forward looking IP strategy for projects and portfolios in line with company business goals.

Collaborates within and across business units to identify and capture high value innovation.

Cost-effectively manages high quality patent prosecution work by outside counsel in the US and abroad.

Effectively partners with product development teams to shape IP strategy for product offering.

Provides value/risk assessment on third party IP estates and/or landscapes for collaborations, consortiums and other third party complex agreements.

Contributes to intellectual property assessments in mergers, acquisitions and investments.

Works strategically and collaboratively with IP litigation team.

Contributes to educational efforts across business on best practices for IP and other legal matters.

Drives operational excellence within legal and across the business.

SUMMARY

At Vanguard-IP, we know Intellectual Property. We focus 100% on the recruitment of IP/Patent professionals. Our focus provides us with a deeper knowledge of our client needs, our candidate’s individual talents and career interests, and how these can be matched together. While we don’t claim to know everything, we feel that we know more than most -including technology focus, docket matters, and specifics about the practice. We are also comfortable receiving a great question and have the resources to get answers that are most often not readily available. We look forward to speaking with you and learning more about what you are seeking in your next opportunity.

CONFIDENTIALITY

Vanguard-IP, LLC respects the confidentiality of each client submission made to us. Each submission sent to Vanguard-IP is for our internal review purposes only and will NOT be shared to any of our clients without prior authorization from you. Submission alone does not imply your consent and/or authorization.

title: Patent Attorney – Engineering, VIP-3964

description:
Company Background

In the United States, over a third of all the food we grow is lost to spoilage and wasted before we can eat it. In the developing world, more than half of all produce is lost to spoilage before it can be consumed. Apeel Sciences creates agricultural solutions inspired by and derived from Nature for growers to protect their crops and increase the shelf life of harvested fresh produce. We are committed to being a technological and environmental trailblazer at the interface between the agricultural, materials science, chemistry, biotechnology, and engineering industries to eliminate food waste and reduce reliance on pesticides. Our mission is to enable widespread, positive impacts through the development of high-performance pre- and post-harvest products and processes that conserve our precious natural resources and safeguard the Earth’s delicate ecological balance.

Company Culture

Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and strongly tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, are obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are core and absolutely fundamental to our company’s success and continued growth. Look around and what do you see? Team members who are working tirelessly and selflessly—not to serve themselves—but to help the team as a whole strategically, aggressively, and collectively realize a shared mission and vision. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, tackle challenges (and opportunities!) head-on, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Division

Our Product Integration Team develops solutions to engineering challenges related to large-scale, continuous application of our products at customer locations. Once developed, Apeel's products are applied in fields, in packing lines, in farm sheds and in homes. This team of talented engineers and tradespeople is responsible for the design, fabrication, reliability testing, installation and maintenance of Apeel's product application systems. Additionally, they develop and deploy mobile systems to potential-customer sites to demonstrate the value of our products. Like all Divisions of the company, this team works in a highly collaborative environment to navigate and overcome obstacles to our company’s goals.

Job Description

Apeel Sciences is seeking an experienced, extremely hands-on, highly technical, resourceful, and creative candidate with extensive system integration experience to develop and apply expertise in Apeel's liquid product application equipment.

Responsibilities and Outcomes (including but not limited to):
  • Architect software solutions for R&D; and customer systems integration
  • Coordinate software integration from R&D; into final product line
  • Produce feedback control strategies to deal with variations in operational parameters
  • Develop embedded systems for installation at customer facilities
  • Determine most practical and efficient operational characteristics
  • Develop integrated remote monitoring capabilities
Required Experience/Qualifications

  • BSc in an engineering field or equivalent
  • 5 years + embedded system design experience (please be ready to show examples)
  • LabVIEW experience, preferably with certification

As a Multi-Level Cell (MLC)/Triple-Level Cell (TLC) NAND Product Line Manager at Micron Semiconductor Products, Inc. you will working at Micron’s Embedded Business Unit (EBU) managing one of the fastest growing memory products in the market today. This high impact individual will drive MLC/TLC NAND product management worldwide for the consumer, set top box, industrial and medical segments. This position does not supervise direct reports. You will be required to travel two weeks out of the year domestically and/or internationally.

You will have the following key responsibilities:
  • Manage the complete MLC/TLC NAND product line life cycle from creating the strategic business plan to tactical execution
  • Work closely with engineering team to define new product specs
  • Develop new NAND flash products for embedded markets
  • Develop and implement go-to-market plans for new MLC/TLC products targeting the embedded market
  • Support customers and sales team with product collateral

Minimum Qualifications:
  • Knowledge through coursework or experience in Business Development, Product Marketing, Engineering or R&D; .
  • Strong technical background and understanding of NAND product features, performance and reliability.
  • Understanding of product development life cycle management.
  • Understanding of embedded application and customer usage model.
  • Knowledge or experience in writing marketing requirement documents that bridge customer/technical needs into clearly defined features and benefits.
  • Ability to travel two weeks out of the year domestically and/or internationally.

Resume and/or cover letter must reflect each requirement above or it will be rejected. Upon hire, all applicants will be subject to drug testing/screening and background checks.

Work Location: 2235 Iron Point Road, Folsom, California, 95630

Hours of work: Usually 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday.

Experience Required: None

OR

Academic Discipline(s): Materials Science; Electrical or Electronics Engineering, Materials Engineering, Business Administration or Marketing Managers

Alternate Occupations

Accepted: Materials Science; Electrical or Electronics Engineering, Materials Engineering, Business Administration or Marketing Managers

Experience Required: Five years of post-degree progressive experience

Position Title
Part-Time Engineering Instructor (Pool)

Position ID
FY14/15-019POOL

Campus
Mission College

Position Summary Information

Definition
PART-TIME, ASSOCIATE FACULTY POOL

Applications for Part-Time, Associate Faculty pools are continually accepted (unless otherwise specified) by the District and will be added to the application pool for review by hiring authorities on an as-needed basis. Should you be invited for an interview, you will be contacted by a District representative.

Assignment
This position is a part-time position as an Associate Instructor. The teaching assignment may require teaching lecture-discussion courses during day, evening or on Saturday and/or in an on-line/distance education format. The assignments are as needed, during Spring, Summer, and/or Fall semesters. This position is represented by the Association of College Educators (ACE).

Work location: Mission College, Santa Clara, CA

Salary and Benefits
Salary is based on a percentage of workload, up to a maximum of 67% of a full-time load. Salary is prorated based on an initial hiring salary range of $18,548-$22,029 per semester; and is based on academic achievement, teaching and related experience.

Minimum Qualifications

1. Education - Possess any one of the following:
Master's degree in any field of engineering; OR

Bachelor's degree in any of the above AND master's degree in mathematics, physics, computer science, chemistry, or geology; OR

Bachelor's degree in any field of engineering with a professional engineer's license; OR

A valid California Community College Instructor's Credential in the discipline; OR

The equivalent of the above.
AND
2. Demonstrated ability to effectively work with persons of diverse socioeconomic, cultural, disability, and ethnic backgrounds.

Desired Qualifications

Strong background in engineering materials or materials science

Coursework in Engineering Graphics

Strong background in using computer tools

Experience using Solidworks or other 3D modeling tool

Knowledge of 3D printers

Teaching experience in Engineering and related fields

Coursework and/or experience in Engineering and related fields

Manufacturing processes experience

Experience with the design, implementation, or coordination of STEM-related projects or initiatives

Examples of Duties and Responsibilities
Instructional duties and assignments may consist of one or more of the following:

Provide instruction for assigned courses. This includes preparation for in-class or on-line/distance education activities, evaluation of students' work, consultation with students outside of class and/or on-line, maintenance of currency in the subjects taught.

Maintain accurate class and other records required by the college.

Submit, when due, attendance rosters and grade reports.

Follow course outlines as filed in the instruction offices.

Maintain office hours each week, at .5 hours per week per section.

Observe, support and enforce the regulations, policies and programs of the District and college.

Provide each student with a written course syllabus at the beginning of the course, as per instructions in the Faculty Handbook.

Refer students to appropriate college sources for information on counseling and other student services.

Assist students by providing advice on requirements for successful achievement in the members' area of expertise.

Work cooperatively within the college community.

Foster an environment that protects academic freedom within the college community.
Foster a positive working environment that is free from harassment, prejudice and/or bias.

Demonstrate a respect for the dignity of each individual.

Selection Process

SELECTION PROCESS INFORMATION:
Applications will be screened by appropriate department representatives on an as-needed basis. Qualified applicants who best meet the needs of the division will be contacted for an interview.

Travel expenses to attend the interview are the responsibility of the candidate.

Applications will remain in our online system for 1 year. Each year, part-time pools will be refreshed and applicants will be notified of the opportunity to re-submit application.

Application materials become the property of the District and will not be returned or duplicated.

The District reserves the right to contact former, current, the most recent employers, and others to investigate past employment records of applicants.

Upon hire the successful candidate must provide the required documents of identity and authorization to work and attest he/she is authorized to work in the United States.

The District is committed to nondiscrimination on the basis of ethnic group identification, race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, physical disability, mental disability, ancestry, sexual orientation, language, accent, citizenship status, transgender status, parental status, marital status, economic status, veteran status, and medical condition consistent with applicable federal and state laws.

Innovation Counsel (San Francisco)

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced IP transactions attorney with a strong patent and scientific background and a passion for innovative technology to serve as Gap Inc.’s first Innovation Counsel. This highly visible position will support the company’s newly launched Global Innovation & Performance Center of Excellence (COE), which is charged with developing performance apparel innovations at all price points for our portfolio of brands, including Gap, Old Navy, Athleta, and Banana Republic. This position will sit in the COE and collaborate closely with business teams on the creation, acquisition, and protection of intellectual property in new and innovative product technologies. You will provide strategic legal advice, negotiate third-party transactions, and lead the development of Gap Inc.’s global patent strategy and processes. The ideal candidate has significant experience negotiating complex IP deals and advising on patent strategy, enthusiasm for challenges and learning new skills, and a scientific or engineering background. The position will report to the Associate General Counsel for Brand Services.

About Gap Inc.
Doris and Don Fisher opened the first Gap store in 1969. Today, Gap Inc. is a leading global fashion retailer with five brands, more than 3,000 stores, and over 135,000 employees. We are on a journey to be the world’s favorite apparel destination, from value to luxury, by delivering great product to our customers and being the best place to work and shop.

Responsibilities:
Proactively engage with COE business partners to identify and evaluate potential innovation opportunities and drive IP protection strategy to meet business needs and ensure long-term competitive advantage
Advise COE leadership on the acquisition, development, and commercialization of third-party technologies
Negotiate and draft agreements related to strategic partnerships, joint development, IP acquisitions, exclusivity, and confidentiality
Develop and implement a patent strategy for COE innovations
Manage patent research and analysis projects on issues including competitive intelligence, patentability, prior art, infringement, invalidity, and freedom to operate
Oversee the drafting, filing, prosecution, and maintenance of US and foreign patents
Develop, implement, and drive rollout and adoption of internal processes to track inventions and other ownable innovations throughout Gap Inc.
Advise and support other Gap Inc. business teams on innovation initiatives, including GapTech digital and mobile technologies
Spearhead internal education initiatives and trainings related to IP and processes
With AGC, build and manage legal budget for innovation work and patent portfolio
Education
8 or more years of legal experience in IP transactions and patent practice
Juris Doctor or LLM from accredited law school
Licensed to practice law in the U.S.
Bachelor’s degree in a scientific or engineering field
USPTO admission preferred
Experience
Significant experience negotiating and drafting a wide range of complex IP agreements related to strategic partnerships, joint development, acquisitions, exclusive licenses, etc.
Significant experience counseling clients on strategic IP protection
Deep technical knowledge and expertise in IP law, particularly patent and trade secret
Experience with apparel-related technologies, including fiber/textile science, materials science, fabric construction, apparel design and construction, apparel manufacturing processes and equipment, and wearable electronics
Experience developing and implementing IP strategies and conducting freedom to-operate analyses, IP portfolio analyses, and competitive analyses
In-house experience preferred
Hands-on patent prosecution experience a plus

Job Summary

A Research Assistant is responsible for supporting and running biomedical experiments in cancer research with the focus on cells in vitro and rodents in vivo. Main skills required include maintaining different cell cultures (especially cancer), preparing and characterizing cellular specimen and samples. Animal experience required: hands on experience and certification for mice: xenograft tumors, tail injection, and vital surgery. To prepare, perform and document experiments in vitro and in vivo. To manage the lab supplies and keep the supplies and safety records.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Maintain cell cultures requiring the use of sterile techniques, low temperature storage, sawing, culturing, characterization and sample preparation.
  • Solid experience with cancer cell lines
  • Familiar with cell culturing in various modern systems (such as Ibidi cell systems)
  • Prepare cell samples including the incubations of cells with various substances.
  • Record keeping for tracking methods, data, results, etc. for preparing research and technical reports and other
  • Animal experience required: hands on experience and certification for mice: xenograft tumors, tail injection, and vital surgery.
  • Maintaining laboratory equipment (incubator, bio-hood, centrifuge, microscope).
  • Ensuring and maintaining the biosafety (BSL-2 level) in the lab.
  • Managing the stock control of laboratory supplies, chemicals and equipment.
  • Ensuring that equipment is properly cleaned and that chemicals, drugs and other materials are appropriately stored.
  • Waste management
  • Ensuring that all health and safety procedures are understood and followed correctly.
  • Ability to efficiently work in a small team.
Minimum Qualifications ​
  • Solid (3 years or more) experience in p erforming standard laboratory procedures with live cells (such as maintaining cell cultures requiring the use of sterile technique, incubation cells with nanoparticles or drugs and preparing slides using staining techniques) and mice (xenograft tumor models, tail injection, vital surgery and tumor measurements). Cell counts. Cell viability and concentration measurements.
  • Solid skills in cell storage, sawing, culturing, characterization
  • Solid experience with optical microscopes in cell studies
  • Solid bio-safety skills at the BSL2 level
  • Solid skills of using different laboratory equipment used in cell level experiments such as optical/fluorescent microscopes, centrifuges, etc. and the ability to maintain and calibrate technical equipment.
  • Good IT skills to use computers for data collection, analysis and storage
  • Ability to organize data into reports of the manuscript type (with figures, tables and text)
  • Strong practical and organizational skills with the ability to manage own workload in order to work on several different projects at the same time.
  • Good communication and team workings skills, the ability to effectively interface within a cross-functional team environment and patience.
  • The ability to learn specific, practical techniques and apply this knowledge to solve technical problems. Attention to details.
  • Dedication to the goal.
Preferred Qualifications ​
  • PhD or MS in biosciences, i.e. biotechnology, materials science/technology, biomedical engineering, pharmacology, biomedical optics, etc.
  • Experience in the biomedical optics and laser-based cell research
  • Ability to perform assays for protein, RNA, DNA, or other cellular components.
  • Care for laboratory animals. Hands on skills and past certification for handling mice (modeling tumors, tail injection, vital surgery).
  • Experience in setup and control of the cell culturing lab.

Education

Bachelors of Science degree in biosciences, i.e. biotechnology, materials science/technology, biomedical engineering, pharmacology, etc. required. Advanced degree preferred.

Physical requirements/Work Environment

This position primarily works in a laboratory and an office environment. It requires frequent sitting, standing and walking. Daily use of a computer and other computing and digital devices is required. May stand for extended periods when facilitating meetings or walking in the facilities. Some local travel is necessary, so the ability to operate a motor vehicle and maintain a valid Driver’s license is required.

The physical demands of the position described herein are essential functions of the job and employees must be able to successfully perform these tasks for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those individuals with real or perceived disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job described.

We are proud to offer if eligible a highly competitive compensation plan with an excellent benefits package including 3 weeks vacation, stock options, 401k match, medical, dental, vision plans and much more!

Masimo is an Equal Employment Opportunity Commission / Affirmative Action employer, We encourage Minorities, Females, Disabled and Veterans to apply.

***NO AGENCIES PLEASE*** Thank you!
title: Research Assistant

description:
Product Development Manager-Irvine, CA

DESCRIPTION:
This position is responsible for directing research and development of under fill film product development. Products must be developed in a timely manner that will permit their evaluation, qualification, and implementation use by customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Leads and manages the overall efforts of a team of professional and nonexempt personnel in the product development and oversees new product development projects, establishes and implements a strategy consistent with defined business plan, organizes and manages projects and resources to meet planned objectives, reports on R&D; activities and provides technical support to customers to both internal and external.

Plays a major role in specifying and supporting laboratory development projects to support electronics and related industry development and validation activities and provides technical support services to manufacturing and quality as required.

Organize and manage process developments necessary to support cross-functional stage-gate teams to achieve the completion of new technology products consistent with established strategic objectives; advance the state of the art in materials science and polymer chemistry to address the changing dynamics of the electronics market.

Assure all R&D; laboratory work is carried out in a safe manner including employees wearing personal protective equipment, trained on safety practices, etc. and that products and processes comply with all deferral and state regulatory agencies and act as the principal technical resource for laboratory development in team's area of responsibility such as die attach product development or applications engineering; assure all new products meet international chemical health and safety requirements.

Provide clear direction and expectations to subordinates regarding responsibilities and performance standards, continually evaluate and lead staff's performance with a focus on further development of professional skills and this incumbent is responsible for carrying out company policy and initiatives for example but not limited to; conducting annual performance reviews for their subordinate(s), development of the team's personnel, and assisting annual planning and budgetary review.

Support intellectual property activities and provide guidance and recommendations on patents, trademarks and proprietary agreements.

Interface with a variety of customers and managers located internally and externally and assure technology readiness through internal development of laboratory and staff.

REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum, BS in Chemistry or chemical engineering with a background in polymer chemistry and formulation technique; graduate or PhD degree preferred with minimum of 5 years technical management experience in the electronics industry working with organic materials including adhesives and or composite materials.

Minimum of 3 years technical experience for adhesive film product development and experience minimum 5 new products launch through development activities

Thorough knowledge of electronics materials technology, engineering requirements, and the capability to plan and direct research activities with demonstrated leadership, team building, employee development, coaching, and motivational skills.

Demonstrated ability to partner with customers in product development programs and excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and analytical skills as well as effective presentation skills with experience at presenting to top management, customers, public groups and/or board of directors.

Excellent conflict resolution and problem solving skills.

title: Research & Development Laboratory Technician

description:
GIA (Gemological Institute of America) invites qualified candidates to apply for its Research-Identification Internship Program. Ideal applicants will be students pursuing a Bachelor of Science and/or Master of Science in physics, materials science, geology, chemistry and related fields. The selected individuals will have the opportunity to learn and practice gemology by performing all types of analysis of gem materials. Interns will receive ongoing coaching and mentoring from experienced GIA gemologists in the areas of spectroscopy and gemology.

Candidates Should Possess the Following:

• Technical skills – basic understanding of relevant sciences, especially physics and chemistry

• Purpose – desire to achieve, has a vision and wants to accomplish goals

• Teamwork – collaborates and communicates well with others

Internship Program • The interns will work on a well-defined, agreed-upon project.

• The duration of internship will be one-to-two months, and may be extended for special circumstances.

• Summer season is encouraged.

• The work schedule will be eight hours per day, Monday through Friday (8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. with a 30-minute lunch).

• An experienced employee will mentor the interns.

• A learning project will be created on a specific gemology topic, and a conclusion will be reached by the end of the internship.

Work will include using the necessary instruments, analysis and data processes.

• Upon completion of the internship, the intern will have acquired some capabilities in instrument operation and will have a basic understanding of data interpretation. In order to accomplish this, some contributions to lab production or research projects are expected.

Pay

$15 per hour – undergraduate students

$20 per hour – graduate students
title: Intern

description:
REQUIREMENTS

-An advanced degree in medicinal or organic chemistry

-Demonstrated knowledge in the following scientific categorical fields: small molecule modulator (e.g. pharmaceutical drugs) work.

-Demonstrated scientific writing ability using proper grammar and vocabulary which also includes the following skills:

*analyzing and explaining abstract scientific concepts and terms

*synthesizing a large amount of scientific or technological literature into a systematic and concise description of the state of the art; and

*differentiating and describing important differences among related scientific discoveries or technological breakthroughs.

-Demonstrated skills verbally presenting scientific concepts, terms, and discoveries to wide audiences, including scientists and non-scientists.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Patent Agents/Associates/Counsel work under the supervision and guidance of senior associates and partners in their Intellectual Property section and perform a variety of patent-related activities, primarily in the areas of patent drafting, patent prosecution, opinion drafting, freedom to operate analysis, and due diligence work. Specific duties include the following:

- Assess scientific literature, patents and patent application documents, each encompassing multiple chemistry areas, including organic, synthetic, and physical chemistry and may also include a variety of biology fields, including cell biology, cancer biology, immunology, crystallography, and molecular biology, and possibly materials science..

- Understand, critique and provide insightful opinion on scientific data relating to inventions. Conduct comprehensive search for scientific articles, patents and patent application documents relevant to the subject of an invention. - Perform in-depth analysis comparing an invention with existing discoveries or inventions. Identify essential elements, features or components of an invention.

- Compose patent applications comprising a comprehensive background of the field of an invention, a description of critical features and components of the invention, and a set of claims clearly and distinctly defining the invention.

- Draft responses to rejection of a patent application for an invention from the United States Patent and Trademark Office and other worldwide Patent Offices, providing detailed analysis of the scientific or patent references cited in the rejection, assessing the difference between the invention and the citations, and presenting convincing arguments and reasoning why the patent application is to be allowed as a patent.

- Collaborate with colleagues on various projects. Adapt effectively in different team environment. Present ideas, reasoning and conclusions in a concise way to colleagues. Provide insightful feedback and arguments to colleagues on their ideas.

- Work with clients in prosecuting patent applications. Formulate and ask clients questions essential to clarifying the distinct features or properties of the invention. Investigate and respond promptly to clients’ inquiries about the prosecution of patent applications.

SUMMARY

At Vanguard-IP, we know Intellectual Property. We focus 100% on the recruitment of IP/Patent professionals. Our focus provides us with a deeper knowledge of our client needs, our candidate’s individual talents and career interests, and how these can be matched together. While we don’t claim to know everything, we feel that we know more than most -including technology focus, docket matters, and specifics about the practice. We are also comfortable receiving a great question and have the resources to get answers that are most often not readily available. We look forward to speaking with you and learning more about what you are seeking in your next opportunity.

CONFIDENTIALITY

Vanguard-IP, LLC respects the confidentiality of each client submission made to us. Each submission sent to Vanguard-IP is for our internal review purposes only and will NOT be shared to any of our clients without prior authorization from you. Submission alone does not imply your consent and/or authorization.

description:
The Complete Genomics’ Fluidic Devices group is looking for an experienced technologist with significant industry experience to lead CGI’s microfluidic device development team. In this position, you will initially be responsible for developing a microfluidic platform for sample preparation and analysis tools that enable leading-edge medical research and diagnostics. As a successful candidate, you will be a key contributor conceiving new technologies and developing products to enable genetic analysis for research and diagnostic use. You will lead and manage a global team, work closely interdisciplinary with interdisciplinary groups in the Complete Genomics and BGI organization, and with external partners and vendors.

Major Duties and Responsibilities
  • Lead design and development of microfluidic device platform, working cross-functionally with reagent, instrumentation and software teams to deliver products to market
  • Oversee the definition and management of microfluidic devices based on company vision and strategy, identifying current and emerging technologies to meet company product plans
  • Hire and manage a global team of scientists and engineers.
  • Drive design, fabrication and testing of prototype devices
  • Identify and develop manufacturing processes and partners to scale and launch products
  • Present clear and concise written and oral communications to colleagues and upper management, lead and participate in technical meetings, and provide recommendations based on technical results.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Desired Skills & Experience:
  • Ph.D./MS/MA in materials science, engineering, biology, chemistry or related fields
  • 5+ years of experience leading development of products in the life sciences
  • Deep understanding of microfluidics system, the fabrication processes and its physical/chemical limitations for analyzing biological samples
  • High attention to detail, including a proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously, as well as the ability to think strategically and execute methodically
  • Strong team-orientation with superior verbal and written communications skills and the ability to clearly communicate data and insights to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Demonstrated ability to hire and lead high performance product teams
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work in a multi-discipline team environment are required
  • Demonstrated experience in medical product development, design control process, quality and regulatory environments
  • International travel 30~40%

Preferred Qualifications
  • Fluent in Mandarin

Complete Genomics does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website, employees or Human Resources.

Complete Genomics will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of Complete Genomics and will be processed accordingly without fee.

Complete Genomics has the sole discretion to determine with whom we will enter into a contract. If you wish to work with Complete Genomics, please contact the Human Resources department at careers@completegenomics.com .

Complete Genomics provides equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran or uniformed service status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Production Chemist

description:
Position Summary:
We are currently looking for an experienced Product Developer to join the Cleaning R&D; team as a Senior Scientist in the Professional Products Division (PPD). In this role, you will use your product development expertise and internal/external networks to drive growth, develop, and commercialize winning products within the PPD Cleaning space (e.g. Education, Athletic, and commercial facilities).

Operating within the new Agile world, there might also be opportunities to wear a process/package development hat as project work ebbs and flows.

You will be part of a high performing team who is at the frontline of interactions with marketing, insights, and sales to drive business results. The Professional Products business is scrappy, flexible and nimble to enable high growth and is a highly visible business. You will be able to see the direct impact of your work quickly and be part of an outstanding team!

Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead technical teams from charter to product launch. Act as primary R&D; voice for cross-functional teams and collaborates closely with the PPD SBU on new innovation initiatives.
  • Utilize technical skills and creative problem solving skills to successfully translate consumer needs to robust technical approaches and drive technology from inside and outside sources to deliver superior products.
  • Drive creation of broad exclusionary strategy (IP) where and when applicable.
  • Collaborate with peers in a team that values open learning, technical curiosity, and supports development, sharing, and testing of new ideas.
  • Mentor younger scientist who may be newer to product development
Required Qualifications:
  • B.S. (Ph.D strongly preferred) in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science or related field.
  • 5-10 years of previous experience in product development and/or cleaning. Preference for experience in consumer products or B2B/I&I;
  • Ability to work independently, contributing to bringing new products to life, and implement multiple projects in a timely manner.
  • Strong problem solving skills to research and make recommendations demonstrating the superiority and relevance of our products. Must be resourceful in order to provide real time solutions.
  • Strong, deep technical skills to identify, adapt and formulate solutions with speed and excellence. Must be technically curious and willing to learn quickly.
  • High energy, positive drive and commitment in setting and meeting aggressive goals.
  • Demonstration of leadership, communication and teamwork skills.
  • Ability to adapt to changing business needs and priorities.
Desired Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of colloids, and oxidative chemistries.
  • Understanding of microbiology and germicidal test methodologies.
  • Broad knowledge of the industry for CPG companies, suppliers, and end users.
  • Experience with EPA registered products and the multiple facets of bringing a product to market
Notes:
  • Grade level 25 (Scientist II) will also be considered based on relevant experience with appropriately scaled responsibilities for the grade level in the above identified areas.

title: Sr. Scientist - Product Development R&D, Clorox Cleaning Professional Products Division (PPD)

description:
B.S or A.A. with background in physics, materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or equivalent with experience processing and characterizing new devices and materials in research environments.

We seek technicians to support research for various projects, primarily in the areas of thin film processing and printing. Positions are initially for a fixed term and have the potential to become regular hires.

Applicants are requested to submit a resume and a cover letter that describes examples of past project achievements.

Requirements:
  • B.S or A.A. with background in physics, materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or equivalent.
  • Experience processing and characterizing new devices and materials in research environments.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Benefits

We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K). PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria. The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).

About PARC

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D; services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.

Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.

PARC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with PARC should contact PARC Human Resources.

The Electronic Materials & Devices Laboratory (EMDL) and the Hardware Systems Laboratory (HSL) are a group of physical scientists and engineers with a passion for identifying future hardware needs and a history of innovation in creating new technologies to meet those needs. Our current research areas include printed electronics, novel printing systems, 3D printing, energy devices and systems, hierarchical structural materials, RF and IR metamaterials, MEMS, displays, amorphous and polycrystalline silicon systems, x-ray imaging, acoustic imaging, optoelectronic semiconductors, visible and UV lasers and LEDs, compact optical sensing systems, drug delivery, biosensors and bio-medical instrumentation.
title: Technicians: Electronic Materials/Devices & Hardware Systems

description:
Ph.D. with background in physics, materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, bioengineering, chemical engineering with experience designing and developing novel devices, materials, and systems.

The Electronic Materials & Devices Laboratory (EMDL) and the Hardware Systems Laboratory (HSL) are a group of physical scientists and engineers with a passion for identifying future hardware needs and a history of innovation in creating new technologies to meet those needs. Our current research areas include printed electronics, novel printing systems, 3D printing, energy devices and systems, hierarchical structural materials, RF and IR metamaterials, MEMS, displays, amorphous and polycrystalline silicon systems, x-ray imaging, acoustic imaging, optoelectronic semiconductors, visible and UV lasers and LEDs, compact optical sensing systems, drug delivery, biosensors and bio-medical instrumentation.

We seek outstanding researchers and technologists to develop new advances in a variety of interdisciplinary projects. Candidates with interest and experience in microassembly are especially encouraged to apply. Positions are initially for a fixed term and have the potential to become regular hires.

Applicants are requested to submit a resume, cover letter and three representative publications.

Requirements:
  • Ph.D. with background in physics, materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, bioengineering, chemical engineering or equivalent.
  • Experience designing and developing novel devices, materials, and systems.
  • Strong publication record. Please include 3 representative publications in application.
  • Strong communication, teamwork and leadership skills.
  • Experience with commercialization, manufacturing, entrepreneurship and fundraising are highly desired.

  • B.S or M.S. with background in physics, materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or equivalent.
  • Experience characterizing and building new devices and materials in research environments.
  • Strong communication, teamwork and leadership skills.
Benefits

We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K). PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria. The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).

About PARC

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D; services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.

Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.

PARC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with PARC should contact PARC Human Resources.

The Electronic Materials & Devices Laboratory (EMDL) and the Hardware Systems Laboratory (HSL) are a group of physical scientists and engineers with a passion for identifying future hardware needs and a history of innovation in creating new technologies to meet those needs. Our current research areas include printed electronics, novel printing systems, 3D printing, energy devices and systems, hierarchical structural materials, RF and IR metamaterials, MEMS, displays, amorphous and polycrystalline silicon systems, x-ray imaging, acoustic imaging, optoelectronic semiconductors, visible and UV lasers and LEDs, compact optical sensing systems, drug delivery, biosensors and bio-medical instrumentation.

description:
The Institute for Collaborative Biotechnologies (ICB) is an Army-sponsored University Affiliated Research Center (UARC). The ICB is a uniquely interdisciplinary research alliance led by the University of California, Santa Barbara, in collaboration with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, the California Institute of Technology and partners from the Army and industry.

ICB research is driven by more than 50 premier faculty working together with graduate students project scientist, specialists, and professional researchers as interdisciplinary teams of biologists, chemists, physicists, psychologists, physicians, social scientists, and engineers. These teams develop biologically inspired, revolutionary technological innovations in systems and synthetic biology, materials science and engineering, biotechnology tools and cognitive neuroscience.

The ICB is actively seeking Specialists (in the full, Associate, Assistant, and Junior ranks) to commit effort on ICB projects. This is a large, pooled recruitment covering many disciplines and research foci. Screening of applicants is ongoing and will continue as needed through October 31, 2017. The number of positions varies depending on the needs of the department. The use of a pooled recruitment does not guarantee that an open position exists at the time you are applying. Positions may range from 0% (without salary) to 100%.

Appointees to the Specialist series engage in specialized research, professional activity, and University and/or public service. Specialists use their professional expertise to make scientific and scholarly contributions to the research enterprise of the University and to achieve recognition in the professional and scientific community. Specialists may participate in University and/or public service depending upon funding source and duties of the position.

Candidates for appointment, and subsequent personnel cases, will be reviewed on the following criteria (which are provided as guidelines and may be used flexibly where deemed necessary):

1) performance in research in the defined area of expertise and specialization,

2) professional competence and activity, and

3) University and/or public service

The ICB has a vast research portfolio, indicated by (but not limited to) the following to projects and disciplines:

Systems and synthetic biology

Control and dynamical systems

Photonic and electronic materials

Electronic materials and devices

Cellular structural materials

Biotechnology and biotechnology tools

Cognitive neuroscience

Psychological and brain sciences

Medical/biomedical

Nanofluidics and microfluidics

Biomimetrics and biofilms

Automated analysis in online communication

Social media analysis and predictive modeling

Molecular, cellular, ecosystems, marine science, and biology research

Engineering, materials, and computer science research

Chemistry and biochemistry

Additional Information related to levels (Specialist series ranks)

Junior Specialists enable research as part of a team. They should possess a baccalaureate degree (or equivalent degree) or have equivalent research experience.

Assistant Specialists enable research as part of a team and may provide some independent input into the planning and execution of the research. They should possess a masterâs degree (or equivalent degree) or have five years of experience demonstrating expertise in the relevant specialization.

Associate Specialists normally provide considerable independent input into the planning and execution of the research, have a record of academic accomplishments, including contributions to published research in the field, and a demonstrated record of University and/or public service. They should possess a masterâs degree (or equivalent degree) or have five to ten years of experience demonstrating expertise in the relevant specialization.

[full] Specialists normally provide considerable independent input into the planning and execution of the research, have a significant record of academic accomplishments, including contributions to published research in the field, and a demonstrated record of University and/or public service. They should possess a terminal degree (or equivalent degree) or have ten or more years of experience demonstrating expertise in the relevant specialization.

Salary is dependent on experience, qualifications, and hiring level. The UCSB salary scales may be found at https://ap.ucsb.edu/compensation.and.benefits/ucsb.salary.scales/

Minimum requirements

Baccalaureate degree (or equivalent degree) or equivalent research experience.

Previous research experience in applicable or relevant field.

Desirable requirements

University and public service are encouraged but not required.

Mentorship/supervision of junior researchers and students.

To apply, please submit:
1) An updated CV

2) Statement of interest/cover letter

References or recommendation letters may be requested at a later date.

Equal Opportunity:
The department is especially interested in candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of the academic community through research, teaching and service.

The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job location
Santa Barbara, CA
Learn More

More information about this recruitment: http://www.icb.ucsb.edu

Documents

Curriculum Vitae - Your most recently updated C.V.

Cover Letter

How to apply

description:
Northrop Grumman is one of the industry leaders in Stealth Technology. As such, we are involved in all phases of development, production, and maintenance of Low Observable (LO) platforms. We are currently looking for experienced Low Observable / Survivability engineers to work on a variety of challenging projects. This position will be located in El Segundo, California. One area where we are in the need of talent is integrating new technology into our products. Successful candidate will have a broad knowledge and technical experience with the development and integration of aircraft components, materials, and subsystems.

Role and Responsibilities

As a Survivability Systems Engineer â Project Lead you will conduct any of the following tasks:

Work with Integrated Product Teams (IPT) to provide LO requirements, understand other disciplines requirements, and develop an optimized solution that meets all disciplines prioritized needs.

Guide suppliers in the development and procurement of new technology

Coordinate between various IPT, customer, and suppliers to integrate technology into our product line

Performing RCS analysis using in house and commercially available predictive software codes that use physical optics (PO) and/or Method of Moments (MoM) to generate predictions of electromagnetic performance of materials, components and aircraft geometry as well as a variety of post processing codes such as Pioneer and Knowbell. Python scripting is a plus.

Design RCS testing to qualify prototype and advance the maturity of technology

Provide engineering oversight to RCS model fabrication

Oversee RCS testing and perform RCS data post processing and analyze test results. Testing will involve indoor and outdoor far field ranges (Tier 3) as well as near field diagnostic imaging systems (Tier 2).

Collect and process Tier 1 RF measurement handheld tool data.

Conduct subsystem and total vehicle RCS roll-up using both analysis and test data

Conduct trade studies for aircraft features, materials and processes, integrating the needs of all disciplines, collecting and analyzing the data from all options and presenting the results in a comprehensive but concise way to the other disciplines and management.

Manage Project budget and report on technical cost and schedule performance.

As a Survivability Engineer 3 the following skills are anticipated to be in place prior to start.

Knowledge, Skills and Ability

: Complete understanding and wide application of technical principle, theories, and concepts in the field. General knowledge of other related disciplines.

Problem Solving

: Provide technical solutions to a wide range of complex difficult problems. Solutions are imaginative, thorough, practicable, and consistent with organization objectives.

Discretion/Latitude

: Works under only general direction. Independently determines and develops approach to solutions. Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives.

Impact

: Contributes to the completion of specific programs and projects. Failure to obtain results or erroneous decisions or recommendations would typically result in serious program delays and considerable expenditure of resources.

Liaison

: Frequent inter-organizational and outside customer contacts. Represents the organization in providing solutions to difficult technical issues associated with specific projects.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Bachelors of Science in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) field of study from an accredited university

Minimum 5 years engineering experience; 3 years of experience with a Masters'; 0-1 years of experience with a PhD in a related field

Comprehensive understanding of Systems Survivability and the techniques used to control aircraft electromagnetic signature.

Experience leading technology development and implementation teams containing individual with different areas of technical expertise and skills levels.

Experience equivalent to supporting at least one low observable technology maturation projects from technology demonstration, development, flight test and production including development of all associated contractor acquisition documents.

Experience presenting technical, cost and schedule performance briefings to senior management and customers

Strong written and verbal communication, mentoring experience, and excellent interpersonal skills

The successful candidate will have an Active Top Secret DoD clearance and the ability to obtain SAP/SAR access.

Preferred Qualifications:
Masterâs Degree in Aerospace, Mechanical, Materials Science, or Electrical Engineering discipline from an accredited college or university

Prior experience in successful capture of new business and contractor acquisition document development, and in developing and implementing new low observable technologies onto an existing platform

Demonstrated ability, within diverse LO technologies, to develop new project requirements and implementation strategies including significant project management skills and proven success leading teams to execute projects on schedule within budget

Significant knowledge associated with the managing of cost type contracts, earned value, risk management & management of suppliers; and familiarity with the Low Observable customer community

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, extensive mentoring experience, and exceptional interpersonal skills

Demonstrated capability to make good and difficult decisions amidst incomplete data that impact team direction and team performance outcomes

Knowledge of company best practices and government acquisition process and expertise in federal procurement and programming / budgeting processes

Current active SAP/SAR access to programs

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit

www.northropgrumman.com/EEO

. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

description:
The University of California, Merced is a dynamic new university campus in Merced, California, which opened in September 2005 as the tenth campus of the University of California and the first American research university in the 21st century. In keeping with the mission of the University to provide teaching, research and public service of the highest quality, UC Merced offers research-centered and student-oriented educational opportunities at the undergraduate, masterâs and doctoral levels through three academic schools: Engineering, Natural Sciences and Social Sciences/Humanities/Arts.

The School of Engineering anticipates hiring teaching assistants for Summer 2016 and Academic Year (AY) 16-17 in the following disciplines:
Bioengineering
Computer Science and Engineering
Engineering Fundamentals (courses may include the following: Introduction to Materials, Statics and Dynamics, Circuit Theory, Thermodynamics, Heat Transfer, Strength of Materials, Spatial Analysis, etc.)
Environmental Engineering
Materials Science and Engineering
Mechanical Engineering

The Teaching Assistant (TA) will be responsible for conducting assigned laboratory and/or discussion sections. Additional responsibilities include attending lecture, lab and TA meetings; proctoring all exams related to the course, grading assignments, scheduling at least two fixed office hours per week, and other instructionally related duties in support of the supervising instructor.

The University of California Teaching Assistants are represented by the UAW-AFL-CIO.

Qualifications:

Academically eligible to hold the appointment (per UC Merced's Graduate Advisor Handbook)

Interested applicants are required to submit 1) a cover letter, which describes your academic or other experience that qualifies you for the teaching position 2) curriculum vitae or resume and 3) a list of courses (types of subjects) eligible to teach based on experience.

Salary is based on an annual full-time salary of $38,559.00. TAs will not be appointed for more than 50% time during the Fall & Spring semesters.

Recruitment will remain open until filled.

Its mission is to drive multi-disciplinary innovation for industry leadership and superior display products. SDAL was established in 2012 and is located in Silicon Valley. Most of the team is made up of researchers who have earned PhDs or are industry fellows. Key areas of lab expertise include circuit design and electronics, algorithms, optics, semiconductor physics and materials science.
Samsung Display America Lab is looking for software engineer interns who will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies for future generation of display systems and devices.
