title: Software Engineer, Intern (Machine Learning)

description:
-

83302

Organization

:

CR-Computational Research

Description

The Computer Science (CS) Department in the Computational Research Division (

crd.lbl.gov)

is looking for talented and motivated postdoctoral fellows to become part of our team working on exciting science research projects. Researchers in computer and data science or any relevant computational science discipline who have received their Ph.D. within the last three years are encouraged to apply. The successful applicant will receive a competitive salary and excellent benefits.

The CS Department performs innovative research that enhances high performance computational science application codes used in scientific discovery across a broad range of scientific disciplines. Members of the Department collaborate broadly across Berkeley Lab, the DOE National Laboratory community, and with academic, government and industrial institutions internationally to enable breakthrough scientific discoveries that make essential use of high-performance computing capabilities. Current research areas include advanced programming systems, parallel languages, computer architecture, advanced operating systems and runtimes, benchmarking and performance modeling, performance optimization, and advanced algorithm development. More details on projects can be found on

http://crd.lbl.gov/departments/computer-science/

.

The successful applicant will be part of one of the multi-disciplinary teams in the department working on a wide array of research and development project and will join one of the three CS groups. These groups and their mission/focus are listed below:

The

Performance and Algorithms Research Group (PAR)

focuses on the research and development of technologies and algorithms that enhance the performance, scalability, and energy efficiency of applications running on the Department of Energy's multicore-, manycore-, and accelerator-based supercomputers. Moreover, PAR develop performance models to understand the inherent bottlenecks in today's systems as well as predict the performance and bottlenecks of tomorrow's exascale systems. To that end, we have formed strong research collaborations with computer science, computer architecture, applied math, and application research teams. See also

http://crd.lbl.gov/departments/computer-science/performance-and-algorithms-research/

The

Computer Architecture Laboratory (CAL)

and associated

Architecture Group

advances Exascale Design Space Exploration to develop energy efficient and effective processor and memory architecture R&D; for the Department of Energy's Exascale program. The group’s mission is to research, design, and implement new architectural simulation capabilities, novel hardware architecture features, assess design trade-offs, and facilitate the co-design process for leading-edge High Performance Computing (HPC) systems. The primary project of this group is the Computer Architecture Laboratory (

http://www.cal-design.org

), which is multi-laboratory activity involving Sandia National Laboratories and Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. Research topics include but are not necessary limited to developing advanced modeling and simulation infrastructure (

http://sites.google.com/a/lbl.gov/codex/

), developing novel hardware architectures (

http://opensocfabric.lbl.gov/home.php

), collaborating with industry through the fast forward and design forward projects (

http://www.exascaleinitiative.org

). See also

http://crd.lbl.gov/departments/computer-science/computer-architecture/

.

The

Computer Languages and System Software (CLaSS)

group’s mission is to research, design, and implement new models, features and optimizations of parallel programming languages and their execution environments for leading-edge High Performance Computing (HPC) systems. Research topics include but are not necessary limited to theory, implementation and optimization of parallel programming languages, compilers, operating systems, and advanced communication and run-time libraries. This builds on the group’s long history of leadership in this area with the development of GASNet communication library, UPC/UPC++ programming languages, and the Tesselation OS. See also

http://crd.lbl.gov/departments/computer-science/CLaSS/

The successful candidate will have excellent oral and written communication skills; have a strong technical background in computer science, or computer architecture, or computational science and be able to work effectively both in an independent fashion as well as part of a team.

Specific Responsibilities:
Research, development, and coding of new and existing algorithms, tools and technologies to enable leading edge scientific applications take maximum advantage of future parallel computing systems.

To perform independent scientific research in an area of programming languages, operating systems, communication libraries, computer architectures, and other components of an advanced parallel programming environment for scientific computing.

Evaluation of existing and new techniques and results.

Work in a multidisciplinary team environment, that fosters interactions between advanced technologies (hardware, software, languages) and domain sciences teams (chemistry, materials science, combustion, cosmology, etc…)

Author peer-reviewed journal articles and contribute to grant proposals

Required Qualifications:
Ph.D. in a Computer Science or Computer Engineering or related field

Highly self-motivated and willing to learn new technologies.

Experience working in a collaborative environment

Established record of peer reviewed publications

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Keen interest in solving science challenges

Experience with using and developing cutting edge software, and/or hardware prototypes in a research environment.

Additional desired qualifications:
Experience with scientific programming languages (e.g., Python, R, C/C++, Fortran) and parallel languages and execution environments (e.g., MPI, OpenMP, OpenCL, CUDA, UPC, CAF, other advanced languages)

Deep understanding of advanced computer and systems architecture (CPU, caches, memory systems), and their contributions to the overall system performance

Demonstrated creativity, initiative and ability to design, develop and implement complex solutions consistent with emerging technology challenges

Experience using performance analysis tools (e.g. hardware performance counters and code instrumentation frameworks like Tau) will also be beneficial to understand performance of complex scientific applications involved in the study

Experience as part of a multidisciplinary, collaborative team that includes computer/computational scientists and domain scientists

NOTES:
We encourage all applicants to provide a cover letter and a statement of research interests when applying.

This is a full time 1 year postdoctoral appointment with the possibility of renewal based upon satisfactory job performance, continuing availability of funds and ongoing operational needs. You must have less than 3 years paid postdoctoral experience. Salary for postdoctoral positions depends on years of experience post-degree.

Full-time, M-F, exempt (monthly paid) from overtime pay.

This position is represented by a union for collective bargaining purposes.

Salary will be predetermined based on postdoctoral step rates.

This position is contingent on the successful completion of a background check.

Work will be primarily performed at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, 1 Cyclotron Road, Berkeley, CA.
title: Postdoctoral Fellow - Computer Science Department

The ICB is a uniquely interdisciplinary research alliance led by the University of California, Santa Barbara, in collaboration with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, the California Institute of Technology and partners from the Army and industry.

ICB research is driven by more than 50 premier faculty working together with graduate students project scientist, specialists, and professional researchers as interdisciplinary teams of biologists, chemists, physicists, psychologists, physicians, social scientists, and engineers. description:
Position Summary:
Clorox Healthcare is one of the leading providers of surface disinfectants in more than 2,500 acute care facilities across the nation. With a deep commitment to providing efficacious solutions to the HealthCare industry, Clorox will continue to build upon its rich history of helping HealthCare professionals stop the spread of pathogens in facilities and promote the Public Health. We are currently seeking a Scientist II with experience in Packaging to develop and commercialize winning products for Health Care settings. This is a business facing role, you will be at the frontline of cross-functional interactions with the HealthCare Studio while working directly with your cross functional counterparts in Sales Planning, Marketing, PSO and the field Sales. In addition, you will work directly with external suppliers and Design firms to enable successful product development, scale up and commercialization of new products to Market.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead package development utilizing knowledge and skills gained with experience in primary and secondary package development.
  • Manage projects which include all aspects of packaging - from primary package through shipping cases, unit load and point-of-purchase displays. Beginning as early as conception and running through implementation to full national production.
  • Collaborate effectively and proactively with our TECH Solutions team to ensure seamless market introduction and strong sell-in story for field Sales
  • Work with internal and external partners to ensure package components are of high quality, efficiently produced and easily run on manufacturing lines meeting key end-user needs.
  • Drive creation of broad exclusionary strategy (IP) where and when applicable.
  • Lead technical teams from charter to product launch. Act as primary R&D; voice for cross-functional teams and collaborates closely with the PPD SBU on packaging-centric initiatives.
  • Proactively provide leadership & support to the technical team to enable pathways for innovative packaging-centric product ideas that meet strategy and business needs.
  • Combine creative problem solving skills with a bias for action to deliver innovative solutions as part of a cross functional team.
Required Qualifications:
  • BS in Packaging, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science or related field.
  • 7+ years of previous experience in packaging development or related packaging industry.
  • Ability to work independently, contributing to bringing new products to life, and implement multiple projects in a timely manner.
  • Strong problem solving skills to research and make recommendations demonstrating the superiority and relevance of our products. Must be resourceful in order to provide real time solutions.
  • Strong, deep technical skills to identify, adapt and formulate solutions with speed and excellence. Must be technically curious and willing to learn quickly.
  • High energy, positive drive and commitment in setting and meeting aggressive goals.
  • Demonstration of leadership, communication and teamwork skills.
Desired Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of blow molding, injection molding, flexibles, cartons, and corrugate.
  • Broad knowledge of the packaging industry for CPG companies, suppliers, and end users.
  • Experience in leading technical projects with a strong empathy for end-user to be able to enable a seamless experience for the end-user through product design.
Notes:
  • Sr. Scientist candidates will also be considered based on relevant experience with appropriately scaled responsibilities for the grade level in the above identified areas.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
title: Scientist II - Packaging Development, Clorox Healthcare, Professional Products Division (PPD)

description:
Job Description:

Major duties and responsibilities of this position include:
  • Routine technical and programmatic interface with JPL Project Managers, Project Element Managers, Task Managers, and Mission Assurance Managers to develop appropriate reliability engineering requirements and plans for JPL Space Projects.

  • Lead and perform duties related to the selection, procurement, manufacture, use, and/or testing/screening of electronic parts in high reliability applications.

  • Apply expert knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications and systems.

  • Provide technical oversight of flight electronic parts tasks including the creation of engineering requirements specifications and drawings, and advising projects on part selections maximizing reliability while considering cost and schedule constraints.

  • Apply extensive understanding of part and project risk knowledge to define part reliability and quality requirements and assess risks associated with waivers, deficiencies, and failures.

  • Support project system and design teams, advise projects on the electronic part selection that maximizes reliability while considering schedule and cost constraints.

  • Apply advanced understanding of electronic parts and project risk to define part quality requirements at onset of project work.

  • Report on screening and/or failure test results and advise senior management and project.

  • Advise project management on highly complex electronic part selections that maximize reliability while considering schedule and cost constraints.

  • Position supports continuous refinement and improvement of development methodologies and processes.

  • Position supports project team meetings and reviews, with a high degree of personal and professional responsibility.
Required Skills:
  • Requires Bachelor of Science degree with equivalent course work in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Materials Science/Engineering, Applied Mathematics or related technical discipline.

  • Requires 15 years of experience in parts engineering activities.

  • Must be a U.S. Citizen

  • Must be able to pass a National Agency Check

  • Experience must include expert knowledge in one or more of the following areas - RF Parts, Hybrid Parts, Photonics, VLSI Microelectronics or Passives Parts in support of parts development, fabrication, manufacturing, process integration, reliability assessment, and test and/or qualification.

  • Extensive understanding and experience in the selection, procurement, manufacture, use, and testing/screening of high reliability electronic parts for spaceflight applications.

  • Professional experience with EEE parts and supporting Mil-STDs.

  • Requires an understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in electronic parts technologies resulting in contributions to the development of new test and qualification methodologies.

  • Ability to work well with cross-functional reams, design engineers, line management, and project management.

  • Excellent computer skills, including and use of computer-aided engineering tools.

  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills, and ability to work with multiple interfaces is required.
Other Desired Skills:
  • Preferred knowledge of DoD, NASA, and JEDEC specifications and requirements related to electronic parts.

  • Clearance level at Secret/Top Secret level desired.
Bastion participates in E-Verify and EEO
title: BT-1423 Parts Engineering Sr. Engineer II

description:
The Department of Electrical Engineering at the University of California, Santa Cruz (UCSC) invites applications for a tenure-track position at the Assistant Professor level. Applicants must be able to contribute to the departmental focal areas in Renewable Energy and Power Systems. We seek outstanding candidates with expertise in power & energy systems with specialty in areas such as power semiconductor devices, smart-grid, and integration of renewables. The successful candidate will be expected to enhance our excellence in research and strengthen our strong commitment to teaching at both graduate and undergraduate levels. The ideal candidate would also provide synergistic research collaborations with our faculty working in renewable energy. UCSC is the home of many research centers and programs including the program for Sustainable Energy and Power Systems. We are also affiliated with CITRIS (the California Institute for Information Technology Research in the Service of Society).

The successful candidate will be expected to maintain an active research program, obtain external funding, teach courses that contribute to the Electrical Engineering Department undergraduate and graduate curriculum, mentor and advise students at the graduate and undergraduate level, and perform University and professional service. The candidate must be able to work with students, faculty, and staff from a wide range of social and cultural backgrounds. We are especially interested in candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of the academic community through their teaching, research, and/or service.

RANK: Assistant Professor

SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Ph.D. or equivalent foreign degree in electrical engineering, materials science, physics, or a closely related field expected to be conferred by June 30, 2017; demonstrated record of research; demonstrated record of publications; and, demonstrated experience in university teaching.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Demonstrated excellence in innovative research; and/or a strong record of publications; and/or demonstrated excellence in university teaching at the graduate and undergraduate levels; and/or, a record of extramural funding.

POSITION AVAILABLE: July 1, 2017 with the academic year beginning September 2017. Ph.D. must be conferred by June 30, 2018 for employment beyond this date.

TO APPLY: Applications are accepted via the UCSC Academic Recruit online system and must include: 1) letter of application; 2) curriculum vitae (including a list of publications); 3) research statement; 4) teaching statement; 5) 2 - 3 publications; and 6) 3 confidential letters of reference* Applicants are invited to submit a statement addressing their contribution to diversity through research, teaching, and/or service. Documents/materials must be submitted as PDF files.

Apply at https://recruit.ucsc.edu/apply/JPF00418

Refer to Position #JPF00418-17 in all correspondence.

*All letters will be treated as confidential per University of California policy and California state law. For any reference letter provided via a third party (i.e., dossier service, career center), direct the author to UCSCâs confidentiality statement at http://apo.ucsc.edu/confstm.htm

CLOSING DATE: Review of applications will begin on February 2, 2017. To ensure full consideration, applications should be complete and letters received by this date. The position will remain open until filled, but not later than 6/30/2017.

UC Santa Cruz faculty make significant contributions to the body of research that has earned the University of California the ranking as the foremost public higher education institution in the world. In the process, our faculty demonstrate that cutting-edge research, excellent teaching and outstanding service are mutually supportive.
The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, or protected veteran status. UC Santa Cruz is committed to excellence through diversity and strives to establish a climate that welcomes, celebrates, and promotes respect for the contributions of all students and employees. Inquiries regarding the Universityâs equal employment opportunity policies may be directed to: Office for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at the University of California, Santa Cruz, CA 95064; (831) 459-2686.
Under Federal law, the University of California may employ only individuals who are legally able to work in the United States as established by providing documents as specified in the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986. Certain UCSC positions funded by federal contracts or sub-contracts require the selected candidate to pass an E-Verify check. More information is available here or from the Academic Personnel Office (APO) at (831) 459-4300.
UCSC is a smoke & tobacco-free campus.
If you need accommodation due to a disability, please contact the Academic Personnel Office at apo@ucsc.edu (831) 459-4300.

VISIT THE APO WEB SITE AT: http://apo.ucsc.edu

description:
As a Wet Etch Process Development Engineer within the Sunpower RnD team, you will be responsible for innovating and improving wet etch and wet cleans processing for current and next generation technologies. You will work in all facets of the photovoltaic device processing and integration including process development and optimization. You will team with Equipment Engineering to assess and develop necessary toolsets to achieve this objective. The team will be challenged by new materials, applications,and device architectures.

You will be responsible for establishing robust wet processes and chemistries through rigorous characterization and statistical validation before ramping them into high volume manufacturing. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Primary responsibility is the development and assessment of novel wet processing techniques to meet SunPower solar cell development goals.Investigating and assessing new chemistries for performance and cost of operation.Integration of these new processes to upstream and downstream processing and product requirements.Designing experiments (DOE)Coordinating/executing experiments in the laboratory, at production sites and at vendor sitesAnalyzing and presenting data with recommendationsCommunicating within a development team and with internal project customers Qualifications and Experience: Minimum of Bachelorâs in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, or related fields.

If a candidate has a B.S. or M.S. only, 4/2+ years (respectively) of industrial experience is required.Demonstrated failure analysis work in which the candidate was responsible for choosing the best samples and metrology to quickly identify root cause.Significant experience with semiconductor materials and equipment development2+ yearsâ experience in semiconductor research and development environment preferredExperience with solar processes and integration a plusSolar cell device physics background or equivalent (i.e. semiconductor physics) a plusSelf-starter, comfortable with owning a development projectFlexible, creative problem solver, willing to adapt to unexpected situations to get resultsTeam player, good at working with diverse groupsExcellent communicator, both in presentations and written reports.Willing to travel 10% of the time.

Potential start date: Next couple of weeksWet Etch / semiconductor research and development environment preferred

description:
With more than 60 years of innovation and leadership, FEI enables customers to find meaningful answers to questions that accelerate breakthrough discoveries, increase productivity, and ultimately change the world. FEI designs, manuÂ­factures, and supports the broadest range of high-performance microscopy workflows that provide images and answers in the micro-, nano-, and picometer scales.

Combining hardware and software expertise in electron, ion, and light microscopy with deep application knowledge in the materials science, life sciÂ­ences, electronics, and natural resources markets, the worldwide FEI team of 2,700+ employees is dedicated to customers' pursuit of discovery and resolution to global challenges.

Job Purpose


The Electrical Design Engineer is responsible for the design and integration of control electronics for focused ion and semiconductor diagnostic systems. These products are complex electro-mechanical systems that employ charged particle optics, gas chemistries, lasers and other technologies for sub-micron structural modifications, imaging and device characterization. The system elements under electronic control include: charged particle beam focusing and deflection elements; electron detection, pre-amplifiers and signal processing; process gas delivery; laser scanning microscopes; IR imaging; and precision mechanical positioning systems.

Duties and responsibilities
  • Design, integrate, test, and debug electronic controls (including beam deflection, electron detection, and motion control)
  • Specify and document projects from concept through release to manufacturing
  • Conduct system-level configuration of electronics architectures
  • Debug and troubleshoot existing electronic designs including hands-on debug activities such as noise suppression and grounding schemes
  • Ensure compliance, including electromagnetic compatibility and immunity, for electrical subsystems
  • Design and implement electronic architectures, power, and grounding systems
  • Conduct system level integration for highly-integrated semiconductor capital equipment tools
  • Interface directly with manufacturing for product documentation and vendor interactions that support the production and deployment of new or next-generation systems designs
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
  • University Degree in Electrical Engineering or related discipline. MS EE preferred
  • 10+ years combined board and system level design, debug and deployment
  • wide breadth of experience in design and debug of complex, highly-integrated systems
  • PCB designs from concept through to manufacturing with minimal support infrastructure. Must be proficient in EDA software tool(s), layout is a plus
  • Understanding and experience with low level analog signal processing (pA, uV)
  • Experience with high voltage and vacuum systems
  • Feedback and high precision control systems
  • Particle detection, photodiodes and imaging systems
  • Self-motivated, organized, customer focused with excellent written and communication skills

EEO/AAP

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

description:
The Challenge

To manage the technical service of a solar energy business in order to achieve the objectives as agreed in Sales and Account plans.

The Position

  • Investigate and determine the technical needs of customers and draw up a technical service plan, in cooperation with Sales and Account Management, and according to the Customer Service Level Agreements.
  • Interact with total Solar value chain to represent and introduce DSM and its innovations for the Solar PV market
  • Acting as regional technical representative in assigned regional or global technical activities and projects
  • Organize and support trials for validation of new products or formula changes in customersâ production facilities.
  • Investigate (or support the investigation), resolve and document customer technical complaints.
  • Interpret data and trends related to technical service issues and provide recommendations for improvement.
  • Monitor competitive and customer technical developments, new applications and new products and share this knowledge with the appropriate functions in the BU.
  • Establish a relationship with appropriate equipment vendors in order to have advance knowledge of process improvements, have the BU products approved for use and have the products recommended for commissioning of the equipment.
  • Document actions by compiling technical journals and preparing reports based on these findings.

The Ideal

  • Technical BSc/M in with minimal 5 years of international experience in the technical marketing and sales environment in preferable performance materials.
  • Knowledge of and experience in the Solar Energy industry, preferably in materials.
  • Technical and processing knowledge of BU products.
  • Good communication and social skills.
  • Project Management experience.

Who We Are

A global science-based company active in health, nutrition and materials. By connecting its unique competences in life sciences and materials sciences We are driving economic prosperity, environmental progress and social advances to create sustainable value for all stakeholders simultaneously. We deliver innovative solutions that nourish, protect and improve performance in global markets such as food and dietary supplements, personal care, feed, medical devices, automotive, paints, electrical and electronics, life protection, alternative energy and bio-based materials. We and our associated companies deliver annual net sales of about âŹ10 billion with approximately 25,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.

Working for Us

Working for us means doing something meaningful. We are looking for passionate, dedicated colleagues who are inspired by our Vision: contributing to a better world.

We are a dynamic workplace where great colleagues listen to your thoughts and ideas. We give you room to explore and grow. We value entrepreneurship. We encourage diversity and inclusion. With locations in more than 50 countries worldwide and with approximately 25,000 employees, we may be the right place for your next career journey.

Incumbent must reside in the the following areas: San Francisco Bay Area (Oakland, Berkeley, Richmond, San Francisco, etc.), California

Candidate ideally should have a background as a prior Technical Services Manager.

B.A. or B.S. degree minimum

5+ years experience in Performance or Materials Science (Dupont, 3M, WL Gore, Semi Conductor Industry). Minimum of 2 years experience in Solar. Prefers candidates that have worked for any of the following companies: Sunpower, Dupont, 3M, Sun Eddison, Dunmore, Madico, Applied Materials, First Solar, Intertek, UL.

title: Technical Services Manager

description:
Amprius is a start-up company located in Sunnyvale, California, in the heart of Silicon Valley. Amprius is focused on the application of advanced nano-structured materials for lithium-ion batteries. Using our proprietary silicon anode materials, Ampriusâ mission is to enable a new generation of electric vehicles by radically improving the energy density of Li-ion batteries. If you're passionate about energy, smart, and know how to get things done, we'd like to hear from you.
Amprius is looking for an experienced, creative and highly motivated Battery Scientist to join our Battery Development group.
Job Responsibilities

Conceive, plan, and execute research projects in the areas of electrochemical energy storage systems with limited supervision
Identify & develop advanced battery electrolyte materials and formulations
Study cell level component interactions, such as SEI formation
Evaluate the latest battery components, analyze their performance, and identify degradation mechanisms
Implement & create methods of diagnostic testing for battery characterization
Maintain awareness of the state-of-the-art in technical areas of responsibility, and its relevance/importance to corporate needs. Prepare timely, high-quality internal reports and patent applications
Be an effective member of internal and external project teams in key scientific and technical areas
Qualifications

Extensive knowledge of electrochemical energy storage materials
Extensive knowledge of electrolytes, salts, solvents, and additives
Strong skills in organic and/or inorganic synthesis and characterization
Deep understanding of material-property relationship
Hands-on knowledge of battery and/or other electrochemical energy devices testing and design
Thorough knowledge of underlying mechanisms of battery materials interaction and battery degradation
PhD in Science or Engineering in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or Materials Science
Industrial working experience is a plus
Ability to work both independently and in teams
Good oral and written English language skills
Good problem solving capability
Interpersonal traits to work effectively with others

To Apply

Please send resume and short cover letter (2 pdfs) on your interests in energy storage and your organizational style.
